      44             : /*
      45             : Macro to test whether the current token is a Microsoft storage class
      46             : specifier.  Includes an "||" at the beginning.
      47             : */
      48             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
      49             : #define or_is_microsoft_storage_class() ||                            \
      50             :   (curr_token == tok_declspec ||                                      \
      51             :    curr_token == tok_microsoft_inline ||                              \
      52             :    curr_token == tok_forceinline)
      53             : #else /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
      54             : #define or_is_microsoft_storage_class() /* Nothing */
      55             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
      56             : 
      57             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
      58             : #define is_inline_token()                                            \
      59             :   (curr_token == tok_inline || curr_token == tok_microsoft_inline )
      60             : #else /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
      61             : #define is_inline_token() (curr_token == tok_inline)
      62             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
      63             : 
      64             : /*
      65             : Macro to test for "__thread", "thread_local", or "_Thread_local" storage
      66             : specifier.

      68             : #if THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED
      69             : #define or_is_thread_local_storage_specifier() ||                     \
      70             :   ((curr_token == tok_thread_local) ||                                \
      71             :    (curr_token == tok_c11_thread_local) ||                            \
      72             :    (curr_token == tok_thread))
      73             : #else /* !THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED */
      74             : #define or_is_thread_local_storage_specifier() ||                     \
      75             :   ((curr_token == tok_thread_local) ||                                \
      76             :    (curr_token == tok_c11_thread_local))
      77             : #endif /* THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED */
      78             : 
      79             : /*
      80             : Macro that is TRUE if the current token is the start of a storage class
      81             : specifier.
      82             : */
      83             : #define is_storage_class()                                            \
      84             :   (curr_token == tok_typedef  || curr_token == tok_extern   ||        \
      85             :    curr_token == tok_static   || curr_token == tok_mutable  ||        \
      86             :    curr_token == tok_register ||                                      \
      87             :    (auto_storage_class_specifier_enabled && curr_token == tok_auto)   \
      88             :    or_is_thread_local_storage_specifier()                             \

     385       15630 : void add_end_of_parse_action(a_decl_parse_callback_function  *fn,
     386             :                              a_decl_parse_state              *dps,
     387             :                              a_boolean                       secondary_decls)
     388             : /*
     389             : Allocate an entry to call back the given function with the given parse state,
     390             : and add it to the actions to be performed at the end of the declaration
     391             : described by dps.  If secondary_decls is TRUE, the action should also be
     392             : performed for declarations associated with subsequent secondary declarators.
     393             : */
     394             : {
     395       15630 :   a_decl_parse_callback_ptr  entry;

     405             :   }  /* if */

     407       15630 :   entry->apply_to_secondary_declarators = secondary_decls;
     408       15630 :   entry->next = dps->end_of_parse_actions;
     409       15630 :   dps->end_of_parse_actions = entry;
     410       15630 : }  /* add_end_of_parse_action */
     411             : 
     412             : 
     413     4531540 : void run_end_of_parse_actions(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
     414             :                               a_boolean           more_declarators)
     415             : /*
     416             : Execute the end-of-parse callbacks registered for the declaration described by
     417             : *dps, and, if appropriate, free up the associated callback entries.
     418             : more_declarators is TRUE if secondary declarators will follow (in which case
     419             : some associated callback entries should not be freed).
     420             : */
     421             : {
     422     4531540 :   a_decl_parse_callback_ptr  actions = dps->end_of_parse_actions, *p_action;
     423             : 
     424             :   /* Clear dps->end_of_parse_actions.  The execution of the actions could
     425             :      conceivably add more actions, but that is currently prohibited. */

     427     4546950 :   for (p_action = &actions; *p_action != NULL;) {
     428       15411 :     a_decl_parse_callback_ptr       action = *p_action;
     429       15411 :     a_decl_parse_callback_function  *callback = action->callback_fn;
     430       15411 :     if (!more_declarators || !action->apply_to_secondary_declarators) {
     431             :       /* Remove this action from the list and free it up for reuse. */
     432       15411 :       *p_action = action->next;
     433       15411 :       action->next = avail_decl_parse_callbacks;
     434       15411 :       action->callback_fn = NULL;
     435       15411 :       avail_decl_parse_callbacks = action;
     436             :     } else {
     437             :       /* Leave the current action in the list for subsequent declarators, and
     438             :          move to the next action. */
     439           0 :       p_action = &action->next;

     441             :     /* Execute the action. */
     442       15411 :     callback(dps);
     443             :   }  /* for */
     444             :   /* End-of-parse actions are currently not allowed to generate more actions
     445             :      for the same declaration. */

     763             : static void deactivate_gnu_decl_attributes_on_template_redecl(
     764             :                                         a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
     765             :                                         an_attribute_ptr    prev_attributes)
     766             : /*
     767             : Mark all the id attributes and prefix attributes of the declaration described
     768             : by dps as "unrecognized", thereby deactivating any effects those attributes
     769             : might otherwise have had.  Issue a warning if there is such an attribute and
     770             : an attribute of the same kind did not appear on the list pointed to by

     772             : of the template was seen; NULL if none).

     775             :   an_attribute_ptr  ap, diag_ap = NULL;

     778             :     if (is_gcc_attribute(ap)) {

     782             :            original template declaration. */

     785             :       make_attr_unrecognized(ap);

     851     1240430 : void scan_gnu_asm_name(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
     852             : /*
     853             : Scan a construct of the form
     854             :     asm ( "string" )
     855             : and record the contents and position of the string literal in *dps.  This is a
     856             : GNU extension that provides the name to be used for an entity in generated
     857             : assembler code.
     858             : */
     859             : {
     860     1240430 :   if (gnu_mode && curr_token == tok_asm) {
     861        1111 :     a_const_char       *asm_name = NULL;
     862        1111 :     a_source_position  asm_start_pos, asm_name_pos = null_source_position;
     863        1111 :     asm_start_pos = pos_curr_token;
     864        1111 :     report_gnu_extension_if_needed(&pos_curr_token,
     865        1111 :                                    ec_asm_name_is_gnu_extension);
     866             :     /* Bypass "asm" and the leading paren. */
     867        1111 :     (void)get_token();
     868        1111 :     if (required_token(tok_lparen, ec_exp_lparen)) {
     869        1111 :       add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
     870             :       /* The next token must be a string constant.  If it isn't, flush and
     871             :          then consume any right paren to avoid double errors. */
     872        1111 :       if (curr_token != tok_string_literal) {
     873           0 :         syntax_error(ec_exp_string_literal);
     874           0 :         if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
     875           0 :           (void)get_token();
     876             :         }  /* if */
     877             :       } else {
     878             :         /* If there was an error in parsing the string, we do not need to
     879             :            issue another error here. */
     880        1111 :         if (!is_error_constant(&const_for_curr_token)) {

     882             :              "ab\0c") but ignores everything after the "\0".  So, storing the
     883             :              asm argument as a character pointer, without a length, gives
     884             :              compatibility with GCC. */
     885        1111 :           asm_name = const_for_curr_token.variant.string.value;
     886        1111 :           asm_name_pos = pos_curr_token;
     887             :         }  /* if */
     888             :         /* Consume the string constant. */
     889        1111 :         (void)get_token();

     891        1111 :         (void)required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen);
     892             :       }  /* if */
     893        1111 :       remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);

     916             : 
     917     5841260 : a_symbol_ptr curr_type_symbol(a_boolean is_new_type_name,
     918             :                               a_boolean in_prescan,
     919             :                               a_boolean in_type_check,
     920             :                               a_boolean is_sizeof_context)
     921             : /*
     922             : If the current token is an identifier or, in C++, the "::" at the start of a
     923             : global qualified name, and if it starts the name of a type (a typedef name or,
     924             : in C++, the name of a class, struct, union, or enum), return a pointer to
     925             : the symbol.  Otherwise, return NULL.  Ambiguity and access control checking
     926             : is not done.  in_prescan is TRUE when we are called from the prescanning
     927             : routines used for disambiguation.  This flag suppresses errors that
     928             : might result from class template names that are missing argument lists.
     929             : in_type_check is used when this routine is called directly or indirectly
     930             : from places such as is_type_start.  is_sizeof_context is TRUE if this
     931             : is called indirectly from scan_sizeof_operator and the name being scanned
     932             : should not be treated as a type for dependent name purposes.

     939     5841260 :   assoc_symbol = NULL;

    1110     1711790 : a_boolean is_decl_start(an_is_decl_start_options_set options)

    1112             : Return TRUE if the current token looks like the start of a declaration,
    1113             : i.e., it is the start of a type-specifier, a type-qualifier, or a
    1114             : storage-class-specifier.  Note that this does not cover the start of

    1251           0 : a_boolean f_check_for_overload_anachronism(void)
    1252             : /*

    1254             : the tokens that follow.  If a declaration is of the format "overload f;" (or

    1325     3164140 : void adjust_parameter_type(a_type_ptr  *type_ptr)
    1326             : /*
    1327             : *type_ptr points to the type of a parameter.  Modify the type if
    1328             : necessary.  See 3.7.1:  A declaration of a parameter as "array of
    1329             : type" shall be adjusted to "pointer to type", and the declaration of
    1330             : a parameter as "function returning type" shall be adjusted to
    1331             : "pointer to function returning type", as in 3.2.2.1.
    1332             : */
    1333             : {
    1334     3164140 :   db_enter(4, "adjust_parameter_type");
    1335             :   /* Note that incomplete types are allowed.  One can't call a function
    1336             :      that has an incomplete-type parameter, but one can complete it later. */
    1337     3164140 :   if (is_array_type(*type_ptr)) {
    1338             :     /* Array, adjust to pointer to element type. */
    1339       11074 :     a_type_qualifier_set  qualifiers =

    1345           0 :       *type_ptr = make_qualified_type(*type_ptr, qualifiers);

    1504             : 
    1505      290507 : void check_operator_function_params(a_type_ptr        rout_type,
    1506             :                                     a_type_ptr        class_type,
    1507             :                                     a_symbol_locator  *locator)
    1508             : /*
    1509             : Check the argument list on the declaration of a user-defined conversion
    1510             : or overloaded operator function.  For member function (and member function
    1511             : template) declarations, class_type indicates the enclosing class.
    1512             : The rules for standard C++ are as follows.  For conversion functions, no
    1513             : arguments are allowed.  For operators there are different requirements for
    1514             : different operator kinds.  Issue a diagnostic if an error is found.
    1515             : In C++/CLI mode, additional possibilities exist: Member operators can be
    1516             : static member functions, and parameter types can be handles or tracking
    1517             : references.
    1518             : If this routine is modified to use additional fields from the locator
    1519             : make_template_function needs to be updated to make sure that the
    1520             : new fields are set properly.
    1521             : */
    1522             : {
    1523      290507 :   an_opname_kind                 opname;
    1524      290507 :   int                            param_count;

    1528      290507 :   a_type_ptr                     tp;
    1529      290507 :   a_boolean                      is_nonstatic_member_function;
    1530      290507 :   an_error_code                  error_code = ec_no_error;
    1531      290507 :   a_boolean                      err = FALSE;

    1878      247378 : static void report_bad_new_or_delete(a_symbol_locator    *locator,

    1950           0 : static a_boolean compare_exception_specification_type_list(
    1951             :                               an_exception_specification_ptr  spec_1,
    1952             :                               an_exception_specification_ptr  spec_2,
    1953             :                               a_source_position_ptr           throw_pos,
    1954             :                               a_diagnostic_ptr                *dp,
    1955             :                               an_error_code                   diff_msg,
    1956             :                               an_error_code                   intro_msg,
    1957             :                               a_symbol_ptr                    prev_sym,
    1958             :                               a_boolean                       difference_seen)
    1959             : /*
    1960             : Helper function to report differences between two exception specifications
    1961             : spec_1 and spec_2.  Normally this routine is called twice with the arguments
    1962             : for spec_1 and spec_2 exchanged and diff_msg set to an error message that
    1963             : reports missing or extraneous types.  If a diagnostic is started, *dp is
    1964             : set to that diagnostic entry.  The position of the keyword "throw" that
    1965             : introduced the latest declaration is throw_pos.  The earlier declaration
    1966             : resulted in symbol prev_sym.
    1967             : If difference_seen is FALSE and a difference is seen in this comparison, an
    1968             : introductory message is issued, and difference_seen is set to TRUE.
    1969             : The routine returns difference_seen.
    1970             : */
    1971             : {
    1972           0 :   an_exception_specification_type_ptr  etype_1, etype_2;
    1973             : 
    1974           0 :   if (spec_1->is_noexcept) {
    1975             :     etype_1 = NULL;
    1976             :   } else {
    1977           0 :     etype_1 = spec_1->variant.exception_specification_type_list;
    1978             :   }  /* if */
    1979           0 :   for (; etype_1 != NULL; etype_1 = etype_1->next) {
    1980           0 :     if (etype_1->redundant) {
    1981             :       /* Don't bother looking for a match on redundant types.  It will already
    1982             :          have been done. */
    1983             :     } else {
    1984           0 :       a_boolean  match = FALSE;
    1985           0 :       if (spec_2->is_noexcept) {
    1986             :         etype_2 = NULL;
    1987             :       } else {
    1988           0 :         etype_2 = spec_2->variant.exception_specification_type_list;
    1989             :       }  /* if */
    1990           0 :       for (; etype_2 != NULL; etype_2 = etype_2->next) {
    1991           0 :         if (!etype_2->redundant && etype_2->type != NULL &&
    1992           0 :             identical_types(etype_1->type, etype_2->type)) {
    1993             :           /* An entry of the same type was found on the list of spec_2. */
    1994             :           match = TRUE;
    1995             :           break;
    1996             :         }  /* if */
    1997             :       }  /* for */
    1998           0 :       if (!match) {
    1999             :         /* No match was found, so the list of spec_2 does not have a type that
    2000             :            is on the list of spec_1. */
    2001           0 :         if (!difference_seen) {
    2002             :           /* The diagnostics will be combined with a header message followed
    2003             :              by additional messages identifying the specific discrepancy.
    2004             :              This is the first diagnostic, so put out the header message
    2005             :              first. */
    2006           0 :           *dp = pos_stsy_start_error(intro_msg, throw_pos, ":", prev_sym);

    2055       66527 : void check_exception_specification(a_type_ptr         new_rout_type,

    2476      879193 : a_symbol_ptr enter_local_symbol(a_symbol_kind    kind,
    2477             :                                 a_symbol_locator *locator,
    2478             :                                 a_scope_depth    scope_level,
    2479             :                                 a_boolean        suppress_redecl_error)
    2480             : /*
    2481             : Enter a symbol declarative scope specified by scope_level.  kind indicates

    2499             :     } else {

    2526             : typedef struct an_id_linkage_block {
    2527             :   a_symbol_locator
    2528             :                 *locator;
    2529             :                         /* Locator associated with the current variable,
    2530             :                            routine, or function template declaration. */
    2531             :   a_symbol_ptr  linked_symbol;
    2532             :                         /* A symbol apparently representing a prior
    2533             :                            declaration of the entity currently being
    2534             :                            declared. */
    2535             :   a_symbol_ptr  homonym_symbol;
    2536             :                         /* If linked_symbol is NULL, another declaration
    2537             :                            with the same name and belonging to the same
    2538             :                            scope; otherwise, if linked_symbol is a newly
    2539             :                            created symbol representing a function template
    2540             :                            instance that is a guiding declaration,
    2541             :                            homomyn_symbol may point to the symbol for the
    2542             :                            template, with which the guiding-declaration symbol
    2543             :                            will be overloaded; otherwise, homonym_symbol is
    2544             :                            always NULL when linked_symbol in non-NULL.  (C++
    2545             :                            only, and used only with function declarations.) */
    2546             :   a_symbol_ptr  prior_decl_in_enclosing_scope;
    2547             :                         /* If the current declaration is a block-extern or
    2548             :                            friend declaration, a prior declaration in an
    2549             :                            enclosing scope (used to determine linkage);
    2550             :                            otherwise NULL. */
    2551             :   a_symbol_ptr  overload_symbol;
    2552             :                         /* A symbol representing the overload set to which
    2553             :                            the current declaration already belongs or will
    2554             :                            belong.  Specifically, if linked_symbol or
    2555             :                            homonym_symbol is non-NULL and is an overload-set
    2556             :                            member, it is the associated sk_overloaded_function
    2557             :                            symbol.  If homonym_symbol is itself an overload
    2558             :                            symbol, a pointer to the same symbol.  It is
    2559             :                            always NULL when both linked_symbol and
    2560             :                            homonym_symbol are NULL.  (C++ only, and used only
    2561             :                            with function declarations.) */
    2562             :   a_scope_depth
    2563             :                 effective_decl_level;
    2564             :                         /* The effective scope depth of the declaration.  It
    2565             :                            is usually the same as decl_scope_level, except
    2566             :                            in the case of friend declarations and certain
    2567             :                            template declarations. */
    2568             :   a_storage_class
    2569             :                 storage_class;
    2570             :                         /* On entry to id_linkage, the storage class
    2571             :                            explicitly specified in the declaration.  May be
    2572             :                            replaced in id_linkage by a setting corresponding
    2573             :                            to the linkage. */
    2574             :   a_func_info_block
    2575             :                 *func_info;
    2576             :                         /* Pointer to a func_info block for the declaration.
    2577             :                            NULL for variable declarations. */
    2578             :   a_type_ptr    type;
    2579             :                         /* The type with which the entity was declared. */
    2580             :   a_bit_field   is_friend_decl:1;
    2581             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration is a friend
    2582             :                            declaration. */
    2583             :   a_bit_field   is_function_template:1;
    2584             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration is a function template
    2585             :                            declaration. */
    2586             :   a_bit_field   is_new_template_instance:1;
    2587             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration matches a function
    2588             :                            template instance that is newly created by the
    2589             :                            declaration. */
    2590             :   a_bit_field   is_definition:1;
    2591             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration is a definition. */
    2592             :   a_bit_field   is_block_extern_decl:1;
    2593             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration is a block extern
    2594             :                            declaration (a declaration within a function of
    2595             :                            an entity with linkage outside the function). */
    2596             :   a_bit_field   is_local_class_friend_decl:1;
    2597             :                         /* TRUE when is_friend_decl is TRUE and the class in
    2598             :                            which the declaration appears is a local class. */
    2599             :   a_bit_field   within_unnamed_namespace:1;
    2600             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration appears within an
    2601             :                            unnamed namespace. */
    2602             :   a_bit_field   extern_C_name_linkage_specified:1;
    2603             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration appears within the
    2604             :                            context of an extern "C" linkage specification. */
    2605             :   a_bit_field   direct_linkage_specifier:1;
    2606             :                         /* If TRUE, a linkage specification appeared directly
    2607             :                            on the declaration (as opposed to the declaration
    2608             :                            just being in a linkage specification block). */
    2609             :   a_bit_field   namespace_reactivated:1;
    2610             :                         /* TRUE if a namespace reactivation scope was
    2611             :                            pushed during linkage processing; it must be
    2612             :                            popped by the caller. */
    2613             :   a_bit_field   from_inline_namespace:1;
    2614             :                         /* TRUE if the symbol found is a projection symbol
    2615             :                            for a symbol made visible by an inline namespace. */
    2616             :   a_bit_field   c_overload:1;
    2617             :                         /* TRUE if the symbol found is an overloaded C
    2618             :                            function (possible through the Clang "overloadable"
    2619             :                            attribute. */
    2620             :   a_template_decl_info_ptr
    2621             :                 templ_info;
    2622             :                         /* When is_function_template is TRUE, a pointer to
    2623             :                            the associated template declaration information.
    2624             :                            (Particularly, information about the parameter
    2625             :                            list.) */
    2626             :   an_id_linkage_kind
    2627             :                 linkage;
    2628             :                         /* The linkage (none, internal, external) computed
    2629             :                            for the current declaration. */
    2630             :   a_name_linkage_kind
    2631             :                 name_linkage;
    2632             :                         /* The name linkage for the current declaration. */
    2633             :   a_byte_boolean
    2634             :                 name_linkage_is_explicit;
    2635             :                         /* TRUE if the name linkage for the current
    2636             :                            declaration was explicitly specified. */
    2637             :   a_byte_boolean
    2638             :                 suppress_qualified_name_redecl_error;
    2639             :                         /* TRUE if qualified_name_redecl_sym should suppress
    2640             :                            an error if the lookup fails. */
    2641             : } an_id_linkage_block;
    2642             : 
    2643             : #if NULL_POINTER_IS_ZERO
    2644             : 
    2645             : #define clear_id_linkage_block(idlbp)                                        \
    2646             :   (memzero((char*)(idlbp), sizeof(an_id_linkage_block)))
    2647             : 
    2648             : #else /* !NULL_POINTER_IS_ZERO */
    2649             : 
    2650             : static void clear_id_linkage_block(an_id_linkage_block *idlbp)
    2651             : /*
    2652             : Clear the fields of the given id linkage block.
    2653             : */
    2654             : {
    2655             :   idlbp->locator = NULL;
    2656             :   idlbp->homonym_symbol = NULL;
    2657             :   idlbp->prior_decl_in_enclosing_scope = NULL;
    2658             :   idlbp->linked_symbol = NULL;
    2659             :   idlbp->overload_symbol = NULL;
    2660             :   idlbp->effective_decl_level = NO_SCOPE_DEPTH;
    2661             :   idlbp->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
    2662             :   idlbp->func_info = NULL;
    2663             :   idlbp->type = NULL;
    2664             :   idlbp->is_friend_decl = FALSE;
    2665             :   idlbp->is_function_template = FALSE;
    2666             :   idlbp->is_new_template_instance = FALSE;
    2667             :   idlbp->is_definition = FALSE;
    2668             :   idlbp->is_block_extern_decl = FALSE;
    2669             :   idlbp->is_local_class_friend_decl = FALSE;
    2670             :   idlbp->within_unnamed_namespace = FALSE;
    2671             :   idlbp->extern_C_name_linkage_specified = FALSE;
    2672             :   idlbp->direct_linkage_specifier = FALSE;
    2673             :   idlbp->namespace_reactivated = FALSE;
    2674             :   idlbp->from_inline_namespace = FALSE;
    2675             :   idlbp->c_overload = FALSE;
    2676             :   idlbp->templ_info = NULL;
    2677             :   idlbp->linkage = idl_none;
    2678             :   idlbp->name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none;
    2679             :   idlbp->name_linkage_is_explicit = FALSE;
    2680             :   idlbp->suppress_qualified_name_redecl_error = FALSE;
    2681             : }  /* clear_id_linkage_block */
    2682             : 
    2683             : #endif /* NULL_POINTER_IS_ZERO */
    2684             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2685             : 
    2686             : static a_boolean for_init_declaration_uses_standard_scope(
    2687             :                                                   an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp,
    2688             :                                                   a_scope_depth        depth)
    2689             : /*
    2690             : A declaration with the properties described in *idlbp appeared in a for-init
    2691             : construct in a Microsoft mode that determines the scoping of for-init variable
    2692             : based on its type or the type of a synonym in the surrounding scope.  depth is
    2693             : the depth of the standard for-init scope within the current scope stack.
    2694             : Return whether or not the for-init variable should use the standard for-init
    2695             : scope.
    2696             : */
    2697             : {
    2698             :   a_boolean   result = FALSE;
    2699             :   a_type_ptr  type;
    2700             :   a_scope_depth  saved_decl_scope_level = decl_scope_level;
    2701             :   a_symbol_ptr   sym;
    2702             : 
    2703             :   check_assertion(microsoft_mode && microsoft_type_dependent_for_init_scope);
    2704             :   /* Look for an existing declaration in the scope in which the for-statement
    2705             :      appears. */
    2706             :   decl_scope_level = depth-1;
    2707             :   sym = curr_scope_id_lookup(idlbp->locator, IDL_NO_OPTIONS);
    2708             :   decl_scope_level = saved_decl_scope_level;
    2709             :   /* Check that no synonym declaration exists in that nonstandard scope
    2710             :      (except for other nonstandard for-init variables). */
    2711             :   if (sym != NULL && sym->decl_scope == scope_stack[depth-1].number) {
    2712             :     /* There already is a declaration of the same name in the scope enclosing
    2713             :        the for-statement. */
    2714             :     if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable &&
    2715             :         sym->variant.variable.declared_in_for_init) {
    2716             :       /* The existing declaration is also a for-init variable: Hide it. */
    2717             :       sym->is_invisible = TRUE;
    2718             :     } else {
    2719             :       /* The existing declaration is not a for-init variable: Use the standard
    2720             :          scope for the current variable. */
    2721             :       result = TRUE;
    2722             :     }  /* if */
    2723             :   }  /* if */
    2724             :   if (!result) {
    2725             :     /* If the current declaration has a class type with a destructor, use the
    2726             :        standard scope. */
    2727             :     type = skip_typerefs(idlbp->type);
    2728             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(type)) {
    2729             :       a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(type);
    2730             :       if (cssp != NULL && cssp->destructor != NULL) {
    2731             :         /* The for-init variable has a class type with a destructor: Use the
    2732             :            standard scope. */
    2733             :         result = TRUE;
    2734             :       }  /* if */
    2735             :     }  /* if */
    2736             :   }  /* if */
    2737             :   return result;
    2738             : }  /* for_init_declaration_uses_standard_scope */
    2739             : 
    2740             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2741             : 
    2742     1141970 : static void compute_effective_decl_level(an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp,
    2743             :                                          a_scope_depth        depth)
    2744             : /*
    2745             : A name is being declared, and the "effective declaration level" identifies
    2746             : the scope into which the newly declared symbol will be entered.  Usually
    2747             : this is exactly the same as the current declaration scope, as indicated by
    2748             : decl_scope_level.  This routine checks for some special cases and returns
    2749             : the appropriate scope depth.  (The normal case is that the effective
    2750             : declaration level is the same as decl_scope_level, which in turn is usually
    2751             : the same as depth_scope_stack).
    2752             : */
    2753             : {
    2754     1141970 :   db_enter(4, "compute_effective_decl_level");
    2755     1141970 :   if (C_mode()) {
    2756      887328 :     if (idlbp->is_block_extern_decl) {
    2757          10 :       if (C_dialect == C_dialect_pcc &&
    2758           0 :           (idlbp->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_extern ||
    2759           0 :            idlbp->func_info != NULL)) {
    2760             :         /* In pcc mode, functions and extern variables are always effectively
    2761             :            declared at the file scope level. */
    2762             :         depth = DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE;
    2763          10 :       } else if (idlbp->func_info != NULL &&
    2764          10 :                  idlbp->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
    2765             :         /* In C mode, as an extension, "static" is accepted on function
    2766             :            declarations at function scope.  Such declarations are promoted
    2767             :            to file scope. */
    2768           0 :         depth = DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE;
    2769             :       }  /* if */
    2770             :     }  /* if */
    2771      254645 :   } else if (idlbp->is_friend_decl) {
    2772             :     /* Make the appropriate adjustment for a friend declaration.  The
    2773             :        The "effective declaration level" of a friend function declaration is 
    2774             :        usually the innermost non-class scope.  Starting from the specified
    2775             :        scope depth, find the depth of the containing non-class scope. */
    2776         460 :     a_scope_kind  kind = scope_stack[depth].kind;
    2777         580 :     while (kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union ||
    2778             :            kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_reactivation) {
    2779         492 :       depth--;
    2780         492 :       kind = scope_stack[depth].kind;
    2781         492 :       if (kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_template_instantiation) {
    2782         372 :         if (scope_stack[depth].in_prototype_instantiation ||
    2783             :             scope_stack[depth].in_nonreal_instantiation) {
    2784             :           /* During prototype instantiation, use the instantiation scope
    2785             :              as the effective declaration scope. */
    2786             :         } else {
    2787         264 :           depth = depth_innermost_namespace_scope;
    2788             :         }  /* if */
    2789             :         break;
    2790         120 :       } else if (kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_instantiation_context) {
    2791             :         /* An instantiation context scope without an intervening instantiation
    2792             :            scope.  This can occur when get_definition_of_class is being
    2793             :            used. */
    2794           0 :         depth = depth_innermost_namespace_scope;
    2795           0 :         break;
    2796         120 :       } else if (kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_template_declaration) {
    2797             :         /* Must be an error of some sort. */
    2798           0 :         depth = depth_innermost_namespace_scope;
    2799           0 :         break;
    2800             :       }  /* if */
    2801             :     }  /* while */
    2802             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2803             :   } else if (microsoft_type_dependent_for_init_scope &&
    2804             :              scope_stack[depth].is_for_init_block &&
    2805             :              !for_init_declaration_uses_standard_scope(idlbp, depth)) {
    2806             :     /* The scoping of for-init variables in MSVC++ 7.1 depends on the type of
    2807             :        that variable and on the kind of declaration that might be hidden in the
    2808             :        nonstandard scope.  The call to for_init_declaration_uses_standard_scope
    2809             :        may cause a previous for-init declaration to become invisible. */
    2810             :     --depth;
    2811             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2812             :   }  /* if */
    2813     1141970 :   idlbp->effective_decl_level = depth;
    2814     1141970 :   db_exit();
    2815     1141970 : }  /* compute_effective_decl_level */
    2816             : 
    2817             : 
    2818             : static a_boolean namespace_extension_is_for_instantiation(
    2819             :                                                 a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep)
    2820             : /*
    2821             : Return TRUE if the given namespace extension scope stack entry sits on top of
    2822             : an instantiation context (possibly with intervening namespace extensions).

    2831             : 
    2832             : 
    2833           0 : static a_scope_depth get_effective_depth_innermost_namespace(void)
    2834             : /*
    2835             : Return the "effective" innermost namespace scope depth.  Usually, this is just
    2836             : depth_innermost_namespace_scope.  In (pre-4.6.0) GNU C++ modes, however,
    2837             : namespace extensions that are implicitly pushed on the scope stack as part of a
    2838             : class or namespace reactivation are ignored (but reactivations for
    2839             : instantiations are treated as "explicit" in this context).  This is used to
    2840             : emulate GCC's behavior wrt. certain block extern declarations.  For example:
    2841             :       namespace N { struct S { void f(); }; }
    2842             :       void N::S::f() {
    2843             :         void g();  // ::g in pre-4.6.0 g++ mode, N::g otherwise.

    2854             :     }  /* while */
    2855             :   }  /* if */
    2856           0 :   return depth;

    2934     1134320 : static void compute_name_linkage(an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp)
    2935             : /*
    2936             : Based on the current state of the indicated id-linkage block, set the
    2937             : fields describing the name-linkage for the current declaration.  This
    2938             : routine can be called more than once for a given declaration (e.g., when
    2939             : an entity initially declared with external linkage is redeclared to have
    2940             : internal linkage).
    2941             : */
    2942             : {
    2943     1134320 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
    2944     1134320 :   a_symbol_ptr             prior_decl;
    2945     1134320 :   a_source_correspondence  *scp;
    2946             : 
    2947     1134320 :   idlbp->name_linkage_is_explicit = FALSE;

    2955      885374 :       if (idlbp->c_overload) {

    2957             :       } else {

    2959             :       }  /* if */
    2960      247641 :     } else if (idlbp->func_info != NULL &&
    2961             :                idlbp->func_info->is_main_function) {

    3003      233757 :       if (prior_decl != NULL &&

    3031             : 
    3032             : static a_boolean is_overloadable_c_sym(a_symbol_ptr         sym,
    3033             :                                        an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp)
    3034             : /*
    3035             : Return TRUE if the given symbol or the current declaration is declared with
    3036             : the Clang attribute "overloadable".  If the given symbol is an overload set,
    3037             : also return TRUE (at least one of the constituent functions will necessarily
    3038             : have been declared with "overloadable" also).  Only called in Clang C mode.
    3039             : E.g.:
    3040             :   __attribute((overloadable)) void f(int);
    3041             :   __attribute((overloadable)) void f(double);
    3042             : Here, this function will be called for the second declaration with sym
    3043             : describing the previous declaration (if there were more than one, sym would
    3044             : represent an overload set).
    3045             : */
    3046             : {
    3047             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    3048             : 
    3049             :   check_assertion(clang_mode && C_mode());

    3051             :     /* We already overloaded this function name. */
    3052             :     result = TRUE;
    3053             :   } else if (idlbp->c_overload) {
    3054             :     /* The "overloadable" attribute is specified on the new declaration. */
    3055             :     result = TRUE;
    3056             :   } else if (symbol_is(sym, sk_routine)) {
    3057             :     a_routine_ptr     rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;

    3061             :       result = TRUE;

    3063             :   }  /* if */

    3066             : 
    3067             : 
    3068     1134310 : static void find_linked_symbol(an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp)
    3069             : /*
    3070             : Find and return a symbol idlbp->linked_symbol representing the potential prior
    3071             : declaration of the variable, routine, or function template declaration
    3072             : described by *idlbp.  Two distinct cases are handled here:
    3073             :   -- redeclaration in the same scope:
    3074             :         void f();
    3075             :         void f() { }        // the other "f" is returned as linked symbol
    3076             :         static int i;
    3077             :         extern int i;       // the other "i" is returned as linked symbol
    3078             :   -- friend declaration (C++ only):
    3079             :         void g();
    3080             :         class A {
    3081             :           friend g();       // the other "g" is returned as linked symbol
    3082             :         };
    3083             : 
    3084             : It also returns other sorts of symbols:
    3085             : (1) idlbp->prior_decl_in_enclosing_scope is a visible linked declaration in a
    3086             : prior scope.  For example, with a block extern declaration:
    3087             :         int j;
    3088             :         void f() {
    3089             :           extern int j;     // No linked symbol but the other "j" is returned
    3090             :         }                   // via idlbp->prior_decl_in_enclosing_scope.
    3091             : (Note, however, that this is only the case for "visible" prior declarations.
    3092             : E.g.,
    3093             :         static int k;
    3094             :         void f() {
    3095             :           int k;            // ::k is no longer visible
    3096             :           { extern int k; } // idlbp->prior_decl_in_enclosing_scope is NULL.
    3097             :         }
    3098             : This behavior affects how id_linkage determines the linkage of block-extern
    3099             : declared k; the latter gets external linkage, which results in a linkage
    3100             : conflict that is reported in strict mode.)
    3101             : 
    3102             : (2) In C++ only, for function and function template declarations,
    3103             : idlbp->overload_symbol is returned when a name match was found with another
    3104             : function or function template declaration, whether or not a type match was
    3105             : also found. For instance,
    3106             :   -- redeclaration in the same scope:
    3107             :        void f(int);
    3108             :        void f(int,int);  // idlbp->prior_decl_in_enclosing_scope and
    3109             :                          // idlbp->linked_symbol are both NULL, but "f(int)"
    3110             :                          // is returned via idlbp->overload_symbol.
    3111             :   -- friend declaration:
    3112             :        void f(int);
    3113             :        class A {
    3114             :          friend f(int,int);  // ditto.
    3115             :        };
    3116             :   -- block extern
    3117             :        void f(int);
    3118             :        void g() {
    3119             :          extern f(int,int);  // ditto.
    3120             :        }
    3121             : 
    3122             : Besides the type, required for function matching in C++, and the locator, the
    3123             : input parameters include idlbp->effective_decl_level, the scope at which the
    3124             : entity is to be entered into the symbol table, and idlbp->is_friend_decl, TRUE
    3125             : when the declaration is a friend declaration within a class.
    3126             : */
    3127             : {
    3128     1134310 :   a_boolean     decls_at_same_scope;
    3129     1134310 :   a_boolean     is_list;
    3130     1134310 :   a_symbol_ptr  other_decl, other_decl_saved;
    3131     1134310 :   a_symbol_kind kind = (a_symbol_kind)sk_last;
    3132     1134310 :   a_boolean     function_template_seen = FALSE;
    3133     1134310 :   a_boolean     is_function = is_function_type(idlbp->type);
    3134     1134310 :   a_boolean     is_namespace_member_def = FALSE;
    3135     1134310 :   a_symbol_locator  *locator = idlbp->locator;
    3136     1134310 :   a_boolean     is_guiding_decl = FALSE;
    3137             : 
    3138     1134310 :   db_enter(3, "find_linked_symbol");

    3410             :           }  /* if */
    3411          16 :           if (symbol_is(fund_other_decl, sk_function_template)) {
    3412             :             /* Look for a match on the list of instantiations. */

    3531             : static a_boolean has_linkage_within_innermost_namespace_scope(a_symbol *sym)
    3532             : /*
    3533             : Given the symbol *sym representing a declaration found by find_linked_symbol,
    3534             : this function returns TRUE if that prior symbol's linkage should be applied

    3561             : static void id_linkage(an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp,
    3562             :                        a_decl_parse_state   *dps)
    3563             : /*
    3564             : Determine the linkage (internal, external, or none) of the current variable,
    3565             : routine, or function template declaration (described by *dps).  Find previous
    3566             : declarations with the same name that may affect the linkage.  Return the
    3567             : information in the specified id-linkage block.

    3569             : {

    3803           0 : static a_boolean incompatible_types_are_SVR4_compatible(a_type_ptr  tp1,
    3804             :                                                         a_type_ptr  tp2)
    3805             : /*
    3806             : tp1 and tp2 are types that have already been determined to be incompatible.
    3807             : However, we are in SVR4-C mode and the compatibility rules are relaxed in some
    3808             : cases.  Return TRUE if the two types are compatible by these relaxed rules.
    3809             : */
    3810             : {
    3811           0 :   a_boolean   compat = FALSE;
    3812           0 :   a_type_ptr  ret1;
    3813           0 :   a_type_ptr  ret2;
    3814             : 
    3815           0 :   check_assertion(SVR4_C_mode);
    3816           0 :   if (is_function_type(tp1)) {
    3817             :     /* Two function types.  In SVR4 mode if they are incompatible solely
    3818             :        because of their return types, and if the return types are "close
    3819             :        enough", then consider the routine types themselves to be compatible.
    3820             :        Further, if the return types are "close enough" and one type has a
    3821             :        prototyped and the other a nonprototyped parameter list, also consider
    3822             :        the types compatible. */
    3823           0 :     tp1 = skip_typerefs(tp1);
    3824           0 :     ret1 = tp1->variant.routine.return_type;
    3825           0 :     check_assertion(is_function_type(tp2));
    3826           0 :     tp2 = skip_typerefs(tp2);
    3827           0 :     ret2 = tp2->variant.routine.return_type;
    3828           0 :     if (types_are_compatible(ret1, ret2) ||
    3829           0 :         (is_integral_or_enum_type(ret1) &&
    3830           0 :          interchangeable_types(ret1, ret2))) {
    3831             :       /* Either the return types are compatible or else they are incompatible
    3832             :          but both are integral and they are interchangeable (i.e., they have
    3833             :          the same size and alignment).  See whether the two routine types
    3834             :          are otherwise compatible. */
    3835           0 :       if (tp1->variant.routine.extra_info->prototyped !=
    3836           0 :             tp2->variant.routine.extra_info->prototyped) {
    3837             :         /* One of the routine types is prototyped and the other is not.
    3838             :            Ignore incompatibilities (if there are any) in SVR4 mode. */
    3839             :         compat = TRUE;
    3840             :       } else {
    3841           0 :         tp1->variant.routine.return_type = ret2;
    3842           0 :         compat = types_are_compatible(tp1, tp2);
    3843             :         /* Restore the original return type. */
    3844           0 :         tp1->variant.routine.return_type = ret1;
    3845             :       }  /* if */
    3846             :     }  /* if */
    3847             :   } else {
    3848           0 :     check_assertion(!is_function_type(tp2));
    3849           0 :     if (is_array_type(tp1)) {
    3850             :       /* Array object types are "compatible" if they have the same element
    3851             :          type. */
    3852           0 :       tp1 = array_element_type(tp1);
    3853           0 :       check_assertion(is_array_type(tp2));
    3854           0 :       tp2 = array_element_type(tp2);
    3855           0 :       compat = identical_types(tp1, tp2);
    3856             :     } else {
    3857             :       /* Non-array object types are "compatible" if they are
    3858             :          interchangeable. */
    3859           0 :       compat = interchangeable_types(tp1, tp2);
    3860             :     }  /* if */
    3861             :   }  /* if */
    3862           0 :   return compat;
    3863             : }  /* incompatible_types_are_SVR4_compatible */
    3864             : 
    3865             : 
    3866             : static void recover_from_irreconcilable_external_symbol_types(
    3867             :                                            a_type_ptr             latest_type,
    3868             :                                            an_extern_symbol_descr *esdp,
    3869             :                                            a_boolean              *okay)
    3870             : /*
    3871             : Decide the type of an IL entity and the mode with which to proceed when the
    3872             : latest declaration of that entity conflicts with the previous (possibly
    3873             : implicit) declaration.  latest_type is the type implied by the latest
    3874             : declaration and esdp points to the relevant part of the IL entity (associated
    3875             : with an sk_extern_routine or sk_extern_variable).  esdp->type is updated with
    3876             : the type with which to proceed, and *okay is set to FALSE if the subsequent
    3877             : processing should proceed in error mode.
    3878             : */
    3879             : {
    3880             :   if (!is_function_type(latest_type)) {
    3881             :     /* A variable: Imbue an error type for recovery. */
    3882             :     esdp->type = error_type();
    3883             :     *okay = FALSE;
    3884             :   } else {
    3885             :     a_type_ptr  return_type =
    3886             :                       skip_typerefs(latest_type)->variant.routine.return_type;
    3887             :     if (is_auto_type(find_bottom_of_type(return_type))) {
    3888             :       /* The latest declaration implies a deducible return type, but the
    3889             :          earlier declaration may not match that, and the routine entry may
    3890             :          therefore not reflect the deducibility.  Proceed with an error
    3891             :          type. */
    3892             :       esdp->type = latest_type;
    3893             :       *okay = FALSE;
    3894             :     } else if (decl_scope_level == DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE) {
    3895             :       /* A routine, and the latest declaration is in file-scope: Assume this
    3896             :          latest declaration has the type intended by the programmer and
    3897             :          proceed in error mode. */
    3898             :       esdp->type = latest_type;
    3899             :       *okay = FALSE;
    3900             :     } else {
    3901             :       /* The latest declaration is in block scope.  Proceed in non-error mode
    3902             :          (although a diagnostic is still emitted for this conflict): This will
    3903             :          cause the type of this declaration to prevail in this scope, and that
    3904             :          of the previous declaration to be restored when this scope ends. */
    3905             :       a_routine_ptr  rp = esdp->variant.routine.ptr;
    3906             :       if (rp != NULL) {
    3907             :         if (rp->is_constexpr) {
    3908             :           /* We cannot do this for constexpr functions because a mismatch
    3909             :              between the declared return type and the actual returned value
    3910             :              would corrupt the constexpr interpreter. */
    3911             :           *okay = FALSE;
    3912             :         } else if (!rp->defined &&
    3913             :                    rp->function_def_number != NULL_function_def_number) {
    3914             :           /* If the block-scope declaration is for a function being defined,
    3915             :              proceed in error mode to avoid return statements that do not match
    3916             :              the return type of the enclosing function declaration (this makes
    3917             :              for nicer diagnostics in some cases). */
    3918             :           *okay = FALSE;
    3919             :         }  /* if */
    3920             :       }  /* if */
    3921             :     }  /* if */
    3922             :   }  /* if */
    3923             : }  /* recover_from_irreconcilable_external_symbol_types */
    3924             : 
    3925             : 
    3926             : static void find_file_scope_decl(a_symbol_ptr  ext_sym,
    3927             :                                  a_boolean     is_routine,
    3928             :                                  a_boolean     *non_file_scope_decl_found,
    3929             :                                  a_boolean     *file_scope_decl_found)
    3930             : /*
    3931             : Given an external symbol ext_sym, determine whether there's an intervening
    3932             : declaration that hides an original at file scope by looping through the
    3933             : symbol list (only valid in C mode).
    3934             : */
    3935             : {
    3936             :   a_symbol_ptr                sym = NULL;
    3937             :   an_extern_symbol_descr_ptr  esdp;
    3938             : 
    3939             :   check_assertion(C_mode());
    3940             :   /* The symbol header for the external symbol may be truncated and/or
    3941             :      case insensitive.  We therefore need to determine the header of the
    3942             :      symbol associated with an actual declaration. */
    3943             :   esdp = ext_sym->variant.extern_symbol_descr;
    3944             :   if (is_routine) {
    3945             :     sym = (a_symbol_ptr)esdp->variant.routine.ptr->source_corresp.assoc_info;
    3946             :   } else {
    3947             :     sym = (a_symbol_ptr)esdp->variant.variable->source_corresp.assoc_info;
    3948             :   }  /* if */
    3949             :   if (sym != NULL) {
    3950             :     sym = sym->header->symbol;
    3951             :   }  /* if */
    3952             :   for (; sym != NULL; sym = sym->next) {
    3953             :     if (name_space_for_symbol_kind[(int)sym->kind] == nsk_other) {
    3954             :       /* Found a symbol of the right sort. */
    3955             :       if (sym->decl_scope == scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE].number) {
    3956             :         if (is_tag_symbol(sym)) {
    3957             :           /* Ignore a tag symbol and look for a routine or variable
    3958             :              at file scope. */
    3959             :         } else {
    3960             :           /* Special handling of symbols encountered at file scope. */
    3961             :           if ((is_routine &&
    3962             :                sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_routine) ||
    3963             :               (!is_routine &&
    3964             :                sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable)) {
    3965             :             *file_scope_decl_found = TRUE;
    3966             :           }  /* if */
    3967             :           break;
    3968             :         }  /* if */
    3969             :       } else if (*non_file_scope_decl_found) {
    3970             :         /* We've already located an intervening declaration. */
    3971             :       } else if (is_routine) {
    3972             :         /* Current declaration is a routine. */
    3973             :         if (sym->kind != (a_symbol_kind)sk_routine) {
    3974             :           /* An intervening declaration of something other than a
    3975             :              function.  This redeclaration is hidden from the original
    3976             :              declaration, so issue a warning instead of an error. */
    3977             :           *non_file_scope_decl_found = TRUE;
    3978             :         }  /* if */
    3979             :       } else {
    3980             :         /* Current declaration is a variable. */
    3981             :         if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable) {
    3982             :           if (sym->variant.variable.ptr == NULL) {
    3983             :             /* This is a symbol not yet bound to an IL entry, and so
    3984             :                it is the one just now being created.  Skip past it. */
    3985             :           } else if (sym->defined &&
    3986             :                      sym->decl_scope !=
    3987             :                             scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE].number) {
    3988             :             /* This is an intervening declaration of a local variable
    3989             :                of a parameter. (We check the defined flag to rule out
    3990             :                an intervening block extern declaration.) */
    3991             :             *non_file_scope_decl_found = TRUE;
    3992             :           }  /* if */
    3993             :         } else {
    3994             :           /* An intervening declaration of something other than a
    3995             :              variable.  This redeclaration is hidden from the original
    3996             :              declaration, so issue a warning instead of an error. */
    3997             :           *non_file_scope_decl_found = TRUE;
    3998             :         }  /* if */
    3999             :       }  /* if */
    4000             :     }  /* if */
    4001             :   }  /* for */
    4002             : }  /* find_file_scope_decl */
    4003             : 
    4004             : 
    4005           1 : a_boolean reconcile_external_symbol_types(
    4006             :                              a_symbol_ptr          ext_sym,
    4007             :                              a_source_position_ptr position,
    4008             :                              a_type_ptr            type_ptr,
    4009             :                              an_error_severity     incompatible_severity)
    4010             : /*
    4011             : Change the type of the external symbol ext_sym to type_ptr.  External
    4012             : symbol entries are constructed for all variables and routines with
    4013             : linkage (external or internal) as a place to keep the pointer to the
    4014             : unique IL entry (needed because the normal symbol entries will not
    4015             : necessarily stay in scope for the entire compilation).  *position
    4016             : gives the source position to be used in case of error.
    4017             : An error about a type incompatibility should not be more severe than
    4018             : incompatible_severity.  If FALSE is returned, an error was encountered.
    4019             : Occasionally, encountering an error still produces a TRUE return value,
    4020             : indicating that error recovery should proceed as if no error had occurred
    4021             : (see also recover_from_irreconcilable_external_symbol_types).
    4022             : */
    4023             : {
    4024           1 :   an_extern_symbol_descr_ptr esdp;
    4025           1 :   a_type_ptr                 old_type;
    4026           1 :   a_boolean                  okay = TRUE;
    4027           1 :   a_boolean                  is_routine;
    4028           1 :   an_error_severity          severity = incompatible_severity;
    4029           1 :   a_symbol_ptr               sym;
    4030           1 :   a_boolean                  compat;
    4031           1 :   a_boolean                  incompatible_linkage_spec = FALSE;
    4032             : 
    4033           1 :   db_enter(4, "reconcile_external_symbol_types");
    4034           1 :   esdp = ext_sym->variant.extern_symbol_descr;
    4035           1 :   old_type = esdp->type;
    4036             :   /* If the old and new types are the same, no checking or processing is
    4037             :      required. */
    4038           1 :   if (!same_entities(old_type, type_ptr)) {
    4039             :     /* Use a special comparison for routine types, to ignore calling
    4040             :        convention differences.  In C mode, overloading is not possible, so
    4041             :        allow error type mismatches on routine types. */
    4042           1 :     is_routine = ext_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_extern_routine;
    4043           1 :     if (is_routine) {
    4044           0 :       if (C_mode()) {
    4045           0 :         compat = types_are_compatible(old_type, type_ptr);
    4046             :       } else {
    4047           0 :         compat = types_are_strictly_compatible(old_type, type_ptr,
    4048             :                                                TCF_CHECK_ENABLE_IF_ATTRIBUTES);
    4049           0 :         if (!compat &&
    4050           0 :             routine_types_are_redecl_compatible(old_type, type_ptr,
    4051             :                                                 TCF_NO_FLAGS)) {
    4052           0 :           okay = FALSE;
    4053           0 :           incompatible_linkage_spec = TRUE;
    4054             :         }  /* if */
    4055             :       }  /* if */
    4056             :     } else {
    4057           1 :       compat = types_are_redecl_compatible(old_type, type_ptr);
    4058             :     }  /* if */
    4059           1 :     if (compat) {
    4060             :       /* The old and new types are compatible.  Form the composite of
    4061             :          those types, and save that as the type of the external symbol. */
    4062           1 :       esdp->type = composite_type(old_type, type_ptr);
    4063           1 :       if (is_error_type(old_type) || is_error_type(type_ptr)) {
    4064             :         /* An error type is treated as "compatible" with any type in this
    4065             :            context, we but we don't want to link two declarations if their
    4066             :            types don't match.  (It could e.g. result in inconsistent
    4067             :            initializer types.) */
    4068           0 :         expect_error();
    4069           0 :         okay = FALSE;
    4070             :       }  /* if */
    4071             :     } else {
    4072             :       /* The old and new types are incompatible.  Issue a warning instead of
    4073             :          an error for certain cases (e.g., SVR4 mode). */
    4074           0 :       if (SVR4_C_mode) {
    4075           0 :         if (decl_scope_level == DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE) {
    4076             :           /* Functions and variables are treated differently.  For example:
    4077             :                void f() { extern unsigned g(), x; }
    4078             :                int g();      // Warning in SVR4 C mode.
    4079             :                int x;        // Error in SVR4 C mode.
    4080             :           */
    4081           0 :           if (is_routine &&
    4082           0 :               incompatible_types_are_SVR4_compatible(old_type, type_ptr)) {
    4083           0 :             severity = ((int)severity>(int)es_warning) ? es_warning : severity;
    4084             :             /* Record the most recent type as the external symbol's type. */
    4085           0 :             esdp->type = type_ptr;
    4086           0 :             goto issue_diagnostic;
    4087             :           }  /* if */
    4088           0 :         } else if (is_array_type(type_ptr)) {
    4089             :           /* Array types are compatible when the element types are the same
    4090             :              no matter what the visibility constraints are. */
    4091           0 :           if (incompatible_types_are_SVR4_compatible(old_type, type_ptr)) {
    4092           0 :             severity = ((int)severity>(int)es_warning) ? es_warning : severity;
    4093           0 :             goto issue_diagnostic;
    4094             :           }  /* if */
    4095             :         } else {
    4096             :           /* The SVR4 algorithm is such that an error is issued if the
    4097             :              incompatibility of a block extern declaration is with a visible
    4098             :              declaration, but only a warning is given otherwise.  For example:
    4099             :                extern int f();
    4100             :                extern int ff();
    4101             :                void g() { extern float f(); }                    // Error
    4102             :                void gg() { int ff = 0; { extern float ff(); } }  // Warning
    4103             :              Determine whether there's an intervening declaration that hides
    4104             :              an original at file scope by looping through the symbol list.
    4105             :              Since this only happens in C mode it is pretty straightforward. */
    4106           0 :           a_boolean     non_file_scope_decl_found = FALSE;
    4107           0 :           a_boolean     file_scope_decl_found = FALSE;
    4108           0 :           find_file_scope_decl(ext_sym, is_routine, &non_file_scope_decl_found,
    4109             :                                &file_scope_decl_found);
    4110           0 :           if (non_file_scope_decl_found || !file_scope_decl_found) {
    4111             :             /* Either there was no other declaration in scope (e.g., when the
    4112             :                external symbol records another block extern declaration) or
    4113             :                else there was an intervening declaration.  Issue a warning. */
    4114           0 :             severity = ((int)severity>(int)es_warning) ? es_warning : severity;
    4115           0 :             if (incompatible_types_are_SVR4_compatible(old_type, type_ptr)) {
    4116             :               /* If this is a variable, record the most recent type as the
    4117             :                  external symbol's type. */
    4118           0 :               if (!is_routine) esdp->type = type_ptr;
    4119             :             } else {
    4120           0 :               okay = FALSE;
    4121           0 :               if (file_scope_decl_found) {
    4122             :                 /* Retain the IL entry on the external symbol. */
    4123             :               } else {
    4124             :                 /* Force "abandonment" of the IL entry associated with the
    4125             :                    current external symbol. */
    4126           0 :                 if (is_routine) {
    4127           0 :                   esdp->variant.routine.ptr->superseded_external = TRUE;
    4128           0 :                   esdp->variant.routine.ptr = NULL;
    4129             :                 } else {
    4130           0 :                   check_assertion_str2(
    4131             :                              (esdp->variant.variable->storage_class ==
    4132             :                                              (a_storage_class)sc_extern) &&
    4133             :                              (esdp->variant.variable->init_kind ==
    4134             :                                              (an_init_kind)initk_none),
    4135             :                              "reconcile_external_symbol_types:",
    4136           0 :                              "can't set superseded_external");
    4137           0 :                   esdp->variant.variable->superseded_external = TRUE;
    4138           0 :                   esdp->variant.variable = NULL;
    4139             :                 }  /* if */
    4140           0 :                 esdp->type = type_ptr;
    4141             :               }  /* if */
    4142             :             }  /* if */
    4143           0 :             goto issue_diagnostic;
    4144             :           }  /* if */
    4145             :         }  /* if */
    4146             :       } else if (microsoft_mode && is_routine) {
    4147             :         if (C_mode()) {
    4148             :           if (decl_scope_level == DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE) {
    4149             :             sym = NULL;
    4150             :           } else {
    4151             :             for (sym = ext_sym->header->symbol; sym != NULL; sym = sym->next) {
    4152             :               if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_routine &&
    4153             :                   sym->decl_scope == scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE].number) {
    4154             :                 break;
    4155             :               }  /* if */
    4156             :             }  /* for */
    4157             :           }  /* if */
    4158             :           if (sym != NULL) {
    4159             :             /* The current declaration is a block extern declaration and
    4160             :                there has been a file-scope declaration of a function with the
    4161             :                same name.  Don't reset the external symbol. */
    4162             :           } else {
    4163             :             /* Force "abandonment" of the IL entry associated with the external
    4164             :                routine. */
    4165             :             esdp->variant.routine.ptr->superseded_external = TRUE;
    4166             :             esdp->variant.routine.ptr = NULL;
    4167             :           }  /* if */
    4168             :           if (is_function_type(old_type) && is_function_type(type_ptr) &&
    4169             :               interchangeable_types(return_type_of(old_type),
    4170             :                                     return_type_of(type_ptr))) {
    4171             :             /* Microsoft accepts incompatible function types with a warning,
    4172             :                as long as the return types are "interchangeable". */
    4173             :             severity = ((int)severity>(int)es_warning) ? es_warning : severity;
    4174             :           } else {
    4175             :             okay = FALSE;
    4176             :           }  /* if */
    4177             :         } else if (!incompatible_linkage_spec) {
    4178             :           /* In Microsoft C++ mode extern "C" routine declarations are
    4179             :              allowed to have incompatible types when they appear in
    4180             :              different namespaces. */
    4181             :           severity = ((int)severity>(int)es_warning) ? es_warning : severity;
    4182             :           goto issue_diagnostic;
    4183             :         }  /* if */
    4184             :       }  /* if */
    4185             :       /* Decide how to proceed and which type to select for recovery: */
    4186           0 :       recover_from_irreconcilable_external_symbol_types(type_ptr, esdp, &okay);
    4187           0 : issue_diagnostic:
    4188             :       /* The old and new types are incompatible.  Error. */
    4189           0 :       if (incompatible_severity != es_none) {
    4190           0 :         pos_sy_diagnostic(severity,
    4191             :                           incompatible_linkage_spec ?
    4192             :                             ec_incompatible_linkage_specifier :
    4193             :                             ec_decl_incompatible_with_previous_use,
    4194             :                           position, ext_sym);
    4195             :       }  /* if */
    4196             :     }  /* if */
    4197             :   }  /* if */
    4198           1 :   db_exit();

    4200             : }  /* reconcile_external_symbol_types */
    4201             : 
    4202             : #if BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED
    4203             : 
    4204             : static a_boolean matching_builtin_function_name_exists(a_symbol_locator  *loc)
    4205             : /*
    4206             : If the name described by the given locator corresponds to the name of a GNU-
    4207             : style builtin function without the "__builtin_" prefix, return TRUE.
    4208             : */
    4209             : {
    4210             :   a_boolean            result = FALSE;
