    4235             : 
    4236      829164 : static a_symbol_ptr create_external_symbol_for_linked_entity(
    4237             :                             a_symbol_locator       *locator,
    4238             :                             a_decl_parse_state     *dps,
    4239             :                             a_type_ptr             type_ptr,
    4240             :                             an_id_linkage_block    *idlbp,
    4241             :                             a_boolean              redeclaration,
    4242             :                             a_boolean              suppress_incompatible_error,
    4243             :                             a_boolean              suppress_ext_sym_lookup,
    4244             :                             a_variable_ptr         *variable_ptr,
    4245             :                             a_routine_ptr          *routine_ptr)
    4246             : /*
    4247             : Find or create an external symbol entry for a variable or routine being
    4248             : declared.  *locator gives the symbol locator for the identifier; dps describes
    4249             : the declaration; type_ptr gives the variable or routine type; name_linkage
    4250             : indicates the linkage (internal, external, C++ external).  Aside from creating
    4251             : the entry, this routine checks that the new declaration is compatible with
    4252             : any previous linked declaration of the same name.  redeclaration is
    4253             : TRUE if the present declaration is a redeclaration within the same scope.
    4254             : suppress_incompatible_error is TRUE to suppress incompatibility errors
    4255             : detected in this routine, presumably because the caller has already
    4256             : issued a similar error.  If *variable_ptr and *routine_ptr are both NULL,
    4257             : meaning no IL entity has been found for the entity, the appropriate one
    4258             : of the two will be set to point to the IL entity attached to the external
    4259             : symbol, if there is one.  Note that the pointer from the external symbol
    4260             : entry to the IL variable or routine is not filled in if the entry is
    4261             : created; the caller must set it.

    4601             :            have to be restored at the end of the current scope.  If so,
    4602             :            create a fixup entry that will be processed by pop_scope.  The
    4603             :            type must be restored in a case like
    4604             :              int a[];
    4605             :              main () {
    4606             :                extern int a[5];
    4607             :                ... Type of "a" is now "int [5]".
    4608             :              }
    4609             :              ... Type of "a" must be restored to "int []" at the end of "main".
    4610             :            Another example involves local typedefs:
    4611             :              int *p;
    4612             :              void f() {
    4613             :                typedef int *IP;
    4614             :                extern IP p;
    4615             :              }  // "p" cannot have type "IP" in file scope; restore "int*"

    4617             :         /* The fixup is only needed if the pre-existing definition is in

    4619             :            since it's hard to know the scope associated with the previous
    4620             :            definition (the associated symbol gives only one scope, and
    4621             :            not necessarily the outermost).  A simple way out is to build
    4622             :            the fixup whenever the current scope is not the file scope.
    4623             :            That builds more fixups than needed, but it always works. */

    4630             :              of such unaesthetic situations, a fixup is applied if the
    4631             :              types are otherwise identical. */
    4632           0 :         } else if (decl_scope_level != depth_innermost_namespace_scope) {

    4634             :              of the current scope (see pop_scope).  Note that the
    4635             :              allocation routine places the new entry on the fixup list

    4656             : 
    4657             : void update_dll_info_for_routine(a_routine_ptr         routine,
    4658             :                                  a_decl_modifier       flags,
    4659             :                                  a_boolean             is_inline,
    4660             :                                  a_boolean             is_redecl,
    4661             :                                  a_boolean             is_definition,
    4662             :                                  a_source_position     *diag_pos)
    4663             : /*
    4664             : Update the DLL interface of the given routine according to flags.  If the
    4665             : current declaration of the routine is marked as "inline", is_inline is set to
    4666             : TRUE (even when routine->is_inline may not yet have been set).  If the current
    4667             : declaration is a redeclaration, is_redecl is set to TRUE.  If the current
    4668             : declaration is a definition, is_definition is set to TRUE.  Diagnostics should
    4669             : be issued at the given position.
    4670             : */
    4671             : {
    4672             :   a_decl_modifier  old_dll_flags = (routine->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS);
    4673             :   a_decl_modifier  new_dll_flags = (flags & DM_DLLFLAGS);
    4674             : 
    4675             :   /* dllimport and dllexport should never be set together. */
    4676             :   check_assertion(new_dll_flags != DM_DLLFLAGS);
    4677             :   if ((old_dll_flags | new_dll_flags) != 0) {
    4678             :     /* Either the current declaration has a DLL interface, or the routine was
    4679             :        previously declared with a DLL interface. */
    4680             :     a_boolean  new_dll_export = FALSE, clear_dll_import = FALSE;
    4681             :     a_boolean  freeze_dll_import = FALSE;
    4682             :     if (routine->is_inline) is_inline = TRUE;
    4683             :     if (new_dll_flags != 0) {
    4684             :       if (routine->source_corresp.name_linkage ==
    4685             :                                           (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal) {
    4686             :         /* Entities that don't have external linkage cannot be declared with
    4687             :            a DLL interface. */
    4688             :         pos_error(ec_dll_interface_requires_external_linkage, diag_pos);
    4689             :         goto done;
    4690             :       } else if (routine->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
    4691             :                                           (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external &&
    4692             :                  is_member_of_unnamed_namespace(&routine->source_corresp)) {
    4693             :         /* dllimport/dllexport on an unnamed namespace member is unlikely to
    4694             :            be useful. */
    4695             :         pos_warning(ec_dll_interface_in_unnamed_namespace, diag_pos);
    4696             :       }  /* if */
    4697             :     } else {
    4698             :       /* The current declaration has no DLL interface, but a previous
    4699             :          declaration did.  A previous dllexport is preserved, but a previous
    4700             :          dllimport is dropped.  Exceptions appear to be inline functions,
    4701             :          block-extern declarations, and out-of-class definitions of members
    4702             :          of class templates. */
    4703             :       if ((old_dll_flags & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
    4704             :         if (innermost_function_scope != NULL || is_inline ||
    4705             :             (routine->is_prototype_instantiation && is_definition &&
    4706             :              routine->source_corresp.is_class_member)) {
    4707             :           /* Inline functions, block-extern declarations, and out-of-class
    4708             :              definitions of members of class templates retain the dllimport
    4709             :              attribute specified on the original declaration.  Setting
    4710             :              freeze_dll_import ensures the dllimport attribute won't be
    4711             :              discarded in what follows. */
    4712             :           freeze_dll_import = TRUE;
    4713             :           new_dll_flags = DM_DLLIMPORT;
    4714             :         } else {
    4715             :           clear_dll_import = TRUE;
    4716             :           if (microsoft_version <= 1200 || is_definition) {
    4717             :             /* If the current declaration is a definition (or if we're
    4718             :                emulating an older Microsoft version), dllimport is
    4719             :                implicitly replaced by dllexport. */
    4720             :             new_dll_flags = DM_DLLEXPORT;
    4721             :           }  /* if */
    4722             :         }  /* if */
    4723             :       } else {
    4724             :         /* Preserve the dllexport attribute of the previous declaration. */
    4725             :         new_dll_flags = DM_DLLEXPORT;
    4726             :       }  /* if */
    4727             :     }  /* if */
    4728             :     if (old_dll_flags == new_dll_flags) {
    4729             :       /* This is a redeclaration and it is compatible with the previous
    4730             :          declaration: Nothing to be done.  (It could also be a full
    4731             :          instantiation compatible with a prior partial instantiation or a
    4732             :          declaration of an extern "C" function also declared in another
    4733             :          namespace.) The "compatibility" may be a result of carrying over the
    4734             :          dll attribute (e.g., for inline functions or block-extern
    4735             :          declarations). */
    4736             :     } else if (old_dll_flags == 0) {
    4737             :       /* This is the first time a DLL interface is specified: If there was a
    4738             :          previous declaration, issue a discretionary error (except for
    4739             :          builtin functions). */
    4740             :       if (is_redecl
    4741             : #if BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED
    4742             :           && !symbol_for(routine)->header->is_builtin_function
    4743             : #endif /* BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED */
    4744             :                                                               ) {
    4745             :         pos_sy_diagnostic(es_discretionary_error,
    4746             :                           ec_redeclaration_adds_dll_interface, diag_pos,
    4747             :                           symbol_for(routine));
    4748             :       }  /* if */
    4749             :       routine->decl_modifiers |= new_dll_flags;
    4750             :       if ((new_dll_flags & DM_DLLEXPORT) != 0) {
    4751             :         new_dll_export = TRUE;
    4752             :       } else if (is_inline) {
    4753             :         /* The combination of "inline" and "dllimport" indicates that the body
    4754             :            should only be used for inlining.  It should never be spilled. */
    4755             :         routine->definition_for_inlining_only = TRUE;
    4756             :         routine->suppress_inline_body = TRUE;
    4757             :       }  /* if */
    4758             :     } else if (!freeze_dll_import) {
    4759             :       /* A declaration that conflicts with a previous declaration: Issue a
    4760             :          warning and ignore any dllimport attribute. */
    4761             :       an_error_code  err_code;
    4762             :       clear_dll_import = TRUE;
    4763             :       routine->decl_modifiers |= (new_dll_flags & DM_DLLEXPORT);
    4764             :       if ((routine->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLEXPORT) != 0) {
    4765             :         err_code = ec_dll_interface_conflict_dllexport_assumed;
    4766             :       } else {
    4767             :         err_code = ec_dll_interface_conflict_none_assumed;
    4768             :       }  /* if */
    4769             :       pos_sy_warning(err_code, diag_pos, symbol_for(routine));
    4770             :     }  /* if */
    4771             :     if (is_definition && !is_inline && (new_dll_flags & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0 &&
    4772             :         !clear_dll_import) {
    4773             :       /* Noninline function definitions cannot have the dllimport attribute.
    4774             :          However, early versions of the Microsoft compilers did not diagnose
    4775             :          this when parsing a template in its generic form. */
    4776             :       an_error_severity  severity = es_error;
    4777             :       if (microsoft_version <= 1200 && routine->is_prototype_instantiation &&
    4778             :           routine->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
    4779             :         severity = es_warning;
    4780             :       } else {
    4781             :         clear_dll_import = TRUE;
    4782             :       }  /* if */
    4783             :       pos_diagnostic(severity, ec_cannot_define_dllimport_function, diag_pos);
    4784             :     }  /* if */
    4785             :     if (clear_dll_import && (routine->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
    4786             :       /* Drop any previous dllimport attribute. */
    4787             :       routine->decl_modifiers &= ~(a_decl_modifier)DM_DLLIMPORT;
    4788             :       routine->definition_for_inlining_only = FALSE;
    4789             :       new_dll_export = ((routine->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLEXPORT) != 0);
    4790             :     }  /* if */
    4791             :     if (new_dll_export && is_inline) {
    4792             :       /* dllexport routines must always have an out-of-line copy.  (If extern
    4793             :          inline routines are instantiated, that instantiation is requested
    4794             :          below.) */
    4795             :       routine->need_out_of_line_copy = TRUE;
    4796             :     }  /* if */
    4797             :     if (new_dll_export &&
    4798             :         !routine->is_prototype_instantiation &&
    4799             :         ((routine->is_template_function && !routine->is_specialized)
    4800             : #if INSTANTIATE_EXTERN_INLINE
    4801             :          || is_inline
    4802             : #endif /* INSTANTIATE_EXTERN_INLINE */
    4803             :                      )) {
    4804             :       /* dllexport forces the instantiation of nonexplicit specializations.
    4805             :          If inline functions are "instantiated", this also applies to inline
    4806             :          functions. */
    4807             :       set_instance_required(symbol_for(routine), TRUE, SIR_DEFER_INLINE);
    4808             :     }  /* if */
    4809             :   }  /* if */
    4810             : done:;
    4811             : }  /* update_dll_info_for_routine */
    4812             : 
    4813             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4814             : 
    4815             : #if DECL_MODIFIERS_IN_USE
    4816             : #if !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4817             : /* ARGSUSED */ /* is_redecl and is_definition are only used in Microsoft
    4818             :                   mode. */
    4819             : #endif /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4820     1178100 : void update_routine_decl_modifiers(
    4821             :                              a_routine_ptr               routine,
    4822             :                              a_decl_modifiers_block_ptr  new_modifiers,
    4823             :                              a_source_position           *position,
    4824             :                              a_boolean                   is_redecl,
    4825             :                              a_boolean                   is_definition,
    4826             :                              a_boolean                   is_inline)
    4827             : /*
    4828             : Update the decl_modifiers field of the routine entry to reflect the modifiers
    4829             : specified in new_modifiers.  (Some modifiers -- notably, most __declspec
    4830             : attributes -- were already applied through the general attribute application
    4831             : mechanism.) If this is a redeclaration or definition of a previously defined
    4832             : routine, make sure that the new modifiers are consistent with the previous
    4833             : declaration specified by routine.  position is used as the error position for
    4834             : any diagnostics.
    4835             : */

    4837     1178100 :   a_decl_modifier  flags = new_modifiers->flags;
    4838             : 
    4839             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4840             :   /* Handle dllexport and dllimport separately. */
    4841             :   update_dll_info_for_routine(routine, flags, is_inline, is_redecl,

    4855             :       pos_error(ec_link_scope_requires_external_linkage, position);

    4857             :       /* A redeclaration cannot relax the link scope of a routine. */
    4858             :       if (is_redecl &&

    4860             :                           (routine->decl_modifiers & DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE)) {
    4861             :         pos_error(ec_link_scope_relaxation, position);
    4862             :       } else {

    4864             :            that recorded in the template.  Therefore, we clear any existing
    4865             :            link scope recorded in the entry. */

    4901             : 
    4902             : #endif /* ENABLE_CUDA_SUPPORT */

    4906             : 
    4907             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4908             : 
    4909             : void update_dll_info_for_variable(a_variable_ptr        var,
    4910             :                                   a_decl_modifier       flags,
    4911             :                                   a_boolean             is_redecl,
    4912             :                                   a_boolean             is_definition,
    4913             :                                   a_source_position     *diag_pos)
    4914             : /*
    4915             : Update the DLL interface of the given variable according to flags (and clear
    4916             : the DLL-related flags of flags).  If the current declaration is a definition,
    4917             : is_definition is set to TRUE.  If the current declaration is a redeclaration,
    4918             : is_redecl is set to TRUE.  Diagnostics should be issued at the given
    4919             : position. */
    4920             : {
    4921             :   a_decl_modifier  old_dll_flags = (var->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS);
    4922             :   a_decl_modifier  new_dll_flags = (flags & DM_DLLFLAGS);
    4923             : 
    4924             :   /* dllimport and dllexport should never be set together. */
    4925             :   check_assertion(new_dll_flags != DM_DLLFLAGS);
    4926             :   if ((old_dll_flags | new_dll_flags) != 0) {
    4927             :     /* Either the current declaration has a DLL interface, or the variable was
    4928             :        previously declared with a DLL interface. */
    4929             :     a_boolean  new_dll_export = FALSE, clear_dll_import = FALSE;
    4930             :     a_boolean  freeze_dll_import = FALSE;
    4931             :     if (var->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
    4932             :       /* A static data member. */
    4933             :       if (is_definition &&
    4934             :           ((old_dll_flags | new_dll_flags) & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
    4935             :         /* Imported static data members cannot be defined.  Note that an error
    4936             :            is issued even if one declaration has dllimport and the other has
    4937             :            dllexport: Unlike for other entities, Microsoft compilers retain the
    4938             :            dllimport attribute on static data members. */
    4939             :         pos_error(ec_dllimport_defined, diag_pos);
    4940             :         old_dll_flags = new_dll_flags = 0;
    4941             :       }  /* if */
    4942             :     } else if (new_dll_flags != 0) {
    4943             :       /* Entities that don't have external linkage cannot be declared with a
    4944             :          DLL interface. */
    4945             :       if (var->source_corresp.name_linkage == (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none) {
    4946             :         /* An error should already have been issued for local variables. */
    4947             :         check_assertion(total_errors != 0);
    4948             :         goto done;
    4949             :       } else if (var->source_corresp.name_linkage ==
    4950             :                                           (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal) {
    4951             :         pos_error(ec_dll_interface_requires_external_linkage, diag_pos);
    4952             :         goto done;
    4953             :       }  /* if */
    4954             :     } else {
    4955             :       /* The current declaration has no DLL interface, but a previous
    4956             :          declaration did.  A previous dllexport is preserved, but a previous
    4957             :          dllimport is dropped (except if the current declaration is in block
    4958             :          scope). */
    4959             :       if (old_dll_flags & DM_DLLIMPORT) {
    4960             :         if (innermost_function_scope != NULL) {
    4961             :           /* A block-extern declaration: Carry over the dllimport attribute.
    4962             :              Setting freeze_dll_import ensures the dllimport attribute won't
    4963             :              be discarded in what follows. */
    4964             :           freeze_dll_import = TRUE;
    4965             :           new_dll_flags = DM_DLLIMPORT;
    4966             :         } else {
    4967             :           clear_dll_import = TRUE;
    4968             :           if (microsoft_version <= 1200 || is_definition) {

    4970             :                emulating an older Microsoft version), dllimport is implicitly
    4971             :                replaced by dllexport. */
    4972             :             new_dll_flags = DM_DLLEXPORT;
    4973             :           }  /* if */
    4974             :         }  /* if */
    4975             :       } else {
    4976             :         /* Preserve the dllexport attribute of the previous declaration. */
    4977             :         new_dll_flags = DM_DLLEXPORT;
    4978             :       }  /* if */
    4979             :     }  /* if */
    4980             :     if (new_dll_flags != 0 &&
    4981             :         var->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
    4982             :                                           (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external &&
    4983             :         is_member_of_unnamed_namespace(&var->source_corresp)) {
    4984             :       /* dllimport/dllexport on an unnamed namespace member is unlikely to
    4985             :          be useful. */
    4986             :       pos_warning(ec_dll_interface_in_unnamed_namespace, diag_pos);
    4987             :     }  /* if */
    4988             :     if (old_dll_flags == new_dll_flags) {
    4989             :       /* This is a redeclaration and it is compatible with the previous
    4990             :          declaration: Nothing to be done.  (It could also be a full
    4991             :          instantiation compatible with a prior partial instantiation.)
    4992             :          The "compatibility" may be a result of carrying over the dll
    4993             :          attribute on or from a block-extern declaration. */
    4994             :     } else if (old_dll_flags == 0) {
    4995             :       /* This is the first time a DLL interface is specified: If there was a
    4996             :          previous declaration, issue a discretionary error. */
    4997             :       if (is_redecl) {
    4998             :         pos_sy_diagnostic(es_discretionary_error,
    4999             :                           ec_redeclaration_adds_dll_interface,
    5000             :                           diag_pos, symbol_for(var));
    5001             :       }  /* if */
    5002             :       var->decl_modifiers |= new_dll_flags;

    5006             :     } else if (!freeze_dll_import) {
    5007             :       /* A declaration that conflicts with a previous declaration: Issue a

    5015             :         err_code = ec_dll_interface_conflict_none_assumed;
    5016             :       }  /* if */
    5017             :       pos_sy_warning(err_code, diag_pos, symbol_for(var));
    5018             :     }  /* if */
    5019             :     if (clear_dll_import && (var->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
    5020             :       /* Drop any previous dllimport attribute. */
    5021             :       var->decl_modifiers &= ~(a_decl_modifier)DM_DLLIMPORT;

    5034             : 
    5035        9346 : void update_variable_decl_modifiers(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    5036             : /*
    5037             : *dps describes a variable declaration.  Update the variable's IL entry to
    5038             : reflect modifiers that appeared in the declaration.  If this is a redeclaration
    5039             : or a definition of a previously declared variable, make sure that the new
    5040             : modifiers are consistent with previous declarations.  (Some modifiers --
    5041             : notably, most __declspec attributes -- are applied through the general
    5042             : attribute application mechanism.)
    5043             : */
    5044             : {
    5045        9346 :   a_variable_ptr   variable = NULL;
    5046        9346 :   a_decl_modifier  flags;
    5047             : 
    5048        9346 :   if (dps->sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable) {
    5049        8015 :     variable = dps->sym->variant.variable.ptr;
    5050        1331 :   } else if (dps->sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable_template) {
    5051           0 :     variable = dps->sym->variant.template_info->
    5052             :                                            variant.variable.prototype_variable;
    5053        1331 :   } else if (dps->sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_static_data_member) {
    5054        1331 :     variable = dps->sym->variant.static_data_member.variable;
    5055             :   } else {
    5056           0 :     unexpected_condition();
    5057             :   }  /* if */
    5058             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5059             :   /* Handle dllexport and dllimport separately. */
    5060             :   if (dps->in_class_scope) {
    5061             :     merge_dll_flags_from_parent_class(parent_class_of(variable), dps);
    5062             :   }  /* if */
    5063             :   flags = dps->decl_modifiers.flags;
    5064             :   update_dll_info_for_variable(variable, flags, !dps->first_decl,
    5065             :                                dps->is_definition, &dps->declarator_pos);
    5066             :   if (flags & DM_MICROSOFT_INLINE) {
    5067             :     pos_st_diagnostic(es_discretionary_error,
    5068             :                       ec_decl_modifiers_invalid_for_this_decl,
    5069             :                       &dps->declarator_pos,

    5167      301457 : static void check_for_linkage_conflict(a_storage_class    *old_storage_class,
    5168             :                                        an_id_linkage_kind *linkage,
    5169             :                                        a_storage_class    *storage_class,
    5170             :                                        a_source_position  *position,
    5171             :                                        a_boolean          suppress_diagnostic)
    5172             : /*
    5173             : A variable or routine is being declared again.  The existing storage class
    5174             : of the entity is *old_storage_class.  The linkage and storage class of the
    5175             : new declaration are given by *linkage and *storage_class.  Issue a diagnostic
    5176             : (at the indicated position) if the old and new linkages conflict, and update
    5177             : *linkage, *storage_class, and *old_storage_class appropriately.
    5178             : */
    5179             : {
    5180      301457 :   if ((*linkage == idl_internal) !=
    5181      301457 :                           (*old_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static)) {
    5182             :     /* External versus internal linkage conflict. */
    5183           0 :     if (!suppress_diagnostic) {
    5184             :       /* There is a conflict between a prior declaration and the current one.
    5185             :          This is clearly an error in C++ (ARM 7.1.1, 7.1.2), but because of
    5186             :          prevailing practice we only issue a remark.  The same is done in
    5187             :          C mode, partly because it is common practice in pcc. */
    5188           0 :       pos_diagnostic((strict_ansi_mode ?
    5189             :                            strict_ansi_error_severity : es_remark),
    5190             :                      ec_linkage_conflict, position);
    5191             :     }  /* if */
    5192             :     /* If either declaration has unspecified storage class (i.e., it's an
    5193             :        external definition), that takes precedence, and the entity should
    5194             :        have unspecified storage class.  Otherwise, because of the test above,
    5195             :        one or the other of the declarations will have static storage class,
    5196             :        and the entity should have static storage class.  extern storage
    5197             :        class just defers to the other storage class, i.e., it's considered a
    5198             :        reference to something else that is not necessarily external.  That
    5199             :        means, for example, that "extern int f();" followed by
    5200             :        "static int f();" yields a static routine (that's how pcc does it,
    5201             :        and it's undefined according to the standard). */
    5202           0 :     if (*old_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified ||
    5203           0 :         *storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    5204           0 :       *storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
    5205           0 :       *linkage = idl_external;
    5206             :     } else {
    5207           0 :       *storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_static;
    5208           0 :       *linkage = idl_internal;
    5209             :     }  /* if */
    5210           0 :     *old_storage_class = *storage_class;
    5211             :   }  /* if */

    5215      182638 : void check_default_args_for_param_type(a_param_type_ptr  ptp,
    5216             :                                        a_source_position *pos)

    5236             : 
    5237             : static void check_default_args(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    5238             : /*
    5239             : dps describes the current declaration, where there is no prior declaration
    5240             : with which to merge it.  If appropriate, look for the case in which a
    5241             : parameter with a default argument is followed in the parameter list by one
    5242             : without a default argument, and report the error.  (In many cases, this check
    5243             : can be delayed until the default arguments are actually scanned, but with,
    5244             : e.g., templates, we do not know if the default arguments will be scanned at
    5245             : all.  If a C++/CLI param array is present, issue an error if a default
    5246             : argument is encountered at all.

    5299       66511 : static void check_default_arg_compatibility(a_type_ptr  orig_type,
    5300             :                                             a_type_ptr  new_type,
    5301             :                                             a_boolean   is_function_template)
    5302             : /*
    5303             : Given an existing routine type (orig_type) and the type based on a new
    5304             : declaration (new_type), compare the default argument expressions on a
    5305             : parameter-by-parameter basis and report any errors.  The merging of the
    5306             : default arguments occurs in composite_type.  is_function_template is TRUE if
    5307             : the associated routine is a function template (but not a member function of
    5308             : a class template).  This routine is only called for template-based cases,
    5309             : where we don't know if we will ever scan the default argument caches at all
    5310             : (therefore, to be sure, we issue related diagnostics at the time of the
    5311             : redeclaration).

    5400      302842 : void reconcile_routine_types(a_routine_ptr       routine_ptr,
    5401             :                              a_type_ptr          type_ptr,
    5402             :                              a_boolean           preserve_rout_type,
    5403             :                              a_boolean           preserve_type_ptr,
    5404             :                              a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    5405             : /*
    5406             : The routine routine_ptr has been given both the type it already has (i.e.,
    5407             : routine_ptr->type) and the other type given by type_ptr; it may be assumed
    5408             : that the two types are compatible.  Check the consistency of the default
    5409             : argument specifications, if any, of the two types and set the routine type
    5410             : to the composite of the two types.  If preserve_rout_type is TRUE,
    5411             : routine_ptr->type must remain the same pointer; that type entry is
    5412             : guaranteed to be unshared and is modified if necessary.  If
    5413             : preserve_type_ptr is TRUE, routine_ptr->type must end up equal to type_ptr,
    5414             : and type_ptr is guaranteed to be unshared and is modified if necessary.
    5415             : Those flags are used when the associated type is part of a function
    5416             : definition, and therefore already contains definition information like
    5417             : assoc_routine which should not be overridden.  Obviously, both flags may
    5418             : not be TRUE.
    5419             : *dps describes the current declaration: This routine may update *dps->prev_type
    5420             : if it must overwrite that type with the composite type (prev_type then becomes
    5421             : a copy of the previous type).
    5422             : */
    5423             : {
    5424      302842 :   a_type_ptr        rout_type = routine_ptr->type;
    5425      302842 :   a_type_ptr        comp_type;
    5426      302842 :   a_param_type_ptr  rout_type_ptp, comp_type_ptp, next_rout_type_ptp;
    5427      302842 :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
    5428             :                     rtsp, comp_rtsp;
    5429      302842 :   a_boolean         preserve_qualifiers_from_rout_type;
    5430             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5431             :   a_calling_convention
    5432             :                     orig_calling_convention =
    5433             :                          skip_typerefs(rout_type)->variant.routine.extra_info->
    5434             :                                                             calling_convention;
    5435             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5436             : 
    5437      302842 :   db_enter(4, "reconcile_routine_types");
    5438      302842 :   if (rout_type != type_ptr) {
    5439             :     /* We only try to reconcile routine types that have already been
    5440             :        determined to be compatible. */
    5441      302842 :     check_assertion_str(routine_types_are_redecl_compatible(
    5442             :                                       type_ptr, rout_type,
    5443             :                                       TCF_ERROR_TYPE_COMPATIBLE_WITH_ANYTHING),
    5444      302842 :                         "reconcile_routine_types: types are not compatible");
    5445             :     /* We cannot be required to preserve the types from both sources. */
    5446      302842 :     check_assertion_str(!preserve_rout_type || !preserve_type_ptr,
    5447      302842 :                         "reconcile_routine_types: can't preserve both types");
    5448      302842 :     if (!C_mode() && dps->routine_fixup == NULL) {
    5449             :       /* If there are default arguments associated with the parameters, check
    5450             :          them at this time, unless we have recorded a fixup entry to deal with
    5451             :          default arguments at the end of the declaration.  They will be merged

    5453       66511 :       check_default_arg_compatibility(type_ptr, rout_type,
    5454       66511 :                                       routine_ptr->template_arg_list != NULL);
    5455             :     }  /* if */
    5456             :     /* The type of the routine should be the composite of the two types. */
    5457      302842 :     if (!preserve_rout_type && !preserve_type_ptr) {
    5458             :       /* Simple case -- no required result type location.  Normally, we prefer
    5459             :          the original declaration, but if that was compiler-generated, we
    5460             :          prefer the later one (presumably declared in the source). */
    5461      301330 :       if (routine_ptr->compiler_generated) {
    5462          60 :         routine_ptr->type = composite_type(type_ptr, rout_type);
    5463             :       } else {
    5464      301270 :         routine_ptr->type = composite_type(rout_type, type_ptr);
    5465             :       }  /* if */
    5466             :     } else {

    5468             :          like by passing it first to composite_type. */
    5469        1512 :       if (preserve_rout_type) {
    5470             :         /* rout_type must be preserved. */
    5471        1353 :         comp_type = composite_type(rout_type, type_ptr);
    5472             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    5473        1353 :         if (!same_entities(comp_type, rout_type) &&
    5474           6 :             same_entities(routine_ptr->declared_type, rout_type)) {
    5475             :           /* The declared type, which was saved when the routine was defined,
    5476             :              points to a type entry that is going to be modified, so change
    5477             :              it to point to a copy. */
    5478           0 :           routine_ptr->declared_type =
    5479           0 :                 copy_routine_type_with_param_types(rout_type,
    5480             :                                                    /*copy_default_args=*/TRUE);

    5487             :            arguments to the new type, to ensure that duplicate default
    5488             :            arguments are correctly diagnosed.  E.g.:

    5490             :                void f(int = 3) {}

    5492             :            expressions will be scanned later (via a routine fixup).  So at this
    5493             :            point the param type entry returned by composite_type has the

    5700             : 
    5701      274442 : void check_constituent_types_have_linkage(a_symbol_ptr      sym,
    5702             :                                           a_source_position *error_pos,
    5703             :                                           a_boolean         is_declaration)
    5704             : /*
    5705             : Check whether an entity with linkage was declared using types without linkage.
    5706             : Before C++11 such declarations were not allowed by the language (but were
    5707             : accepted in some cases).  In C++11 the rules were relaxed to allow such
    5708             : declarations provided the entity is either unused or is defined in the
    5709             : translation unit.
    5710             : 
    5711             : The global variable decls_using_types_without_linkage_allowed is used to
    5712             : specify which behavior is to be checked.  When it is TRUE (C++11 behavior),
    5713             : the caller is responsible for calling this routine only for referenced entities
    5714             : that have not been defined.
    5715             : 
    5716             : sym is a pointer to a routine or variable symbol whose type is to be verified.
    5717             : error_pos determines where any error should be reported.
    5718             : 
    5719             : This routine is always called when an entity is declared (is_declaration is
    5720             : TRUE) and when decls_using_types_without_linkage_allowed is TRUE may be
    5721             : called again at the end of the translation unit (is_declaration is FALSE).
    5722             : When appropriate, this routine sets the declared_using_type_without_linkage
    5723             : flag when is_declaration is TRUE.
    5724             : */
    5725             : {
    5726      274442 :   a_boolean                    is_function;
    5727      274442 :   a_type_ptr                   type;
    5728      274442 :   an_error_severity            severity;

    5854             : 
    5855     1137230 : static void set_name_linkage(an_id_linkage_block     *idlbp,
    5856             :                              a_symbol_ptr            sym,
    5857             :                              a_source_correspondence *scp,
    5858             :                              a_symbol_ptr            ext_sym,
    5859             :                              a_source_position       *error_pos)
    5860             : /*
    5861             : Called from decl_variable and decl_routine, this function sets the name
    5862             : linkage of the IL entry.  The indicated id linkage block indicates the
    5863             : linkage (internal, external, none) that has been assigned.  sym is the symbol
    5864             : for the variable or routine whose name linkage is to be set, and scp points
    5865             : to the source correspondence of the associated IL entry.  ext_sym is the
    5866             : associated sk_external_variable or sk_external_routine symbol, if any.
    5867             : *error_pos is the source position of the identifier.
    5868             : */
    5869             : {
    5870     1137230 :   a_boolean                is_function = symbol_is(sym, sk_routine);
    5871     1137230 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
    5872             : 
    5873     1137230 :   if (idlbp->linkage != idl_none) {

    6028             : 
    6029          46 : static void qualified_name_redecl_sym(an_id_linkage_block  *idlbp)
    6030             : /*
    6031             : This routine is called from decl_variable, decl_routine, and
    6032             : decl_function_template for either of two cases:
    6033             :     (1) when idlbp->is_friend_decl is FALSE, a namespace-qualified identifier
    6034             :         is being redeclared outside of the namespace of which it is a member
    6035             :         -- this will be a definition in a well-formed program; and
    6036             :     (2) when idlbp->is_friend_decl is TRUE, a namespace- or file-scope-
    6037             :         qualified name is being declared in a friend declaration.
    6038             : *idlbp describes the declaration being processed; it is updated by this
    6039             : function.
    6040             : */

    6042          46 :   a_symbol_ptr     linked_symbol;

    6046          46 :   a_namespace_ptr  nsp = qualifier_namespace_ptr(*locator);
    6047          46 :   a_scope_depth    orig_effective_decl_level = NO_SCOPE_DEPTH;
    6048             : 
    6049          46 :   db_enter(3, "qualified_name_redecl_sym");

    6250             : 
    6251           0 : static void move_variable_to_end_of_list(a_variable_ptr  var,
    6252             :                                          a_symbol_ptr    linked_decl,
    6253             :                                          a_boolean       from_inline_namespace)
    6254             : /*
    6255             : The given variable is being redeclared (and defined).  Move the corresponding
    6256             : IL entry to the end of the associated scope list.  linked_decl is a symbol
    6257             : representing the previous declaration; in Sun and Microsoft modes it could
    6258             : be a using-declaration.  from_inline_namespace is TRUE if linked_decl
    6259             : is a namespace projection symbol made visible by an inline namespace.
    6260             : */
    6261             : {
    6262           0 :   a_scope_depth  depth;
    6263           0 :   a_boolean      namespace_scope_needed = FALSE;
    6264             : 
    6265           0 :   if (var->source_corresp.name_linkage == (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external) {
    6266             :     /* Variables with C linkage are always placed on the file scope list. */
    6267             :     depth = DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE;
    6268             :   } else {
    6269           0 :     a_symbol_ptr     fund_linked_decl;
    6270           0 :     fund_linked_decl = linked_decl == NULL
    6271           0 :                                    ? NULL : fundamental_symbol_of(linked_decl);
    6272           0 :     if (from_inline_namespace) {
    6273             :       /* The scope for the inline namespace must be pushed. */
    6274           0 :       namespace_scope_needed = TRUE;
    6275             :     } else if ((sun_mode || microsoft_mode) &&
    6276             :                depth_innermost_function_scope == NO_SCOPE_DEPTH &&
    6277             :                linked_decl != NULL &&
    6278             :                linked_decl->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace_projection) {
    6279             :       /* In Sun and Microsoft modes it is possible to redeclare a variable
    6280             :          outside its namespace when that variable is visible through a
    6281             :          using-declaration.  In that case, we must push that namespace
    6282             :          scope so that the associated variable can be found by
    6283             :          remove_from_variables_list and add_to_variables_list. */
    6284             :       if (sym_is_namespace_member(fund_linked_decl)) {
    6285             :         namespace_scope_needed = TRUE;
    6286             :       }  /* if */
    6287             :     }  /* if */
    6288           0 :     if (namespace_scope_needed) {
    6289           0 :       f_push_namespace_extension_scope(
    6290             :                                 sym_parent_namespace(fund_linked_decl), TRUE);
    6291             :     }  /* if */
    6292           0 :     depth = depth_innermost_namespace_scope;
    6293             :   }  /* if */
    6294           0 :   check_assertion(in_file_scope(var));
    6295           0 :   remove_from_variables_list(var, depth);
    6296           0 :   add_to_variables_list(var, depth);
    6297           0 :   if (namespace_scope_needed) {
    6298           0 :     pop_namespace_extension_scope();

    6307             : static a_boolean microsoft_for_init_hiding(a_symbol_locator  *loc,
    6308             :                                            a_scope_depth     decl_level,
    6309             :                                            a_boolean         *in_for_init)
    6310             : /*
    6311             : Starting with version 7, Microsoft Visual C++ allows for-initializers to
    6312             : declare variables that conflict with a declaration in the surrounding scope.
    6313             : The earlier declaration is hidden by the new one.  The given locator is for
    6314             : a new variable declaration in the current scope.  Return TRUE if we must
    6315             : emulate the Microsoft behavior for that declaration.  decl_level is the
    6316             : scope level in which for-init variables will be placed.  *in_for_init is set
    6317             : to TRUE if we are in Microsoft mode and in a for-init block.
    6318             : */
    6319             : {
    6320             :   a_boolean  hiding = FALSE;
    6321             : 
    6322             :   check_assertion(microsoft_mode);
    6323             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6324             :   if (!C_mode() &&
    6325             :       struct_stmt_stack != NULL && depth_stmt_stack >= 0 &&
    6326             :       struct_stmt_stack_top().for_init) {
    6327             :     *in_for_init = TRUE;
    6328             :     if (microsoft_version >= 1300 &&
    6329             :         (use_nonstandard_for_init_scope ||
    6330             :          (decl_level != depth_scope_stack &&
    6331             :           microsoft_type_dependent_for_init_scope))) {
    6332             :       a_scope_depth  saved_decl_scope_level = decl_scope_level;
    6333             :       a_symbol_ptr   prev_decl;
    6334             :       /* Look for an existing variable in the scope in which the for-init
    6335             :          variable will be placed. */
    6336             :       decl_scope_level = decl_level;
    6337             :       prev_decl = curr_scope_id_lookup(loc, IDL_NO_OPTIONS);
    6338             :       decl_scope_level = saved_decl_scope_level;
    6339             :       if (prev_decl != NULL &&
    6340             :           prev_decl->decl_scope == scope_stack[decl_level].number) {
    6341             :         if (!(prev_decl->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_variable &&
    6342             :               prev_decl->variant.variable.declared_in_for_init)) {
    6343             :           /* Do not issue a warning if the hidden variable is a for-init
    6344             :              declaration since that is common and unsurprising practice. */
    6345             :           a_diagnostic_ptr      dp;
    6346             :           dp = pos_start_diagnostic(es_warning, ec_for_init_hides_declaration,
    6347             :                                     &loc->source_position);
    6348             :           add_diag_info_with_pos_insert(dp, ec_for_init_hidden_declaration,
    6349             :                                         &prev_decl->decl_position);
    6350             :           end_diagnostic(dp);
    6351             :         }  /* if */
    6352             :         hiding = TRUE;
    6353             :       }  /*if */
    6354             :     }  /*if */
    6355             :   }  /* if */
    6356             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6357             :   return hiding;
    6358             : }  /* microsoft_for_init_hiding */

    6362             : static void adjust_calling_convention_if_entry_point(
    6363             :                                            a_symbol_locator       *locator,
    6364             :                                            a_func_info_block_ptr  func_info,
    6365             :                                            a_type_ptr             type)
    6366             : /*
    6367             : A function is being declared with a name represented by locator, with the
    6368             : given type, and with additional properties pointed to by func_info.  If this
    6369             : function is the standard "main" entry point, a cc_default calling convention
    6370             : is replaced by cc_cdecl.  If its name is "WinMain" or "wWinMain", a cc_default
    6371             : calling convention is replaced by cc_stdcall (in this case the parent
    6372             : namespace and type are ignored, so that the modified function may not in
    6373             : fact be a Microsoft Windows entry point).
    6374             : */
    6375             : {
    6376             :   /* If the function was declared with a typedef, do not change its calling
    6377             :      convention since that would change the typedef's type.  (I.e., do not
    6378             :      apply skip_typerefs to type.) */
    6379             :   if (type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine) {
    6380             :     a_routine_type_supplement_ptr  rtsp = type->variant.routine.extra_info;
    6381             :     if (rtsp->calling_convention == (a_calling_convention)cc_default) {
    6382             :       if (func_info->is_main_function) {
    6383             :         /* main() is a __cdecl function by default. */
    6384             :         rtsp->calling_convention = (a_calling_convention)cc_cdecl;
    6385             :       } else if (locator->symbol_header != NULL) {
    6386             :         a_const_char *name = locator->symbol_header->identifier;
    6387             :         if (name[0] == 'w') {
    6388             :           /* Treat "wWinMain" as "WinMain". */
    6389             :           ++name;
    6390             :         }  /* if */
    6391             :         if (strcmp(name, "WinMain") == 0) {
    6392             :           /* WinMain() is a __stdcall function by default. */
    6393             :           rtsp->calling_convention = (a_calling_convention)cc_stdcall;
    6394             :         }  /* if */
    6395             :       }  /* if */
    6396             :     }  /* if */
    6397             :   }  /* if */
    6398             : }  /* adjust_calling_convention_if_entry_point */

    6590           0 : static a_boolean check_variable_redecl_compatible(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)

    6664             : 
    6665          16 : static void check_sym_of_other_decl(a_source_correspondence  *scp,
    6666             :                                     a_symbol_ptr             new_decl)
    6667             : /*
    6668             : This routine is called when processing the declaration of a variable or
    6669             : function that was previously declared in another scope (this is technically
    6670             : not a "redeclaration").  scp points to the source correspondence entry of the
    6671             : declared entity; its assoc_info field points to the symbol for the earlier
    6672             : declaration.  new_decl points to the symbol associated with the current
    6673             : declaration.  Update scp->assoc_info to point to new_decl if needed.
    6674             : */
    6675             : {
    6676          16 :   a_symbol_ptr  other_decl = (a_symbol_ptr)scp->assoc_info;
    6677          16 :   a_boolean     is_local, other_decl_is_block_extern;
    6678             : 
    6679             :   /* The entity was previously declared in a different scope. */
    6680          16 :   check_assertion(other_decl != NULL);
    6681             :   /* If it wasn't a namespace scope declaration, and it is no longer associated
    6682             :      with a scope on the scope stack, other_decl must have been the result of a
    6683             :      block-extern declaration. */
    6684          32 :   other_decl_is_block_extern =
    6685          16 :                !sym_is_namespace_member(other_decl) &&
    6686           0 :                other_decl->decl_scope !=
    6687          16 :                                     scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE].number &&
    6688           0 :                scope_depth_of_symbol(other_decl, &is_local) == NO_SCOPE_DEPTH;
    6689           0 :   if (other_decl_is_block_extern) {
    6690           0 :     if (depth_innermost_function_scope == NO_SCOPE_DEPTH) {
    6691             :       /* The current declaration is not block-extern, but the previous
    6692             :          declaration was block-extern.  For example:
    6693             :            void f() { extern int x; }
    6694             :            int x;
    6695             :          Use the symbol for the current declaration in the IL entry instead. */
    6696           0 :       a_boolean  saved_referenced_flag = scp->referenced;

    6794             : symbol locator (and thus its name and its declaration position).  *dps
    6795             : describes various properties of the declaration (including its type and
    6796             : storage class).
    6797             : Create and enter a symbol entry, and return a pointer to it in dps->sym.
    6798             : Also allocate any associated IL construct, and attach it to the symbol.  If
    6799             : the identifier has linkage and there is an existing symbol or IL entry, it
    6800             : will be re-used.  Return in *linkage_ptr the linkage of the identifier.
    6801             : Return in *dps->prev_type any previously-known type for this identifier from a

    6803             : type.  If the identifier has linkage, return in *ext_sym a pointer to the
    6804             : external symbol entry; otherwise, set *ext_sym to NULL.  srk_flags contain
    6805             : specific information about the kind of declaration (whether it's a definition,

    7071             :        declarations of a name with linkage refer to the same object or

    7576        1111 : static void record_asm_name_for_routine(

    7590             :        declarations of previously defined functions with a warning.  Earlier
    7591             :        versions of GNU C take the asm name into account only for subsequent
    7592             :        references.  We enforce the newer behavior for all values of gnu_version
    7593             :        because the older behavior would add too much complexity.  E.g.:
    7594             :          void f() {}           // Always emitted as "f" by gcc (not g++).
    7595             :          void f() __asm("h");  // Ignored in gcc 4.0.0 and later.
    7596             :          void g() { f(); }     // Refers to "h" in versions prior to 4.0.0.
    7597             :        (GNU C++ applies the name change throughout the translation unit.)
    7598             :     */

    7600             :        definition. */

    7622           0 : static void check_incompatible_routine_redecl(

    7631             :                                        a_boolean      *linked_redecl_error,
    7632             :                                        a_boolean      *suppress_ext_sym_lookup)
    7633             : /*
    7634             : An incompatible declaration of routine represented by linked_sym has been
    7635             : parsed.  The (incompatible) redeclared type is new_type.  Issue a diagnostic
    7636             : (at the position described by diag_pos) and either record the original type
    7637             : in *old_type or force the creation of a new routine entry (and symbol) by
    7638             : setting *linked_redecl_error to TRUE.  Some modes (GNU C, Microsoft C, and
    7639             : SVR4) allow certain incompatibilities: Only a warning is issued in those
    7640             : cases.  Otherwise an error is issued and *suppress_ext_sym_lookup is set to
    7641             : TRUE to notify the caller that a new "extern symbol" should be forced.
    7642             : old_decl_has_body is TRUE if the function was previously defined, and
    7643             : is_function_def is TRUE if the redeclaration is a definition.

    7857     1129220 : static void check_implicit_routine_alias(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    7858             : /*
    7859             : GCC recognizes certain declarations as matching standard library functions
    7860             : and optimizes calls to those routines in some cases.  In particular, the
    7861             : strlen function is recognized and when applied to a string literal, the result
    7862             : is a constant-expression.  We emulate the "recognition" process by recording
    7863             : the routine as an implicit alias (which expression processing can then make
    7864             : use of).
    7865             : *dps describes the declaration of a function.
    7866             : */
    7867             : {
    7868     1129220 :   check_assertion(gnu_mode);
    7869     1129220 :   if (is_simple_function_symbol(dps->sym) &&
    7870     1129220 :       !sym_is_class_or_namespace_member(dps->sym)) {
    7871     1127220 :     a_routine_ptr  rp = dps->sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    7872     1127220 :     a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
    7873     1127220 :                    rtsp = skip_typerefs(rp->type)->variant.routine.extra_info;
    7874     1127220 :     if (rp->implicit_alias && dps->is_definition) {
    7875             :       /* If a definition is seen after a declaration that was implicitly
    7876             :          aliased, the alias is cleared. */
    7877           0 :       ensure_gnu_routine_supp(rp)->aliased_routine = NULL;
    7878           0 :       rp->implicit_alias = FALSE;
    7879     1127220 :     } else if (dps->first_decl && !dps->sym->defined &&
    7880      816618 :                rtsp->prototyped &&
    7881      816618 :                (!has_gnu_routine_supp(rp) ||
    7882         115 :                 gnu_routine_supp(rp)->aliased_routine == NULL) &&
    7883      816618 :                rp->source_corresp.name_linkage ==
    7884      647639 :                                          (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external &&

    8126           0 : a_boolean check_udl_operator(a_boolean     *p_use_literal_op_template,

    8220          32 : static a_boolean is_valid_udl_char_parameter_type(a_type_ptr  char_type)

    8266          32 : static void check_udl_operator_type(a_symbol_locator  *loc,
    8267             :                                     a_routine_ptr     rp)
    8268             : /*
    8269             : The given function (declared with the given locator) represents a literal
    8270             : operator.  Check that it has an acceptable type and linkage and issue an

    8272             : needed.
    8273             : */

    8278             : 
    8279          32 :   if (rp->source_corresp.name_linkage == (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external) {

    8281             :   }  /* if */

    8283           0 :     pos_error(ec_ellipsis_parameter_for_literal_operator,
    8284             :               &loc->source_position);
    8285           0 :     param_err = TRUE;
    8286          32 :   } else if (ptp == NULL) {
    8287           0 :     pos_error(ec_no_parameter_for_literal_operator, &loc->source_position);
    8288           0 :     param_err = TRUE;

    8291          32 :                 size_t_type = integer_type(targ_size_t_int_kind);

    8293           0 :       pos_ty_error(ec_pointer_to_nonconst_for_literal_operator,

    8295           0 :       param_err = TRUE;

    8420     1129220 : void decl_routine(a_symbol_locator         *locator,
    8421             :                   a_decl_parse_state       *dps,
    8422             :                   a_func_info_block_ptr    func_info,
    8423             :                   a_symbol_reference_kind  srk_flags,
    8424             :                   an_id_linkage_kind       *linkage_ptr,
    8425             :                   a_type_ptr               *old_type,
    8426             :                   a_symbol_ptr             *ext_sym,
    8427             :                   a_decl_pos_block_ptr     decl_pos_block)
    8428             : /*
    8429             : Enter the declaration of an identifier for a nonmember routine.  *locator
    8430             : gives the symbol locator (and thus its name and its declaration position).
    8431             : *dps and *func_info describe various properties of the declaration (e.g., its
    8432             : type, storage class, attributes, etc.).  If func_info->is_implicit_declaration
    8433             : is TRUE, this declaration is for an implicit function declaration, and dps->sym
    8434             : already points to the symbol entry, which is already in the symbol table.  If
    8435             : func_info->is_definition is TRUE, the identifier being defined is part of a
    8436             : function definition (meaning there is a body in the definition), in which case
    8437             : it is guaranteed that dps->type points to an unshared type entry, and that type
    8438             : entry will be preserved as the routine type.  Create and enter a symbol entry,
    8439             : and return a pointer to it in dps->sym.  Also allocate any associated IL
    8440             : construct, and attach it to the symbol.  If the identifier has linkage and
    8441             : there is an existing symbol or IL entry, it will be re-used.  Return in
    8442             : *linkage_ptr the linkage of the identifier.  Return in *old_type any
    8443             : previously-known type for this identifier from a linked identifier in the same
    8444             : scope, or NULL if there was no previously-known type.  If the identifier has
    8445             : linkage, return in *ext_sym a pointer to the external symbol entry; otherwise,
    8446             : set *ext_sym to NULL.  srk_flags contain specific information about the kind
    8447             : of declaration (whether it's a definition, an implicit declaration (C only), a
    8448             : friend declaration (C++ only), and so forth); this information is passed on
    8449             : for use in generating cross-reference output describing this declaration.

    8740             :      attribute.  So check_gnu_inline_attribute may have to look through the

    8751             :     /* In C99 mode, if a function is declared "inline" every time it is
    8752             :        declared in a given translation unit and is never declared with an
    8753             :        explicitly specified storage class, then its definition is regarded as
    8754             :        an "inline definition" instead of an "external definition" (see 6.9,
    8755             :        6.7.4).  An inline function with an "inline definition", even though it
    8756             :        has external linkage, is not visible outside the current translation
    8757             :        unit.  (This does not apply to block-extern declarations.)  Note that
    8758             :        early GNU C99 modes do not adhere to these rules. */

   10062             : 
   10063        4740 : void decl_function_template(a_symbol_locator            *locator,
   10064             :                             a_func_info_block           *func_info,
   10065             :                             a_symbol_ptr                *symbol_ptr,
   10066             :                             a_tmpl_decl_state_ptr       decl_state)
   10067             : /*
   10068             : Roughly speaking, this routine does for function templates what decl_routine
   10069             : does for ordinary functions.  Look up and reuse or else create a function
   10070             : template symbol; for new symbols also create a routine entry (though one that
   10071             : is not added to the IL).  *locator represents the name specified in the
   10072             : declarator.  func_info holds some function properties.  decl_state points to
   10073             : a block of information describing the current state of processing for the
   10074             : template.  The function template may be part of an overload set, it may have
   10075             : been previously declared (but not defined), and it may be an out-of-line
   10076             : definition of a member function of a class template.
   10077             : */
   10078             : {
   10079        4740 :   a_decl_parse_state                *dps = &decl_state->decl_parse;

   10083        4740 :   a_symbol_ptr                      overload_symbol = NULL;

   10981          10 : static void define_static_data_member(a_symbol_locator    *locator,
   10982             :                                       a_decl_parse_state  *dps,

   10986             : /*
   10987             : Enter the definition of a static data member.  *locator gives the symbol
   10988             : locator (and thus its name and its declaration position).  *dps describes
   10989             : various properties of the declaration (including type and storage class).
   10990             : Note that static data members must already have been declared within the
   10991             : class (or struct or union) of which they are members.  The type must be
   10992             : compatible with the original declaration, and there must be no explicit
   10993             : storage class on the current definition.  The storage class of defined
   10994             : static members should be changed to sc_unspecified.  Return a pointer to

   11915             : static a_boolean implicitly_predeclared_gcc_function(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
   11916             : /*
   11917             : Early versions of GNU C predeclare the "exit" function implicitly; i.e., the

   11936          10 : void decl_default_function(a_symbol_ptr symbol_ptr)
   11937             : /*
   11938             : Declare the given symbol as a default function.  This routine is called
   11939             : when a previously-unknown identifier appears in an expression followed by

   12020           3 : a_label_ptr scan_label(a_boolean  is_definition,
   12021             :                        a_boolean  is_declaration)
   12022             : /*

   12122       10515 : a_boolean simplify_curr_class_qualified_name(void)
   12123             : /*
   12124             : If the current token is the start of a qualified name in which the class
   12125             : name component is the name of a class currently being defined, advance past
   12126             : the class name and the "::" so that the current token is a non-qualified
   12127             : name.  Return TRUE if such a modification is done and FALSE otherwise.
   12128             : This routine is called in C++ only.
   12129             : 
   12130             : This functionality is provided to deal with declarations of class members
   12131             : where a qualified name is used instead of a simple name, e.g., when a
   12132             : constructor for class A is declared A::A() rather than A().  This is
   12133             : nonstandard, but it is allowed by cfront and other compilers.  GNU C++
   12134             : also allows this for member templates.
   12135             : */
   12136             : {
   12137       10515 :   a_boolean                is_member_id = FALSE;
   12138       10515 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[decl_scope_level];
   12139             : 
   12140       10515 :   db_enter(3, "simplify_curr_class_qualified_name");
   12141             : 
   12142       10515 :   if (gpp_mode && ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_template_declaration) {
   12143             :     /* In GNU mode, the simplification is also performed for the declarators
   12144             :        of member templates. */
   12145        1762 :     --ssep;
   12146             :   }  /* if */
   12147       19420 :   if (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union &&
   12148       17810 :       is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_TEMPLATE_ARGS_OPTIONAL) &&
   12149             :       locator_for_curr_id.is_qualified_name) {
   12150           0 :     if (same_entities(qualifier_class_type(locator_for_curr_id),
   12151           0 :                       ssep->assoc_type) &&
   12152           0 :         locator_for_curr_id.is_global_qualified_name == FALSE) {
   12153           0 :       an_error_severity sev = strict_ansi_mode ? strict_ansi_error_severity :
   12154             :                                                  es_warning;
   12155           0 :       is_member_id = TRUE;
   12156             :       /* Reset the fields in the locator to make it appear as if the
   12157             :          qualifier was not present. */
   12158           0 :       clear_qualifier_from_locator(&locator_for_curr_id);
   12159             :       /* No diagnostic is issued in cfront and some Microsoft modes.  In the
   12160             :          Microsoft case, we may also end up here for friend declarations
   12161             :          ("struct S { friend void S::f(); };") and dropping the qualifier may
   12162             :          result in the injection of the name in namespace scope. */
   12163           0 :       if (any_cfront_mode()) {
   12164             :         sev = es_none;

   12166             :         if (ms_permissive) {
