   12183             : 
   12184           0 : void report_missing_type_specifier(a_source_position  *err_pos,
   12185             :                                    a_type_ptr         type,
   12186             :                                    a_boolean          is_function,
   12187             :                                    a_boolean          is_function_def,
   12188             :                                    a_boolean          is_main_func,
   12189             :                                    a_boolean          any_decl_specifiers)
   12190             : /*
   12191             : No type was explicitly specified for the current declaration.  Issue the
   12192             : appropriate diagnostic at the source position given by *err_pos.
   12193             : type points to the type, which may have derived type levels on
   12194             : top of the underlying implicitly-generated type.  is_function is TRUE
   12195             : if this is a function declaration; is_function_def is TRUE if it is
   12196             : a function declaration that is also a definition; is_main_func is TRUE
   12197             : if it is a declaration of global scope "main".  any_decl_specifiers is
   12198             : TRUE if at least one decl-specifier was seen (e.g., a storage class or
   12199             : cv-qualifier).
   12200             : Note that this routine determines whether the "implicit int" rule applies.
   12201             : */
   12202             : {
   12203           0 :   an_error_code      error_code;
   12204           0 :   an_error_severity  severity = es_none;
   12205           0 :   a_type_ptr         bottom_type;
   12206             : 
   12207           0 :   bottom_type = find_bottom_of_type(type);
   12208           0 :   if (is_error_type(bottom_type) || is_unknown_type(bottom_type)) {
   12209             :     /* An error was previously issued on the specifiers type, so do
   12210             :        not issue another diagnostic. */
   12211           0 :     goto done;
   12212             :   }  /* if */
   12213             :   /* Different modes call for different severities.  Most diagnostics involve
   12214             :      one of two messages depending on whether any decl-specifiers were seen at
   12215             :      all, but the global function "main" is handled with a different error
   12216             :      code (in case discretionary-error control for "main" should be
   12217             :      independent of that for other functions). */
   12218           0 :   error_code = is_main_func        ? ec_implicit_int_on_main :
   12219             :                any_decl_specifiers ? ec_missing_type_specifier :
   12220             :                                      ec_missing_decl_specifiers;
   12221           0 :   if (C_dialect == C_dialect_pcc) {
   12222             :     /* pcc mode is the most permissive when it comes to diagnosing missing
   12223             :        type specifiers.  Only non-function cases are diagnosed, and the
   12224             :        diagnostic is just a warning. */
   12225           0 :     if (!is_function) {
   12226             :       severity = es_warning;
   12227             :     }  /* if */
   12228           0 :   } else if (C_mode() && (!c99_mode || ms_extensions || gcc_mode)) {
   12229             :     /* In C89 modes the "implicit int" rule applies in most cases, but it's
   12230             :        nonstandard for declarations that aren't function definitions and
   12231             :        have no decl-specifiers at all (e.g., "f();").  The standard cases
   12232             :        usually deserve a remark. */
   12233             :     /* The combination of Microsoft mode and C99 mode is treated like a C89
   12234             :        mode in this respect (Microsoft compilers currently don't have a true
   12235             :        C99 mode).  GNU C doesn't enforce the standard constraints in its C99
   12236             :        mode either. */
   12237           0 :     if (is_function) {
   12238             :       /* The "main" function is silently accepted without any specifiers. */
   12239           0 :       if (!is_main_func) {
   12240           0 :         if (!any_decl_specifiers && !is_function_def) {
   12241             :           /* Something like "f();". */
   12242           0 :           severity = strict_ansi_mode ?
   12243           0 :                          strict_ansi_discretionary_severity : es_warning;
   12244             :         } else {
   12245             :           /* Something like "static f();" or "f() { ... }".  If the are no
   12246             :              decl_specifiers but a function definition follows, the diagnostic
   12247             :              is for the missing type specifier rather than for the missing
   12248             :              specifiers in general.  (The message indicates that "int" is
   12249             :              implicit.) */
   12250           0 :           severity = (gcc_mode && c99_mode) ? es_warning : es_remark;
   12251             :           error_code = ec_missing_type_specifier;
   12252             :         }  /* if */
   12253             :       }  /* if */
   12254             :     } else {
   12255             :       /* A non-function declaration. */
   12256           0 :       if (!any_decl_specifiers) {
   12257             :         /* Microsoft and GNU compilers are as permissive as pcc in this
   12258             :            case. */
   12259           0 :         severity = (ms_extensions || gcc_mode) ? es_warning
   12260           0 :                                                : es_discretionary_error;
   12261             :       } else {
   12262             :         severity = es_warning;
   12263             :       }  /* if */
   12264             :     }  /* if */
   12265           0 :   } else if (!C_mode() && (any_cfront_mode() ||
   12266           0 :                            (ms_extensions && microsoft_version < 1400)) &&
   12267           0 :              !auto_type_specifier_enabled) {
   12268             :     /* Cfront compilers and early Microsoft C++ compilers are fairly
   12269             :        permissive and allow "implicit int" in most cases.  However, if "auto"
   12270             :        may appear as a type specifier, we fall back on the standard
   12271             :        constraints. */
   12272           0 :     if (is_main_func) {
   12273             :       severity = es_remark;
   12274           0 :     } else if (is_function) {
   12275           0 :       severity = any_cfront_mode() ? es_remark : es_warning;
   12276             :       error_code = ec_nonstd_implicit_int;
   12277           0 :     } else if (!any_decl_specifiers) {
   12278             :       severity = es_discretionary_error;
   12279             :     } else {
   12280           0 :       severity = es_warning;
   12281           0 :       error_code = ec_nonstd_implicit_int;
   12282             :     }  /* if */
   12283             :   } else {
   12284             :     /* Apply the standard C++/C99 constraints.  Implicit int is normally not
   12285             :        accepted, but some allowances are made in nonstrict modes for "main".
   12286             :        If "auto" may appear as a type specifier, diagnostics are emitted as if
   12287             :        we were in strict mode. */
   12288           0 :     if (is_main_func) {
   12289           0 :       severity = (strict_ansi_mode || auto_type_specifier_enabled) ?
   12290           0 :                     strict_ansi_discretionary_severity : es_remark;
   12291             :     } else {
   12292           0 :       severity = es_discretionary_error;
   12293           0 :       if (is_function) {
   12294             :         /* Function declaration in C++ or C99 mode.  Issue the same message
   12295             :            whether or not any_decl_specifiers is TRUE and whether this is a
   12296             :            definition or merely a declaration.  That is, all the following are
   12297             :            treated the same way:
   12298             :              a();
   12299             :              b() {}
   12300             :              extern c();
   12301             :              extern d() {}
   12302             :         */
   12303             :         error_code = ec_missing_type_specifier;
   12304             :       }  /* if */
   12305             :     }  /* if */
   12306             :   }  /* if */
   12307             :   /* Unless the diagnostic is suppressed (e.g., many pcc cases), put out the
   12308             :      diagnostic. */
   12309           0 :   if (severity != es_none) {
   12310           0 :     pos_diagnostic(severity, error_code, err_pos);
   12311             :   }  /* if */
   12312           0 : done:;
   12313           0 : }  /* report_missing_type_specifier */

   12315             : 
   12316           0 : static an_attribute_ptr extract_gnu_attributes(an_attribute_ptr  *p_list)
   12317             : /*
   12318             : Extract and return the GNU attributes from the list of attributes pointed to
   12319             : by *p_list (the list can be empty; i.e., *p_list can be NULL).

   12339           0 : static void process_type_name_attributes(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   12340             : /*
   12341             : This routine is called from type_name_full to handle non-type-transforming
   12342             : attributes that might be recorded in dps->prefix_attributes and
   12343             : dps->id_attributes.  GNU attributes may be valid in this context (in
   12344             : particular, the "aligned" attribute) and are therefore applied to dps->type.
   12345             : Other attributes are invalid and are diagnosed.
   12346             : */

   12348           0 :   an_attribute_ptr  gnu_list = NULL, ap;
   12349             : 
   12350           0 :   gnu_list = extract_gnu_attributes(&dps->id_attributes);

   12352           0 :                               extract_gnu_attributes(&dps->prefix_attributes);

   12354           0 :     for (ap = gnu_list; ap != NULL; ap = ap->next) {
   12355           0 :       ap->assoc_info = (void*)dps;
   12356           0 :       if (is_class_struct_union_type(dps->type) || is_enum_type(dps->type)) {
   12357             :         /* GCC issues a warning for attributes on class and enum types in this
   12358             :            context.  E.g., the expression "(int __attribute((aligned(8))))x" is
   12359             :            silently accepted, but "(E __attribute((aligned(8))))x", where E is
   12360             :            an enumeration type, elicits a warning. */
   12361           0 :         report_bad_attribute_target(es_warning, ap);

   12363             :     }  /* for */

   12367           0 :     attach_attributes(gnu_list, (char*)dps->type, iek_type);

   12376             : 
   12377       78380 : void type_name_full(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   12378             : /*
   12379             : Scan a type-name (a sequence of specifiers optionally followed by an abstract
   12380             : declarator) and record information about it in *dps.  In particular, dps->type
   12381             : returns the representation of the type.  Callers can constrain the type by
   12382             : setting certain fields in *dps (e.g., to disallow variably modified types).
   12383             : See type_name for a convenient way to scan type names (via this function) in
   12384             : common cases.
   12385             : */
   12386             : {
   12387       78380 :   a_decl_flag_set              dsi_flags, di_flags;
   12388             : 
   12389       78380 :   db_enter(3, "type_name_full");
   12390       78380 :   set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
   12391       78380 :   dps->is_type_name = TRUE;
   12392       78380 :   dps->trailing_return_type_allowed = trailing_return_types_enabled;
   12393       78380 :   copy_source_position(pos_curr_token, dps->start_pos);
   12394       78380 :   dsi_flags = DSI_TYPE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED | DSI_NO_REAL_DECLARATOR;
   12395       78380 :   if (dps->is_trailing_return_type) {
   12396             :     /* When scanning a C++11 trailing return type, top-level class definitions
   12397             :        should not be considered.  E.g., in "[]()->struct S {}" the "{}" is
   12398             :        considered to be the lambda body; not the definition of S. */
   12399         449 :     dsi_flags |= DSI_NO_TAG_DEFINITION;
   12400             :   }  /* if */
   12401             :   /* Allow specifier attributes. */
   12402       78380 :   if (std_attributes_enabled)  dsi_flags |= DSI_STD_ATTRIBUTES_ALLOWED;
   12403       78380 :   if (gnu_attributes_enabled) dsi_flags |= DSI_GNU_ATTRIBUTES_ALLOWED;
   12404       78380 :   decl_specifiers(dsi_flags, dps, (a_decl_pos_block_ptr)NULL);
   12405       78380 :   check_assertion(dps->type != NULL);
   12406       78380 :   if (!(dps->dso_flags & DSO_HAS_EXPLICIT_TYPE_SPECIFIER)) {
   12407             :     /* Missing type specifier. */
   12408           0 :     report_implicit_int(&dps->start_pos, dps->specifiers_type);
   12409             :   }  /* if */
   12410       78380 :   (skip_typerefs(dps->type))->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
   12411             :   /* Note -- the check for dangling_type_specifier is not relevant here. */
   12412       78380 :   if (is_abstract_declarator_start()) {
   12413             :     /* A declarator follows the type specifiers. */
   12414        4157 :     di_flags = DI_ABSTRACT_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED | DI_QUALIFIED_NAME_ALLOWED;

   12418             :          we turn on DI_VLA_ASTERISK_ALLOWED and check for the error case
   12419             :          once the scan has been completed. */
   12420         551 :       di_flags |= DI_VLA_ALLOWED | DI_VLA_ASTERISK_ALLOWED;
   12421             :     }  /* if */
   12422        4157 :     declarator(di_flags, dps, /*member_parent_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   12423             :                (a_symbol_locator *)NULL, (a_func_info_block_ptr)NULL,
   12424             :                (a_decl_pos_block_ptr)NULL);

   12426             :       /* VLA checking was done. */
   12427         551 :       if (is_array_type(dps->type) &&

   12430             :            one of its dimensions. */
   12431           0 :         pos_error(ec_vla_with_unspecified_bound_not_allowed, &dps->start_pos);
   12432             :       }  /* if */
   12433             :     }  /* if */
   12434             :   }  /* if */
   12435       78380 :   if (!C_mode()) {
   12436       77268 :     check_use_of_placeholder_type(dps);

   12440       78380 :       is_unknown_type(dps->type)) {

   12442             :        hence an error type should be returned.  If the type is a cfront-style

   12458             : 
   12459       75151 : void check_type_definition_in_type_name(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   12460             : /*
   12461             : dps describes a type-name scanned by type_name_full.  In C++ mode, issue an
   12462             : error if the specifiers in the type-name defined a class or enum type.  (Early
   12463             : GNU C++ modes are an exception: They do allow such definitions.  However, if
   12464             : lambdas are enabled in such a mode, we do not emulate that g++ extension to
   12465             : avoid problems with closure types in function prototype scopes.  Similarly, we
   12466             : don't permit type definitions at all in the type-names of alias templates to
   12467             : avoid inconsistencies later on.)
   12468             : */
   12469             : {
   12470       75151 :   if ((dps->dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING) != 0 && !C_mode() &&
   12471           0 :       !(gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400 && !lambdas_enabled &&
   12472           0 :         !dps->is_alias_template_type)) {
   12473           0 :     pos_error(ec_type_definition_not_allowed, &dps->start_pos);
   12474           0 :     dps->type = error_type();
   12475             :   }  /* if */
   12476       75151 : }  /* check_type_definition_in_type_name */
   12477             :

   12479         675 : void type_name(a_type_ptr  *p_type)

   12494        2721 : a_type_ptr scan_type_for_cast(a_boolean  const_expr_context,
   12495             :                               a_boolean  *explicit_cv_qualifiers,
   12496             :                               a_boolean  *type_definition)
   12497             : /*

   12499             : return a pointer to its representation.  If explicit_cv_qualifiers is non-NULL,
   12500             : return in *explicit_cv_qualifiers whether the type included explicit top-level

   12502             : whether the scanned type specifiers included a class or enum definition;

   12566             : 
   12567         129 : void new_type_name(a_decl_parse_state  *state,
   12568             :                    a_boolean           is_parenthesized)
   12569             : /*
   12570             : Scan a C++ new-type-name or a parenthesized type-name that may appear in a
   12571             : "new" expression, and return a pointer to the type through state->type.
   12572             : *state also records various aspects of the type name parsing process (in
   12573             : particular, information about any use of the "auto" specifier).
   12574             : The syntax is:
   12575             : 
   12576             :    new-type-id:
   12577             :               type-specifier-seq new-declarator(opt)
   12578             : 
   12579             :    new-declarator:
   12580             :               ptr-operator new-declarator(opt)
   12581             :               noptr-new-declarator
   12582             : 
   12583             :    noptr-new-declarator:
   12584             :               [ expression ]
   12585             :               noptr-new-declarator [ constant-expression ]
   12586             : 
   12587             : This syntax allows only a restricted form of types, but other types can be
   12588             : specified by enclosing a type-name in parentheses.  If is_parenthesized is
   12589             : TRUE, the caller has already trapped the left parenthesis for such a
   12590             : construct.  The parenthesis is also checked from within this routine if
   12591             : is_parenthesized comes in FALSE.
   12592             : */
   12593             : {
   12594         129 :   a_type_ptr                  complete_type, new_type_ptr;
   12595         129 :   a_type_ptr                  derived_type, bottom_derived_type;
   12596         129 :   a_decl_flag_set             dsi_flags;
   12597         129 :   a_decl_pos_block            decl_pos_block;
   12598         129 :   a_boolean                   rparen_in_new_declarator = FALSE;
   12599             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   12600         129 :   a_boolean                   end_pos_set = FALSE;
   12601             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   12602             : 
   12603         129 :   db_enter(3, "new_type_name");
   12604             :   /* Check for the parenthesized form. */
   12605         129 :   if (!is_parenthesized && curr_token == tok_lparen) {
   12606           0 :     is_parenthesized = TRUE;
   12607           0 :     (void)get_token();
   12608             :   }  /* if */
   12609         129 :   if (is_parenthesized) add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
   12610         129 :   set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
   12611         129 :   clear_decl_pos_block(&decl_pos_block);
   12612         129 :   copy_source_position(pos_curr_token, state->start_pos);
   12613         129 :   dsi_flags = DSI_TYPE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED | DSI_IS_NEW_TYPE_NAME |
   12614             :               DSI_NO_REAL_DECLARATOR;
   12615         129 :   decl_specifiers(dsi_flags, state, &decl_pos_block);
   12616         129 :   if (state->dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING) {
   12617             :     /* Definition of a class, struct, union, or enum type is not allowed. */
   12618           0 :     pos_error(ec_type_definition_not_allowed, &state->start_pos);
   12619         129 :   } else if (!(state->dso_flags & DSO_HAS_EXPLICIT_TYPE_SPECIFIER)) {
   12620             :     /* Missing type specifier. */
   12621           0 :     report_implicit_int(&error_position, state->specifiers_type);
   12622             :   }  /* if */
   12623         129 :   if (state->type != NULL) {
   12624         129 :     (skip_typerefs(state->type))->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
   12625             :   }  /* if */
   12626         129 :   if (gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400 && is_parenthesized &&
   12627           0 :       curr_token == tok_rparen && next_token() == tok_lbracket) {
   12628             :     /* GNU compilers accept new-expressions like "new (int)[n]" where the
   12629             :        "[n]" is part of the type specifier.  (It also accepts forms like
   12630             :        "new (int[n])[3]", which are handled in the call to declarator
   12631             :        below.) */
   12632           0 :     rparen_in_new_declarator = TRUE;
   12633           0 :     is_parenthesized = FALSE;
   12634           0 :     (void)get_token();
   12635           0 :     remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);
   12636             :   }  /* if */
   12637             :   /* Note -- the check for dangling_type_specifier is not relevant here. */
   12638         129 :   if (is_parenthesized) {
   12639             :     /* In the parenthesized form, the full declarator syntax is allowed. */
   12640           0 :     if (is_abstract_declarator_start()) {
   12641           0 :       declarator(DI_ABSTRACT_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED |
   12642             :                     DI_QUALIFIED_NAME_ALLOWED |
   12643             :                     DI_DIMENSION_EXPRESSION_ALLOWED,
   12644             :                  state, /*member_parent_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   12645             :                  (a_symbol_locator *)NULL, (a_func_info_block_ptr)NULL,
   12646             :                  &decl_pos_block);
   12647             :     }  /* if */
   12648           0 :     if (state->do_flags & DO_RPAREN_IN_NEW_DECLARATOR) {
   12649             :       /* We parsed something like "new (int[n])[3]" in a GNU C++ mode.  The
   12650             :          right parenthesis was consumed as part of declarator processing. */
   12651           0 :       check_assertion(gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400);
   12652             :     } else {
   12653             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   12654           0 :       if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
   12655             :         /* Remember the right parenthesis position as the end position. */
   12656           0 :         curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
   12657           0 :         end_pos_set = TRUE;

   12785        8768 : a_boolean scan_conversion_operator(
   12786             :                              a_boolean                        is_class_member,
   12787             :                              a_parent_class_or_namespace_ptr  parent,
   12788             :                              a_type_ptr                       field_sel_type)
   12789             : /*
   12790             : The current token is "operator".  If it is followed by the start of a type
   12791             : name we have an identifier for a conversion operator -- scan the whole
   12792             : construct, update the locator, and return TRUE.  If it doesn't, return FALSE.
   12793             : If the class or namespace pointed to by parent is not NULL then push a class
   12794             : or namespace reactivation scope before scanning the type name of the
   12795             : conversion operator.  is_class_member is TRUE if the parent points to a class,

   12815             :      don't know what kind of operator we are scanning until we call

   12955         353 : a_type_ptr type_keyword(void)
   12956             : /*
   12957             : If the current token is a type keyword (e.g., int, long); return the type
   12958             : indicated by the keyword, otherwise, return NULL.  This is used in scanning
   12959             : a simple-type-name for C++ functional-notation casts.  The current token is
   12960             : not advanced.  Note that this routine does not deal with identifiers that
   12961             : are defined as types, only keywords; it also does not accept multi-token
   12962             : types, e.g., "unsigned int".  See ARM 7.1.6 and 5.2.3.
   12963             : */
   12964             : {
   12965         353 :   a_type_ptr type;
   12966             : 
   12967         353 :   check_assertion(!C_mode());
   12968         353 :   switch (curr_token) {
   12969           8 :     case tok_char:
   12970           8 :       type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_char);
   12971           8 :       break;
   12972           8 :     case tok_short:
   12973           8 :       type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_short);
   12974           8 :       break;
   12975          67 :     case tok_int:
   12976             :     case tok_signed:
   12977          67 :       type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   12978          67 :       break;
   12979           0 :     case tok_long:
   12980           0 :       type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_long);
   12981           0 :       break;
   12982           0 :     case tok_unsigned:
   12983           0 :       type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_int);
   12984           0 :       break;
   12985           0 :     case tok_float:
   12986           0 :       type = float_type((a_float_kind)fk_float);
   12987           0 :       break;
   12988           0 :     case tok_double:
   12989           0 :       type = float_type((a_float_kind)fk_double);
   12990           0 :       break;
   12991          12 :     case tok_void:
   12992          12 :       type = void_type();
   12993          12 :       break;
   12994           0 :     case tok_wchar_t:
   12995           0 :       type = wchar_t_type();
   12996           0 :       break;
   12997         258 :     case tok_bool:
   12998         258 :       type = bool_type();
   12999         258 :       break;
   13000           0 :     case tok_char16_t:
   13001           0 :       type = char16_t_type();
   13002           0 :       break;
   13003           0 :     case tok_char32_t:
   13004           0 :       type = char32_t_type();

   13028             :     default:

   13036       24402 : void record_lint_argsused_and_varargs_state(a_symbol_ptr  rout_sym)

   13075             : 
   13076             : /* ARGSUSED */ /* sp is required for pragma processing functions of type
   13077             :                   a_next_construct_pragma_function. */
   13078           0 : void record_arg_pragma(a_pending_pragma_ptr  ppp,
   13079             :                        a_symbol_ptr          sym,
   13080             :                        a_statement_ptr       sp)
   13081             : /*
   13082             : A pragma indicating special argument checking (e.g., for printf args) has
   13083             : been specified immediately before the current declaration.  If the current
   13084             : declaration declares a function, remember the pragma kind in the function
   13085             : type, so that it can be referenced during argument processing.
   13086             : */

   13139             : 
   13140         422 : static a_boolean scan_name_linkage_string(a_name_linkage_kind  *kind)
   13141             : /*
   13142             : Scan the string portion of a linkage specification (extern "C", extern "C++",
   13143             : etc.).  The current token is the string.  Look it up in the set of strings
   13144             : that may appear in a linkage specification, and if the lookup is successful
   13145             : return TRUE and set *kind to the corresponding name-linkage kind.
   13146             : */
   13147             : {
   13148         422 :   a_boolean            err = FALSE;
   13149         422 :   a_name_linkage_kind  local_kind;
   13150             : 
   13151             :   /* ARM 7.4 specifies that the strings "C" and "C++" must be supported,
   13152             :      but that implementations are permitted to add others, such as "Ada"
   13153             :      or "FORTRAN".  If changes are made here to support other strings, be
   13154             :      sure to update the name linkage kind enumeration. */
   13155         422 :   if (is_error_constant(&const_for_curr_token)) {
   13156             :     /* There must have been an error in scanning the string literal (e.g.,
   13157             :        no closing '"'. */
   13158             :     err = TRUE;
   13159             :   } else {
   13160             :     /* Look for the predefined string ("C++", "C", ...) which the current
   13161             :        token matches. */
   13162         612 :     for (local_kind = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;
   13163         612 :          (int)local_kind < (int)nlk_last;
   13164         190 :          local_kind = (a_name_linkage_kind)(local_kind + 1)) {
   13165         612 :       if (eq_constants(&const_for_curr_token,
   13166         612 :                        &name_linkage_constants[(int)local_kind])) {
   13167             :         /* Found a matching linkage kind string. */
   13168             :         break;
   13169             :       }  /* if */
   13170             :     }  /* for */
   13171         422 :     if (local_kind != (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_last) {
   13172             :       /* Return the name-linkage kind to the caller. */
   13173         422 :       *kind = local_kind;
   13174             :     } else {
   13175             :       /* Bad linkage kind. */
   13176           0 :       pos_error(ec_bad_linkage_specifier, &error_position);
   13177           0 :       err = TRUE;
   13178             :     }  /* if */
   13179             :   }  /* if */
   13180             :   /* Return success status to the caller. */
   13181         422 :   return !err;
   13182             : }  /* scan_name_linkage_string */
   13183             : 
   13184             : 
   13185         422 : static void linkage_specification(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   13186             : /*
   13187             : The caller has determined that we are at the start of a C++ linkage
   13188             : specification -- that is, the current token is "extern" and it is followed
   13189             : by a string literal.  The syntax is:
   13190             : 
   13191             :   linkage-specification:
   13192             :       extern string-literal { declaration-list    }
   13193             :                                               opt
   13194             :       extern string-literal declaration
   13195             : 
   13196             : Since linkage specifications nest, the current linkage specifier is saved
   13197             : in a local variable, the new one is established by updating a global
   13198             : variable, the declaration(s) are processed, and then the original linkage
   13199             : specifier is restored.  dps describes the linkage-specification declaration.
   13200             : */
   13201             : {
   13202         422 :   a_name_linkage_kind  kind;
   13203         422 :   a_boolean            err = FALSE;
   13204         422 :   a_source_range       linkage_spec_range;
   13205             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && GENERATE_LINKAGE_SPEC_BLOCKS
   13206             :   a_constant_ptr       string_constant = local_constant();
   13207             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && GENERATE_LINKAGE_SPEC_BLOCKS */
   13208             : 
   13209         422 :   db_enter(3, "linkage_specification");
   13210         422 :   if (decl_scope_level != depth_innermost_namespace_scope) {
   13211           0 :     pos_error(ec_linkage_specifier_not_allowed, &error_position);
   13212           0 :     err = TRUE;
   13213             :   }  /* if */
   13214         422 :   linkage_spec_range.start = dps->start_pos;
   13215             :   /* Advance to the string literal. */
   13216         422 :   (void)get_token();
   13217         422 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_string_literal);
   13218             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && GENERATE_LINKAGE_SPEC_BLOCKS
   13219             :   *string_constant = const_for_curr_token;
   13220             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && GENERATE_LINKAGE_SPEC_BLOCKS */
   13221             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   13222         422 :   linkage_spec_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   13223             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   13224             :   /* ARM 7.4 specifies that the strings "C" and "C++" must be supported,
   13225             :      but that implementations are permitted to add others, such as "Ada"
   13226             :      or "FORTRAN".  If changes are made here to support other strings, be
   13227             :      sure to update the name linkage kind enumeration. */

   13231             :        the default name linkage kind unchanged.  But to simplify processing,
   13232             :        the push and pop will still be done. */

   13236         422 :   push_name_linkage(kind);

   13238         422 :   (void)get_token();
   13239             :   /* If a brace enclosed declaration list follows, call declaration
   13240             :      repeatedly.  If no brace follows, call declaration just once to pick
   13241             :      up the rest of the current declaration. */
   13242         422 :   if (curr_token == tok_lbrace) {
   13243             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && GENERATE_LINKAGE_SPEC_BLOCKS
   13244             :     /* Add a source sequence entry to indicate the start of the block (with a
   13245             :        matching end-of-construct entry to follow below). */
   13246             :     a_linkage_spec_block_ptr  lsbp = alloc_linkage_spec_block();
   13247             :     lsbp->name_string = move_local_constant_to_il(&string_constant);

   13251             :                                 (an_il_entry_kind)iek_linkage_spec_block);  
   13252             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && GENERATE_LINKAGE_SPEC_BLOCKS */
   13253             :     /* Issue diagnostics on pragmas that are trying to bind to the
   13254             :        extern "C" (or whatever) construct. */
   13255         305 :     cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   13256             :     /* Advance past the left brace. */
   13257         305 :     (void)get_token();
   13258         305 :     add_stop_token(tok_rbrace);
   13259             :     /* Go through the declarations. */
   13260       11711 :     while (curr_token != tok_rbrace && curr_token != tok_end_of_source) {
   13261       11406 :       a_param_id_ptr  param_id_list = NULL;
   13262       11406 :       if (!dps->is_lambda && !dps->is_struct_binding_decl) {
   13263       11406 :         param_id_list = dps->variant.param_id_list;

   13285             :        but don't advance past it -- that is handled in translation_unit. */

   13287         305 :     if (curr_token != tok_rbrace) {
   13288           0 :       pos_error(ec_exp_rbrace, &pos_curr_token);
   13289             :     } else {
   13290             :       /* Advance past right brace.  If the current declaration is a top-level
   13291             :          declaration, set a global flag to enable checking for a header

   13335         288 : static a_boolean is_invalid_catch_type(a_type_ptr         type,
   13336             :                                        a_source_position  *pos)
   13337             : /*
   13338             : Check whether the given type is a valid catch type: incomplete types, pointers
   13339             : and references to incomplete types and abstract class types are not valid.
   13340             : Issue diagnostics as appropriate at the given position.  Return TRUE if the
   13341             : given type should not be used for error recovery purposes.
   13342             : */

   13344         288 :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
   13345             : 
   13346         288 :   if (vla_enabled && is_variably_modified_type(type)) {
   13347           0 :     pos_error(ec_vla_not_allowed, pos);
   13348           0 :     result = TRUE;

   13350           0 :     pos_error(incomplete_type_err_code(type), pos);
   13351           0 :     result = TRUE;

   13353           0 :              !is_template_param_type(type_pointed_to(type))) {

   13355             :        being an lvalue reference due to the "reference collapsing rules".  We

   13387             : 
   13388         802 : void handler_declaration(a_statement_ptr     try_block_stmt,
   13389             :                          a_source_position*  catch_pos,
   13390             :                          a_boolean           is_function_try_block)
   13391             : /*
   13392             : Process a handler declaration:
   13393             : 
   13394             :   "catch" "(" exception-declaration ")" compound-statement
   13395             : 
   13396             : try_block_stmt is a pointer to the try-block statement to which the catch
   13397             : clause is to be attached.  catch_pos is the source position of "catch".
   13398             : is_function_try_block is TRUE if this is a function try block, FALSE for
   13399             : a normal try.
   13400             : */
   13401             : {
   13402         802 :   a_handler_ptr                handler, prev_handler;
   13403         802 :   a_type_ptr                   type_ptr = NULL;

   13413             :      same as that of the handler's compound statement block. */

   13691             : 
   13692             : 
   13693             : #if !GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

   13695             : #endif /* !GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS && !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13696           0 : an_asm_entry_ptr asm_declaration(a_boolean         asm_decl_allowed,
   13697             :                                  a_boolean         is_asm_statement,
   13698             :                                  an_attribute_ptr  *p_attributes)
   13699             : /*
   13700             : Scan an asm declaration, create an entry to represent it in the IL, and
   13701             : return a pointer to the asm entry.  asm_decl_allowed is FALSE if an error
   13702             : should be issued.  is_asm_statement is TRUE if this asm declaration appears
   13703             : inside a function (and will therefore be associated an stmk_asm statement
   13704             : entry), FALSE otherwise.  An asm declaration is specified as follows in the
   13705             : ARM:
   13706             : 
   13707             :   asm ( string-literal ) ;
   13708             : 
   13709             : It can appear at file scope, function scope, and block scope.  In C mode,
   13710             : where declarations and executable statements may not be mingled, an asm
   13711             : "declaration" at function or block scope is always treated as executable.
   13712             : 
   13713             : In Microsoft mode support is provided for additional syntax:
   13714             : 
   13715             :   __asm { asm-instruction-list } ;opt
   13716             :   __asm asm-instruction ;opt
   13717             : 
   13718             : where an asm-instruction-list is a semi-colon-delimited list of asm
   13719             : instructions (unquoted).
   13720             : 
   13721             : Microsoft asm blocks are converted into a string when the __asm token
   13722             : is encountered.  The string is pointed to by curr_token_asm_string and
   13723             : is saved and restored as needed by the token caching mechanism.
   13724             : 
   13725             : In GNU C and C++ modes support is provided for additional syntax:
   13726             : 
   13727             :   asm volatile    goto    ( string-literal : operand-spec )
   13728             :               opt     opt
   13729             : 
   13730             : This may appear only at function or block scope.  The operand-spec tells
   13731             : the compiler how to map C/C++ variables into and out of the assembly
   13732             : instruction's operands.
   13733             : 
   13734             : *p_attributes points to any prefix attributes (NULL if none).  Such attributes
   13735             : are invalid: If *p_attributes is non-NULL issue an error and set *p_attributes
   13736             : to NULL.
   13737             : */
   13738             : {
   13739           0 :   a_constant_ptr            asm_string = local_constant();
   13740           0 :   an_asm_entry_ptr          ap = NULL;
   13741           0 :   a_source_position         asm_pos;
   13742             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13743           0 :   a_boolean                 gnu_asm_form = FALSE;
   13744           0 :   a_boolean                 is_volatile = FALSE;
   13745           0 :   a_boolean                 has_volatile_keyword = FALSE;
   13746           0 :   a_boolean                 is_asm_goto = FALSE;
   13747           0 :   an_asm_operand_ptr        operands = NULL;
   13748           0 :   a_named_register_list_ptr clobbers = NULL;
   13749           0 :   a_label_list_ptr          labels = NULL;
   13750           0 :   int                       number_of_constraints = 0;
   13751             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13752           0 :   a_boolean                 seen_tok_colon_colon = FALSE;
   13753           0 :   a_boolean                 err = FALSE;

   13755           0 :   db_enter(3, "asm_declaration");

   13906           0 :     if (!is_asm_statement) {

   13910           0 :       add_to_asm_entries_list(ap);

   13913             :          update_source_sequence_list directly. */

   13915             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   13916             :     }  /* if */
   13917             :   } else {
   13918           0 :     release_local_constant(&asm_string);

   13924             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

   13926             : void for_each_iterator_declaration(a_statement_ptr for_each_statement)
   13927             : /*
   13928             : Scan a "for each" iteration variable declaration.  "for each" statements are
   13929             : allowed only in Microsoft mode and some types of "for each" are allowed only
   13930             : in C++/CLI mode.  Syntax:
   13931             : 
   13932             :   for each (type-specifier-seq declarator in assignment-expression)
   13933             :             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   13934             : 
   13935             : Only the part marked is scanned in this routine.
   13936             : */
   13937             : {
   13938             :   a_decl_flag_set              dsi_flags;

   13946             :   a_decl_parse_state           state;

   13948             :   db_enter(3, "for_each_iterator_declaration");

   13950             :      not introduce a new class or enumeration. */

   14076          56 : a_variable_ptr check_condition_declaration(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   14077             : /*
   14078             : A declaration was just scanned with *dps representing the state at the end of
   14079             : that processing.  We now know that the declaration is a
   14080             : "condition-declaration": Check that the constraints for such a declaration are
   14081             : satisfied and issue diagnostics accordingly.  E.g.:
   14082             : 
   14083             :     if (static int i = 3) {}
   14084             : 
   14085             : Here the constraint that no storage class specifiers be provided is violated,
   14086             : and this routine issues an error in that case.
   14087             : 
   14088             : Return the variable being declared (if there were no severe errors) or an
   14089             : error variable generated for error recovery purposes.
   14090             : */
   14091             : {
   14092          56 :   a_symbol_ptr    sym = dps->sym;
   14093          56 :   a_variable_ptr  vp = NULL;
   14094          56 :   a_source_position  *diag_pos = &dps->declarator_pos;
   14095             : 
   14096          56 :   if (diag_pos->seq == 0) {
   14097           0 :     diag_pos = &dps->start_pos;
   14098             :   }  /* if */
   14099          56 :   if (sym == NULL) {
   14100           0 :     if (dps->type != NULL && is_error_type(dps->type)) {
   14101           0 :       expect_error();
   14102             :     } else {
   14103           0 :       pos_error((dps->dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING) ?
   14104             :                       ec_condition_does_not_declare_a_variable

   14106             :                  diag_pos);
   14107             :     }  /* if */

   14110          56 :   } else if (dps->secondary_declarator) {
   14111           0 :     pos_error(ec_condition_with_multiple_declarators, diag_pos);
   14112             :   } else {
   14113          56 :     vp = sym->variant.variable.ptr;
   14114          56 :     if (((strict_ansi_mode || clang_mode || gpp_mode) ?

   14116           0 :             : (vp->storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_auto)) ||

   14118           0 :       pos_error(ec_storage_class_not_allowed, &dps->specifiers_pos);
   14119           0 :       vp = NULL;
   14120           0 :       goto done_with_checks;

   14164           0 : static void make_static_assert_string_for_output(a_constant_ptr error_string)
   14165             : /*
   14166             : Create a character string from the string constant entry associated with
   14167             : error_string.  The string constant entry may represent a wide-character
   14168             : literal, but the output will be restricted to the basic source character
   14169             : set -- other characters are replaced by a '?'.  The generated string (which
   14170             : is meant to be used in a diagnostic) is stored in temp_text_buffer.
   14171             : */
   14172             : {
   14173           0 :   unsigned int    char_size;
   14174           0 :   a_const_char    *ptr;
   14175           0 :   a_targ_size_t   con_byte_len, msg_len, k;
   14176             : 
   14177           0 :   check_assertion(error_string != NULL &&
   14178             :                   error_string->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string);
   14179           0 :   char_size = (unsigned int)character_size[error_string->character_kind];
   14180             :   /* Allocate the number of characters needed (plus one in case the constant
   14181             :      doesn't include a trailing NULL). */
   14182           0 :   con_byte_len = error_string->variant.string.length;
   14183           0 :   msg_len = con_byte_len/char_size;
   14184           0 :   ensure_temp_text_buffer_space(msg_len+1);
   14185             :   /* Extract the characters from the constant. */
   14186           0 :   ptr = error_string->variant.string.value;
   14187           0 :   for (k = 0; k < msg_len; ++k, ptr += char_size) {
   14188           0 :     unsigned long  char_val = extract_character_from_string(ptr, char_size);
   14189           0 :     if (char_val == 0) {
   14190             :       break;
   14191           0 :     } else if (char_val > CHAR_MAX ||
   14192           0 :                is_nonstandard_character((char)char_val)) {
   14193           0 :       temp_text_buffer[k] = '?';
   14194             :     } else {
   14195           0 :       temp_text_buffer[k] = (char)char_val;
   14196             :     }  /* if */
   14197             :   }  /* for */
   14198             :   /* Append a null character. */
   14199           0 :   temp_text_buffer[k] = '\0';

   14202             : 
   14203         156 : void static_assert_declaration(a_boolean  leave_semicolon)
   14204             : /*
   14205             : Parse a construct of the form
   14206             :         static_assert ( <constant-expression> , <string-literal> ) ;
   14207             :           or (when terse_static_assert_enabled is TRUE)
   14208             :         static_assert ( <constant-expression> ) ;
   14209             : Issue an error incorporating the string literal (if present) if the constant-
   14210             : expression is "false".  If leave_semicolon is TRUE, do not consume the
   14211             : final token.
   14212             : */
   14213             : {
   14214         156 :   a_constant_ptr     assert_con = local_constant();
   14215         156 :   a_source_position  pos;

   14217         156 :   a_boolean          err = FALSE;
   14218             : 
   14219         156 :   cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   14220             :   /* Record the construct's position and verify the introductory tokens. */
   14221         156 :   pos = pos_curr_token;
   14222         156 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_static_assert);
   14223         156 :   (void)get_token();

   14225         156 :   add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
   14226         156 :   add_stop_token(tok_comma);

   14229             :      to bool. */

   14233             :     /* This appears to be a terse static_assert (i.e., one with only a
   14234             :        single argument). */
   14235           0 :     if (!terse_static_assert_enabled) {
   14236           0 :       pos_diagnostic(es_discretionary_error,
   14237             :                      ec_terse_static_assert_not_enabled, &pos_curr_token);
   14238             :     }  /* if */

   14240             :     /* Scan the second argument, which must be a string literal. */
   14241         156 :     (void)required_token(tok_comma, ec_exp_comma);
   14242         156 :     if (curr_token != tok_string_literal) {
   14243           0 :       syntax_error(ec_exp_string_literal);

   14261           0 :       expect_error();

   14276         156 :       a_static_assertion_ptr  entry = alloc_static_assertion();

   14295          50 : void add_to_inline_namespace_list(a_scope_stack_entry_ptr       ssep,
   14296             :                                   a_using_decl_ptr              udp)
   14297             : /*
   14298             : Add the using-directive specified by udp to the inline namespace list of the
   14299             : namespace scope specified by ssep.
   14300             : */
   14301             : {
   14302          50 :   a_namespace_list_entry_ptr         nlep = alloc_namespace_list_entry();
   14303          50 :   a_scope_pointers_block_ptr         spbp;
   14304             : 
   14305          50 :   check_assertion(is_file_or_namespace_scope(ssep));
   14306          50 :   spbp = get_pointers_block_for_scope(ssep->il_scope);
   14307          50 :   nlep->ptr = (a_namespace_ptr)udp->entity.ptr;
   14308          50 :   nlep->next = spbp->inline_namespaces;
   14309          50 :   spbp->inline_namespaces = nlep;
