   14311             : 
   14312             : 
   14313             : #if !GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   14314             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- attributes is not used in this case. */
   14315             : #endif /* !GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   14316          66 : void make_using_directive(a_namespace_ptr    nsp,
   14317             :                           a_scope_depth      depth,
   14318             :                           a_source_position  *pos,
   14319             :                           a_boolean          compiler_generated,
   14320             :                           a_boolean          inline_namespace,
   14321             :                           an_attribute_ptr   attributes)
   14322             : /*
   14323             : Create a using-decl entry for a using-directive that specifies the indicated
   14324             : namespace, add it to the list of using-decl entries for the scope specified
   14325             : by depth, and "activate" it to assure that inactive-list symbols belonging
   14326             : to the namespace will be found during name lookup.
   14327             : 
   14328             : compiler_generated is TRUE for implicit using-directives created for
   14329             : unnamed namespaces, and for certain using-directives created to emulate
   14330             : a Microsoft bug.  inline_namespace is TRUE if this using-directive is
   14331             : being created to indicate that the specified namespace is an inline namespace
   14332             : of the current namespace.  attributes is a list of attributes specified on
   14333             : this using-directive.
   14334             : */
   14335             : {
   14336          66 :   a_using_decl_ptr              udp;
   14337          66 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr       ssep;
   14338             : 
   14339             :   /* Create the using-directive entry. */
   14340          66 :   udp = alloc_using_decl();
   14341          66 :   udp->position = *pos;
   14342          66 :   udp->entity.kind = (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_namespace;
   14343          66 :   udp->entity.ptr = (char *)nsp;
   14344          66 :   udp->is_using_directive = TRUE;
   14345          66 :   udp->compiler_generated = compiler_generated;
   14346          66 :   udp->inline_namespace = inline_namespace;
   14347          66 :   ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
   14348          66 :   if (inline_namespace) {
   14349             :     /* For inline namespaces, add the using-directive to the inline namespace
   14350             :        list of the enclosing namespace. */
   14351          50 :     add_to_inline_namespace_list(ssep, udp);
   14352             :   }  /* if */
   14353          66 :   if (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_namespace ||
   14354          66 :       ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_namespace_extension ||
   14355             :       ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_file) {
   14356          66 :     udp->decl_sequence_number = ++decl_seq_counter;
   14357             :   } else {
   14358             :     /* For local scope using-directives, assign an effective declaration
   14359             :        sequence number that makes the using-directive always visible. */
   14360           0 :     udp->decl_sequence_number = FIRST_DECL_SEQUENCE_NUMBER;
   14361             :   }  /* if */
   14362          66 :   attach_attributes(attributes, (char*)udp, iek_using_decl);
   14363          66 :   add_to_using_decls_list(udp, depth);
   14364             :   /* Activate it. */
   14365          66 :   add_active_using_directive(udp, depth);
   14366             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   14367          66 :   if (!compiler_generated) {
   14368             :     /* Not a compiler-generated using directive for an unnamed namespace. */
   14369          16 :     add_to_source_sequence_list((char *)udp, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_using_decl);
   14370             :   }  /* if */
   14371             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   14372          66 : }  /* make_using_directive */
   14373             : 
   14374             : 
   14375          50 : static void add_implicit_using_directive(
   14376             :                                 a_namespace_ptr         nsp,
   14377             :                                 a_boolean               inline_namespace,
   14378             :                                 a_boolean               namespace_pushed)
   14379             : /*
   14380             : Add an implicit using-directive for an unnamed or inline namespace.  nsp
   14381             : is the namespace to be made visible by the using-directive.  inline_namespace
   14382             : is TRUE for an inline namespace, FALSE for an unnamed namespace.
   14383             : namespace_pushed is TRUE if the namespace scope for nsp has already been
   14384             : pushed.
   14385             : */
   14386             : {
   14387             :   /* The model for the initial definition of an unnamed namespace
   14388             :        namespace { ... }
   14389             :      is this:
   14390             :        namespace UNIQUE { }
   14391             :        using namespace UNIQUE;
   14392             :        namespace UNIQUE { ... }
   14393             :      This enables this sort of code to work:
   14394             :        namespace {
   14395             :          int i;
   14396             :          int j = ::i;       // lookup rules find UNIQUE::i
   14397             :        }
   14398             :      The model is implemented by immediately popping the
   14399             :      original definition of the unnamed namespace, inserting the
   14400             :      implicit using directive, and then reopening the namespace as
   14401             :      as an extension.  A similar process is used for inline
   14402             :      namespaces -- an inline namespace using-directive is created in
   14403             :      the namespace containing the inline namespace. */
   14404          50 :   if (namespace_pushed) pop_scope();
   14405             :   /* Do an implicit "using" directive of the unnamed namespace. */
   14406          50 :   make_using_directive(nsp, depth_scope_stack, &pos_curr_token,
   14407             :                        /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE, inline_namespace,
   14408             :                        (an_attribute_ptr)NULL);
   14409          50 :   if (namespace_pushed) {
   14410          50 :     (void)push_namespace_scope((a_scope_kind)sck_namespace_extension, nsp);
   14411          50 :     scope_stack_top().explicitly_declared_namespace_extension = TRUE;
   14412             :   }  /* if */
   14413          50 : }  /* add_implicit_using_directive */
   14414             : 
   14415             : 
   14416             : static void namespace_declaration(a_token_kind      *final_token,
   14417             :                                   a_boolean         in_nested_namespace_decl,
   14418             :                                   a_source_position *nested_namespace_pos,
   14419             :                                   a_symbol_ptr      *ns_definition_sym)
   14420             : /*
   14421             : Scan a namespace declaration, which may be an original namespace definition,
   14422             : an extension namespace definition, an unnamed namespace definition, a
   14423             : nested namespace definition, or a namespace alias definition.  The syntax is:
   14424             : 
   14425             :   named-namespace-definition:
   14426             :     inline opt namespace attribute-specifier-seq opt identifier
   14427             :                                                              { namespace-body }
   14428             : 
   14429             :   unnamed-namespace-definition:
   14430             :     inline opt namespace attribute-specifier-seq opt { namespace-body }
   14431             : 
   14432             :   nested-namespace-definition:
   14433             :     namespace enclosing-namespace-specifier :: identifier { namespace-body }
   14434             : 
   14435             :   namespace-alias-definition:
   14436             :     namespace identifier = qualified-namespace-specifier ;
   14437             : 
   14438             : *final_token is set to tok_semicolon if this is a namespace alias definition
   14439             : and to tok_brace otherwise; the final token is swallowed by the caller.
   14440             : This routine is called recursively (for each segment of a qualified name)
   14441             : for a nested namespace definition.  In those cases, in_nested_namespace_decl
   14442             : is set to TRUE and *nested_namespace_pos is set to the source position of the
   14443             : "namespace" keyword.  On return, *ns_definition_sym is set to the symbol for
   14444             : the (most nested level of the) namespace definition (if it's a definition and
   14445             : NULL otherwise).
   14446             : */
   14447             : {
   14448             :   a_source_position           namespace_pos;
   14449             :   a_source_position           start_pos = pos_curr_token;
   14450             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   14451             :   a_source_position           identifier_end_pos, def_start_pos;
   14452             :   a_decl_position_supplement_ptr
   14453             :                               decl_pos_info = NULL;
   14454             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   14455             :   a_namespace_ptr             nsp = NULL;
   14456             :   a_symbol_ptr                ns_sym = NULL, sym;
   14457             :   a_symbol_locator            locator;
   14458             :   a_boolean                   is_unnamed_namespace = TRUE;
   14459             :   a_boolean                   is_namespace_alias = FALSE;
   14460             :   a_boolean                   is_enclosing_namespace_specifier = FALSE;
   14461             :   a_scope_pointers_block_ptr  pointers_block;
   14462             :   a_boolean                   err = FALSE;
   14463             :   a_symbol_reference_kind     srk_flags = SRK_DECLARATION;
   14464             :   a_boolean                   bad_scope_for_namespace_def = FALSE;
   14465             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr namespace_ssep = NULL;
   14466             :   a_boolean                   namespace_scope_pushed = FALSE;
   14467             :   a_boolean                   initial_decl_of_namespace_std = FALSE;
   14468             :   an_attribute_ptr            attributes = NULL;
   14469             :   a_boolean                   is_inline = FALSE;
   14470             : 
   14471             :   db_enter(3, "namespace_declaration");
   14472             :   *ns_definition_sym = NULL;
   14473             :   if (in_nested_namespace_decl) {
   14474             :     /* A nested namespace declaration is being parsed and at least one segment
   14475             :        has already been processed.  Skip the initial processing associated with
   14476             :        the declaration and go directly to the next segment of the qualified
   14477             :        name.  This processing effectively treats "namespace N1::N2 {}" as
   14478             :        "namespace N1 { namespace N2 {}}". */
   14479             :     is_unnamed_namespace = FALSE;
   14480             :     namespace_pos = *nested_namespace_pos;
   14481             :   } else {
   14482             :     if (is_inline_token()) {
   14483             :       /* This is an inline namespace declaration. */
   14484             :       is_inline = TRUE;
   14485             :       (void)get_token();
   14486             :       check_assertion(curr_token == tok_namespace);
   14487             :     }  /* if */
   14488             :     /* Save the source position of the namespace keyword. */
   14489             :     namespace_pos = pos_curr_token;
   14490             :     /* A namespace declaration is outside the "Embedded C++" subset. */
   14491             :     feature_is_not_part_of_embedded_cplusplus_subset(
   14492             :                                           &pos_curr_token,
   14493             :                                           ec_namespaces_in_embedded_cplusplus);
   14494             :     /* Bypass "namespace". */
   14495             :     (void)get_token();
   14496             :     if (namespace_attributes_enabled) {
   14497             :       /* Scan any standard attributes. */
   14498             :       attributes = scan_attributes(al_namespace);
   14499             :     }  /* if */
   14500             :   }  /* if */
   14501             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   14502             : #if DEBUG
   14503             :   if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed &&
   14504             :       (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("dump_ss_full"))) {
   14505             :     fputs("namespace_declaration: adding empty ss entry\n", f_debug);
   14506             :   }  /* if */
   14507             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   14508             :   { /* Namespace entries are always allocated in file scope memory.  Any
   14509             :        source sequence entry pointing to it must therefore also be allocated
   14510             :        there. */
   14511             :     a_memory_region_number  region_to_switch_back_to;
   14512             :     switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
   14513             :     namespace_ssep = add_empty_source_sequence_entry();
   14514             :     switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
   14515             :   }
   14516             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   14517             :   if (curr_token == tok_identifier) {
   14518             :     /* Save the identifier's locator before bypassing it. */
   14519             :     locator = locator_for_curr_id;
   14520             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   14521             :     identifier_end_pos = end_pos_curr_token;
   14522             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   14523             :     is_unnamed_namespace = FALSE;
   14524             :     (void)get_token();
   14525             :     if (curr_token == tok_colon_colon) {
   14526             :       /* Bypass the "::". */
   14527             :       (void)get_token();
   14528             :       if (nested_namespace_definitions_enabled) {
   14529             :         /* An enclosing namespace specifier in a nested namespace
   14530             :            definition. */
   14531             :         is_enclosing_namespace_specifier = TRUE;
   14532             :         if (curr_token != tok_identifier) {
   14533             :           /* This isn't processed now, but make sure an identifier follows
   14534             :              "::". */
   14535             :           pos_error(ec_exp_identifier, &pos_curr_token);
   14536             :           set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14537             :           err = TRUE;
   14538             :         }  /* if */
   14539             :       } else {
   14540             :         /* A qualified name is not allowed. */
   14541             :         pos_error(ec_qualified_name_not_allowed, &locator.source_position);
   14542             :         set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14543             :         err = TRUE;
   14544             :         while (curr_token == tok_identifier) {
   14545             :           /* Skip the entire qualified name. */
   14546             :           (void)get_token();
   14547             :           if (curr_token == tok_colon_colon) {
   14548             :             (void)get_token();
   14549             :           }  /* if */
   14550             :         }  /* while */
   14551             :       }  /* if */
   14552             :     }  /* if */
   14553             :   } else {
   14554             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   14555             :     identifier_end_pos = null_source_position;
   14556             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   14557             :     if (is_generalized_identifier_start(GID_NO_OPTIONS)) {
   14558             :       /* Check for non-identifier error cases. */
   14559             :       is_unnamed_namespace = FALSE;
   14560             :       locator = locator_for_curr_id;
   14561             :       if (locator.is_error) {
   14562             :         /* An error has already been issued. */
   14563             :         expect_error();
   14564             :       } else if (locator.is_operator_name || locator.is_conversion_name ||
   14565             :                  locator.is_udl_operator_name) {
   14566             :         /* Can't be an operator. */
   14567             :         pos_error(ec_operator_name_not_allowed, &error_position);
   14568             :         set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14569             :         err = TRUE;
   14570             :       } else if (locator.is_qualified_name) {
   14571             :         /* A qualified name is not allowed. */
   14572             :         pos_error(ec_qualified_name_not_allowed, &error_position);
   14573             :         set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14574             :         err = TRUE;
   14575             :       } else {
   14576             :         unexpected_condition();
   14577             :       }  /* if */
   14578             :       /* Skip over bad identifier. */
   14579             :       (void)get_token();
   14580             :     }  /* if */
   14581             :   }  /* if */
   14582             :   if (curr_token == tok_attribute && gnu_attributes_enabled &&
   14583             :       (!gpp_mode || gnu_version >= 40200)) {
   14584             :     *f_last_attribute_link(&attributes) = scan_gnu_attribute_groups(
   14585             :                                                              al_gnu_namespace);
   14586             :   }  /* if */
   14587             :   if (curr_token == tok_lbrace) {
   14588             :     /* A namespace or namespace-extension definition, or the final identifier
   14589             :        in a nested namespace declaration. */
   14590             :   } else if (curr_token == tok_assign && !is_unnamed_namespace) {
   14591             :     if (in_nested_namespace_decl) {
   14592             :       /* Something like "namespace A::B = ...", which is ill-formed.  An
   14593             :          error will be given later. */
   14594             :       expect_error();
   14595             :     } else {
   14596             :       /* This must be a namespace alias definition. */
   14597             :       is_namespace_alias = TRUE;
   14598             :       if (is_inline) {
   14599             :         /* The inline specifier cannot be used on a namespace alias. */
   14600             :         pos_error(ec_inline_on_alias, &start_pos);
   14601             :       }  /* if */
   14602             :     }  /* if */
   14603             :   } else if (is_enclosing_namespace_specifier) {
   14604             :     /* A nested namespace declaration. */
   14605             :     if (is_inline) {
   14606             :       /* The inline specifier cannot be used on a nested namespace. */
   14607             :       pos_error(ec_inline_on_nested_namespace, &start_pos);
   14608             :     }  /* if */
   14609             :   } else {
   14610             :     /* A syntax error */
   14611             :     add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   14612             :     add_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
   14613             :     /* A missing brace error will be issued below in most cases (and in
   14614             :        the remaining cases another error will be issued).  If we haven't
   14615             :        seen a name or attribute yet, we diagnose that at this point. */
   14616             :     if (!is_unnamed_namespace || attributes != NULL) {
   14617             :       expect_error();
   14618             :     } else {
   14619             :       (void)required_token(tok_identifier, ec_exp_identifier);
   14620             :     }  /* if */
   14621             :     remove_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
   14622             :     remove_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   14623             :     set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14624             :     /* Silently ignore any attributes. */
   14625             :     attributes = NULL;
   14626             :   }  /* if */
   14627             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   14628             :   def_start_pos = pos_curr_token;
   14629             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   14630             :   if (attributes != NULL &&
   14631             :       (is_namespace_alias || is_enclosing_namespace_specifier)) {
   14632             :     /* Attributes aren't allowed on namespace aliases or nested namespaces. */
   14633             :     pos_error(ec_attribute_not_allowed, &attributes->position);
   14634             :     attributes = NULL;
   14635             :   }  /* if */
   14636             :   if (depth_scope_stack != depth_innermost_namespace_scope) {
   14637             :     /* The current scope is not the file scope or a namespace scope. */
   14638             :     if (!is_namespace_alias) {
   14639             :       /* This is a namespace definition of some sort, which can only occur
   14640             :          in a file or namespace scope. */
   14641             :       pos_error(ec_namespace_def_not_allowed, &namespace_pos);
   14642             :       set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14643             :       err = TRUE;
   14644             :       bad_scope_for_namespace_def = TRUE;
   14645             :     } else {
   14646             :       /* This is a namespace alias definition, which can also occur in
   14647             :          function and block scopes. */
   14648             :       if (scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].kind != (a_scope_kind)sck_function &&
   14649             :           scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].kind != (a_scope_kind)sck_block) {
   14650             :         pos_error(ec_namespace_alias_def_not_allowed, &namespace_pos);
   14651             :         set_to_error_locator(locator);
   14652             :         err = TRUE;
   14653             :       }  /* if */
   14654             :     }  /* if */
   14655             :   }  /* if */
   14656             :   if (is_unnamed_namespace) {
   14657             :     /* No identifier -- this is an unnamed namespace definition. */
   14658             :     if (!err) {
   14659             :       /* See if this is its first definition in the current scope or if this
   14660             :          is an extension. */
   14661             :       pointers_block =
   14662             :                   assoc_pointers_block_of(&scope_stack[depth_scope_stack]);
   14663             :       ns_sym = pointers_block->unnamed_namespace_sym;
   14664             :       if (ns_sym == NULL) {
   14665             :         /* This is the first definition.  Create the symbol. */
   14666             :         ns_sym = make_unnamed_namespace_symbol(&pos_curr_token);
   14667             :         pointers_block->unnamed_namespace_sym = ns_sym;
   14668             :       } else {
   14669             :         /* A definition for the unnamed namespace has already appeared.  This
   14670             :            definition will extend it, so reuse the symbol that was found. */
   14671             :       }  /* if */
   14672             :       make_locator_for_symbol(ns_sym, &locator);
   14673             :     }  /* if */
   14674             :   } else {
   14675             :     /* A named namespace definition (possibly nested) or a namespace alias.
   14676             :        Look up the identifier (which should be the current token) and see if it
   14677             :        is already a namespace name in the current scope. */
   14678             :     if (!err) {
   14679             :       ns_sym = curr_scope_id_lookup(&locator, IDL_NO_OPTIONS);
   14680             :       if (ns_sym != NULL) {
   14681             :         /* A name was found in the current scope. */
   14682             :         a_boolean  ns_sym_was_alias =
   14683             :                        ns_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace &&
   14684             :                        ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr->is_namespace_alias; 
   14685             : 
   14686             :         if (microsoft_mode && !is_namespace_alias && ns_sym_was_alias) {
   14687             :           /* In Microsoft mode, a namespace alias name can be used to define
   14688             :              a namespace extension for the aliased namespace. */
   14689             :           ns_sym = (a_symbol_ptr)
   14690             :              skip_namespace_aliases(ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr)->
   14691             :                                                     source_corresp.assoc_info;
   14692             :         } else if (gnu_namespace_and_class_in_same_scope &&
   14693             :                    is_tag_symbol(ns_sym) && !locator.is_template_id) {
   14694             :           /* Versions of g++ before 4.3 allow a namespace and class to be
   14695             :              declared with the same name. */
   14696             :           ns_sym = NULL;
   14697             :         } else if (ns_sym->kind != (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace ||
   14698             :                    is_namespace_alias != ns_sym_was_alias) {
   14699             :           /* The namespace name should not conflict with the declaration of
   14700             :              another entity.  Furthermore, an alias should not be redeclared
   14701             :              as a namespace name, nor should a plain namespace name be
   14702             :              redeclared as an alias. */
   14703             :           pos_st_error(ec_id_already_declared, &locator.source_position,
   14704             :                        locator.symbol_header->identifier);
   14705             :           ns_sym = NULL;
   14706             :         }  /* if */
   14707             :       }  /* if */
   14708             :     }  /* if */
   14709             :   }  /* if */
   14710             :   /* The closing right brace or semicolon will be swallowed by the caller. */
   14711             :   *final_token = is_namespace_alias ? tok_semicolon : tok_rbrace;
   14712             :   if (is_namespace_alias) {
   14713             :     /* Bypass the "=". */
   14714             :     (void)get_token();
   14715             :     add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   14716             :     if (!is_decl_qualified_name_start()) {
   14717             :       /* A namespace alias definition requires a (possibly qualified)
   14718             :          namespace or class name to the right of the "=". */
   14719             :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   14720             :       syntax_error(ec_exp_identifier);
   14721             :     } else {
   14722             :       /* Look up the namespace specifier. */
   14723             :       sym = coalesce_and_lookup_generalized_identifier(GID_NO_OPTIONS,
   14724             :                                                        ilm_namespace, &err);
   14725             :       if (!err) {
   14726             :         if (sym != NULL &&
   14727             :             locator_for_curr_id.specific_symbol->kind ==
   14728             :                                   (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace_projection &&
   14729             :             locator_for_curr_id.specific_symbol->ambiguous) {
   14730             :           /* The name for which an alias is being declared is ambiguous. */
   14731             :           sym_error(ec_ambiguous_name, locator_for_curr_id.specific_symbol);
   14732             :         } else if (sym == NULL || sym->kind != (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace) {
   14733             :           /* Either nothing was found or what was found was not a namespace. */
   14734             :           pos_error(ec_missing_namespace_name, &error_position);
   14735             :         } else {
   14736             :           if (ns_sym != NULL &&
   14737             :               ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr != NULL) {
   14738             :             nsp = ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr;
   14739             :             if (skip_namespace_aliases(nsp) ==
   14740             :                      skip_namespace_aliases(sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr)) {
   14741             :               /* Redefining the alias to the same thing. */
   14742             :               record_symbol_declaration(srk_flags, ns_sym,
   14743             :                                         &locator.source_position,
   14744             :                                         namespace_ssep);
   14745             :             } else {
   14746             :               pos_sy_error(ec_already_defined, &locator.source_position,
   14747             :                            ns_sym);
   14748             :             }  /* if */
   14749             :           } else {
   14750             :             if (ns_sym == NULL) {
   14751             :               /* Create a namespace symbol to represent the alias.  Its
   14752             :                  creation was delayed till all the error cases had been
   14753             :                  dispensed with, to avoid creating a symbol with no namespace
   14754             :                  to bind to. */
   14755             :               ns_sym = enter_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace, &locator,
   14756             :                                     depth_scope_stack,
   14757             :                                     /*suppress_redecl_error=*/TRUE);
   14758             :             }  /* if */
   14759             :             /* Now create a namespace entry.  It will point to the namespace
   14760             :                entry that was just looked up. */
   14761             :             nsp = alloc_namespace(/*is_alias=*/TRUE);
   14762             :             nsp->variant.assoc_namespace = sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr;
   14763             :             set_source_corresp(&nsp->source_corresp, ns_sym);
   14764             :             set_namespace_membership(ns_sym, &nsp->source_corresp,
   14765             :                                      (a_namespace_ptr)NULL);
   14766             :             nsp->source_corresp.name_linkage =
   14767             :                                   (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;
   14768             :             ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr = nsp;
   14769             :             add_to_namespaces_list(nsp);
   14770             :             record_symbol_declaration(SRK_DECLARATION | SRK_DEFINITION,
   14771             :                                       ns_sym, &locator.source_position,
   14772             :                                       namespace_ssep);
   14773             :           }  /* if */
   14774             :           mark_referenced(sym, &pos_curr_token);
   14775             :         }  /* if */
   14776             :       }  /* if */
   14777             :       if (!err && ns_sym != NULL) {
   14778             :         /* Do processing required for any pragmas bound to the current
   14779             :            declaration. */
   14780             :         process_curr_construct_pragmas(ns_sym, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   14781             :       } else {
   14782             :         discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   14783             :       }  /* if */
   14784             :       /* Bypass the identifier. */
   14785             :       (void)get_token();
   14786             :     }  /* if */
   14787             :     remove_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   14788             :     if (required_token_no_advance(tok_semicolon, ec_exp_semicolon)) {
   14789             :       /* Closing semicolon was found. */
   14790             :       cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   14791             :     } else {
   14792             :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   14793             :     }  /* if */
   14794             :   } else if (bad_scope_for_namespace_def) {
   14795             :     /* Attempting to define a namespace within something other than the
   14796             :        file scope or a namespace scope.  Ignore all the declarations between
   14797             :        the braces. */
   14798             :     discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   14799             :     if (curr_token == tok_lbrace) {
   14800             :       /* Ignore the namespace definition. */
   14801             :       flush_until_matching_token_full(/*limit_flush=*/FALSE);
   14802             :       /* The closing right brace will be swallowed by the caller. */
   14803             :       *final_token = tok_rbrace;
   14804             :     }  /* if */
   14805             :   } else {
   14806             :     /* Namespace definition. */

   14812             :            Reuse the predeclared symbol. */

   14821             :         /* This is the initial explicit declaration of namespace "__cxxabiv1".
   14822             :            Reuse the predeclared symbol. */

   14825             :         srk_flags |= SRK_DEFINITION;

   14829             :         ns_sym = enter_symbol((a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace, &locator,
   14830             :                               depth_scope_stack,
   14831             :                               /*suppress_redecl_error=*/TRUE);
   14832             :       }  /* if */

   14835             :       /* Original definition -- allocate the namespace entry. */

   14841             :                                (a_namespace_ptr)NULL);

   14843             :                                   (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;

   14845             :       ns_sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr = nsp;
   14846             :       /* Set a flag indicating that this namespace is itself an unnamed
   14847             :          namespace or is enclosed by an unnamed namespace. */

   14849             :           (sym_is_namespace_member(ns_sym) &&

   14856             :       if (!is_enclosing_namespace_specifier) {

   14859             :            only to the most nested namespace. */

   14862             :       if (!ignore_std_namespace || ns_sym != symbol_for_namespace_std) {

   14957             :       process_curr_token_pragmas();

   14959             :         /* Record the symbol of the (most nested) namespace definition. */
   14960             :         *ns_definition_sym = ns_sym;

   14962             :     }  /* if */
   14963             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   14964             :     /* Add a source sequence entry marking the end of the namespace
   14965             :        definition. */

   14967             :                                         (char *)nsp,
   14968             :                                         (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_namespace);
   14969             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   14970             :     if (is_enclosing_namespace_specifier) {
   14971             :       /* Any pragmas are only processed at the bottom of the recursion. */
   14972             :     } else if (required_token_no_advance(tok_rbrace, ec_exp_rbrace)) {
   14973             :       /* Closing right brace was found. */
   14974             :       cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();

   14976             :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();

   14978             :     if (namespace_scope_pushed) {

   14983             :            pushed on the ELF visibility stack.  Pop an entry now that the

   14991             :       pop_namespace_scope();

   14993             :     if (is_enclosing_namespace_specifier && !in_nested_namespace_decl &&

   14996             :          pragmas to the most-nested level of the namespace definition

   14998             :          should the pragma apply to the first, last, or all namespaces

   15001             :                                      (a_statement_ptr)NULL);

   15014             :   /* Record extended position information for the namespace or namespace
   15015             :      alias definition.  If this is a namespace extension definition or a

   15057             : 
   15058             : 
   15059             : static void using_directive(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   15060             :                             a_source_position   *using_pos)
   15061             : /*
   15062             : Scan a using directive.  Its syntax is:
   15063             : 
   15064             :   using namespace namespace-name
   15065             : 
   15066             : The caller has consumed the "using" token (whose position is given by
   15067             : using_pos): The current token is "namespace".  A using-directive entry is
   15068             : created and activated for the current scope.
   15069             : */
   15070             : {
   15071             :   a_symbol_ptr          sym;
   15072             :   a_boolean             err = FALSE;
   15073             :   an_attribute_ptr      attributes = dps->prefix_attributes;
   15074             : 
   15075             :   db_enter(3, "using_directive");
   15076             :   /* A using-directive is outside the "Embedded C++" subset. */
   15077             :   feature_is_not_part_of_embedded_cplusplus_subset(
   15078             :                                           &pos_curr_token,
   15079             :                                           ec_namespaces_in_embedded_cplusplus);
   15080             :   /* Bypass "namespace". */
   15081             :   (void)get_token();
   15082             :   add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   15083             :   if (!is_decl_qualified_name_start()) {
   15084             :     syntax_error(ec_exp_identifier);
   15085             :     /* Ignore pragma declarations. */
   15086             :     discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   15087             :   } else {
   15088             :     /* Scan the namespace name. */
   15089             :     sym = coalesce_and_lookup_generalized_identifier(GID_NO_OPTIONS,
   15090             :                                                      ilm_namespace, &err);
   15091             :     if (err) {
   15092             :       /* A diagnostic has already been issued. */
   15093             :     } else if (sym == NULL || sym->kind != (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace) {
   15094             :       pos_error(ec_missing_namespace_name, &error_position);
   15095             :       err = TRUE;
   15096             :     } else if (locator_for_curr_id.specific_symbol->kind ==
   15097             :                      (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace_projection &&
   15098             :                locator_for_curr_id.specific_symbol->ambiguous) {
   15099             :       /* Note: the lookup returns the projection symbol, if there is one,
   15100             :          in the locator, so that's what needed to be tested for ambiguity. */
   15101             :       sym_error(ec_ambiguous_name, locator_for_curr_id.specific_symbol);
   15102             :       err = TRUE;
   15103             :     }  /* if */
   15104             :     (void)get_token();
   15105             :     if (curr_token == tok_attribute) {
   15106             :       *f_last_attribute_link(&attributes) =
   15107             :                                         scan_gnu_attribute_groups(al_postfix);
   15108             :     }  /* if */
   15109             :     if (err) {
   15110             :       /* Ignore pragma declarations. */
   15111             :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
   15112             :     } else {
   15113             :       /* Pragmas cannot bind to a using declaration. */
   15114             :       cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
   15115             :       mark_referenced(sym, &locator_for_curr_id.source_position);
   15116             :       /* Allocate a using-directive entry specifying this namespace and
   15117             :          activate it. */
   15118             :       make_using_directive(sym->variant.namespace_info.ptr, depth_scope_stack,
   15119             :                            using_pos, /*compiler_generated=*/FALSE,
   15120             :                            /*inline_namespace=*/FALSE, attributes);
   15121             :     }  /* if */
   15122             :   }  /* if */
   15123             :   remove_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   15124             :   /* Check for final semicolon in the caller. */
   15125             :   db_exit();
   15126             : }  /* using_directive */
   15127             : 
   15128             : 
   15129        3632 : a_using_decl_ptr make_using_decl(a_symbol_ptr      sym,
   15130             :                                  a_source_position *pos,
   15131             :                                  a_scope_depth     scope_depth)
   15132             : /*
   15133             : Allocate a using-decl entry, set its fields based on sym, add it to the list
   15134             : for the current scope, and return a pointer to it.  This routine is used for
   15135             : class member using-declarations and nonmember using-declarations; similar
   15136             : processing is done for using-directives by make_using_directive.  scope_depth
   15137             : is the scope depth of the list on which the using-declaration should be
   15138             : placed.
   15139             : */
   15140             : {
   15141        3632 :   a_using_decl_ptr  udp;
   15142        3632 :   an_il_entry_kind  kind;
   15143        3632 :   char              *entity;
   15144             : 
   15145             :   /* Determine the IL entity and the entity-kind, based on the symbol. */
   15146        3632 :   entity = il_entry_for_symbol(sym, &kind);
   15147        3632 :   check_assertion_str(kind != (an_il_entry_kind)iek_none,
   15148        3632 :                       "make_using_decl: no IL entry for symbol");
   15149             :   /* Allocate a using-decl entry, and make it point to the IL entity. */
   15150        3632 :   udp = alloc_using_decl();
   15151        3632 :   udp->entity.kind = (a_byte_il_entry_kind)kind;
   15152        3632 :   udp->entity.ptr = entity;
   15153        3632 :   udp->position = *pos;
   15154             :   /* Attach it the list for the current scope. */
   15155        3632 :   add_to_using_decls_list(udp, scope_depth);
   15156             : 
   15157        3632 :   return udp;
   15158             : }  /* make_using_decl */
   15159             : 
   15160             : 
   15161        3287 : static void create_nonmember_using_declaration(
   15162             :                                        a_symbol_ptr     sym,
   15163             :                                        a_symbol_ptr     *overload_sym_ptr,
   15164             :                                        a_symbol_ptr     other_decl,
   15165             :                                        a_namespace_ptr  nsp,
   15166             :                                        a_type_ptr       class_type,
   15167             :                                        a_using_decl_ptr *prev_udp,
   15168             :                                        a_boolean        is_list,
   15169             :                                        a_boolean        suppress_redecl_error)
   15170             : /*
   15171             : Create a projection for symbol "sym" from namespace "nsp" (or, in
   15172             : Microsoft bugs mode, from the class "class_type").  If this is part of
   15173             : an overload set being imported, "is_list" will be TRUE and
   15174             : "*overload_sym_ptr" will point to the overload symbol.  Even when it
   15175             : is not part of an overload set, we may need to create such a set
   15176             : because existing declarations in the scope are being overloaded.
   15177             : "*prev_udp" is the previous using-declaration structure for the
   15178             : using-declaration construct that is currently being processed (NULL if
   15179             : none).
   15180             : */
   15181             : {
   15182        3287 :   a_symbol_locator   locator;
   15183        3287 :   a_symbol_ptr       new_sym;
   15184        3287 :   a_symbol_ptr       overload_sym = *overload_sym_ptr;
   15185        3287 :   a_symbol_ptr       fund_sym = fundamental_symbol_of(sym);
   15186        3287 :   a_source_position  decl_pos;
   15187             : 
   15188        3287 :   locator = locator_for_curr_id;
   15189        3287 :   clear_specific_symbol(locator);
   15190        3287 :   decl_pos = locator_for_curr_id.source_position;
   15191        3287 :   if (fund_sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_undefined) {
   15192             :     /* Undefined symbols have no IL entries, so don't create an
   15193             :       IL entry for this using-declaration. */
   15194             :   } else {
   15195             :     /* Create a using-decl entry to represent this declaration in

   15206             :     } else {

   15211             :     /* Set *prev_udp for a possible subsequent call to this function. */
   15212        3287 :     *prev_udp = udp;

   15214        3287 :   if (overload_sym == NULL) {
   15215             :     /* If we bring in a type that was declared previously, suppress a
   15216             :        redeclaration error.  This is similar to the case
   15217             :        "typedef struct S {} S;". */
   15218        2453 :     if (!suppress_redecl_error && other_decl != NULL &&
   15219           0 :         is_type_symbol(other_decl) && is_type_symbol(fund_sym)) {
   15220           0 :       a_type_ptr  type1 = type_symbol_type(other_decl),
   15221           0 :                   type2 = type_symbol_type(fund_sym);
   15222           0 :       suppress_redecl_error = identical_types(type1, type2);
   15223             :     }  /* if */
   15224             :     /* No overloading. */
   15225        2453 :     new_sym = enter_namespace_projection_symbol(fund_sym,
   15226             :                                                 /*is_using_decl=*/TRUE,
   15227             :                                                 &locator,
   15228             :                                                 depth_scope_stack,
   15229             :                                                 suppress_redecl_error);
   15230             :     /* If is_list is TRUE, there will be overloading on the next
   15231             :        iteration of this loop. */
   15232        2453 :     if (is_list) { *overload_sym_ptr = new_sym; }
   15233         834 :   } else if (already_in_lookup_set(overload_sym, sym,
   15234             :                                    /*merge_c_funcs=*/
   15235         834 :                                                 ((gpp_mode && !clang_mode) ||
   15236             :                                                  microsoft_mode),
   15237             :                                    IDL_NO_OPTIONS)) {
   15238             :     /* Don't try to add a symbol that is already pointed to by
   15239             :        overload_sym. */
   15240         270 :     goto done;
   15241         564 :   } else if (conflicts_with_previous_function_decl(
   15242             :                                          fund_sym, overload_sym, &decl_pos)) {
   15243             :     /* A function introduced by a using declaration cannot have the
   15244             :        same type as a function already declared in the scope
   15245             :        (WP 7.3.3 [namespace.udecl] paragraph 12).  The diagnostic
   15246             :        will have been issued by the subroutine; don't create a

   15248             :     /* In Microsoft mode, two distinct IL entries may have been created for

   15273             : 
   15274        2711 : static void import_any_hidden_tags(a_symbol_ptr      other_decl,
   15275             :                                    a_namespace_ptr   nsp,
   15276             :                                    a_using_decl_ptr  *prev_udp,
   15277             :                                    a_boolean         *redecl_error)
   15278             : /*
   15279             : A name that is imported by a using-declaration can refer to both tag names and
   15280             : non-tag names.  In those cases, ordinary namespace-qualified lookup will only
   15281             : find the non-tag, and this routine is used to also import the tag.  other_decl
   15282             : is a symbol representing a declaration already found in the current scope.
   15283             : nsp is the namespace from which to import the hidden tag.  *prev_udp is set to
   15284             : the using-declaration structure that is created (if any).  *redecl_error is
   15285             : TRUE if and only if a redeclaration error is issued.
   15286             : */
   15287             : {
   15288             :   /* Check if we missed a tag symbol; it should be imported too. */
   15289        2711 :   a_symbol_ptr      null_sym_ptr = NULL, tag_sym;
   15290        2711 :   a_symbol_locator  locator;
   15291             : 
   15292        2711 :   *redecl_error = FALSE;
   15293        2711 :   locator = locator_for_curr_id;
   15294        2711 :   clear_specific_symbol(locator);
   15295             :   /* Look for a tag symbol in the namespace referenced by the
   15296             :      using-declaration. */
   15297        2711 :   if (nsp == NULL) {
   15298        2127 :     tag_sym = file_scope_id_lookup(il_header.primary_scope,
   15299             :                                    &locator,
   15300             :                                    IDL_MUST_BE_TAG |
   15301             :                                    IDL_DIRECT_NAMESPACE_MEMBERS_ONLY);
   15302             :   } else {
   15303         584 :     tag_sym = namespace_qualified_id_lookup(
   15304             :                           &locator, nsp,
   15305             :                           IDL_MUST_BE_TAG | IDL_DIRECT_NAMESPACE_MEMBERS_ONLY);
   15306             :   }  /* if */
   15307             :   /* Tag lookups can sometimes return typedefs.  If we got a typedef back,
   15308             :      ignore it. */
   15309        2711 :   if (tag_sym != NULL && !is_tag_symbol(tag_sym)) tag_sym = NULL;
   15310        2328 :   if (tag_sym != NULL) {
   15311           0 :     a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
   15312           0 :     if (other_decl != NULL && !is_type_symbol(other_decl)) {
   15313             :       /* The current scope already contains a homonym for the imported tag,
   15314             :          but if it's a nontype, it won't conflict.  However, such a nontype

   15323           0 :         !(other_decl != NULL && is_file_or_namespace_scope(ssep) &&

   15341             : 
   15342             : 
   15343        2803 : static void nonmember_using_declaration(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   15344             : /*
   15345             : Scan a using_declaration in a nonclass scope.  Its syntax is:
   15346             : 
   15347             :   using qualified-name ;
   15348             : 
   15349             : The "using" token was consumed by the caller: The current token is (presumably)
   15350             : a qualified-name.
   15351             : A sk_namespace_projection is created and added to the symbol table for the
   15352             : current scope.
   15353             : */
   15354             : {
   15355        2803 :   a_symbol_ptr             sym, fund_sym, overload_sym, other_decl,
   15356             :                              fund_other_decl;
   15357        2803 :   a_boolean                err = FALSE;
   15358        2803 :   a_symbol_locator         locator;
   15359        2803 :   a_boolean                check_for_packs = FALSE, any_more = TRUE;
   15360        2803 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
   15361        2803 :   a_pack_expansion_stack_entry_ptr
   15362             :                            pesep;
   15363        2803 :   a_using_decl_ptr         prev_udp = NULL;
   15364             : 
   15365        2803 :   db_enter(3, "nonmember_using_declaration");
   15366             :   /* A using declaration is outside the "Embedded C++" subset. */
   15367        2803 :   feature_is_not_part_of_embedded_cplusplus_subset(
   15368             :                                           &dps->start_pos,
   15369        2803 :                                           ec_using_decl_in_embedded_cplusplus);

   15371        2803 :   if (variadic_using_decls_enabled) {
   15372           0 :     any_more = begin_potential_pack_expansion_context(&pesep);
   15373           0 :     check_for_packs = TRUE;
   15374           0 :     add_stop_token(tok_comma);
   15375             :   }  /* if */
   15376        2803 :   while (!check_for_packs || any_more) {
   15377        2803 :     a_pack_expansion_descr_ptr  pedep;
   15378        2803 :     if (!is_decl_qualified_name_start() && curr_token != tok_typename) {
   15379           0 :       syntax_error(ec_exp_identifier);
   15380             :       /* Ignore pragma declarations. */
   15381           0 :       discard_curr_construct_pragmas();

   15383           0 :         abandon_potential_pack_expansion_context(pesep);

   15577        2803 :       (void)get_token();
   15578             :     }  /* if */
   15579        2803 :     if (!check_for_packs) break;
   15580           0 :     pedep = end_potential_pack_expansion_context(pesep,
   15581             :                                                  /*is_declarator=*/FALSE);
   15582           0 :     if (pedep != NULL && prev_udp != NULL) {
   15583           0 :       prev_udp->is_pack_expansion = TRUE;
   15584             :     }  /* if */
   15585           0 :     any_more = advance_to_next_pack_element(pesep);
   15586           0 :     if (!any_more) {
   15587             :       /* Check for an explicit comma, indicating more using-declarators were
   15588             :          specified. */
   15589           0 :       if (loop_token(tok_comma)) {
   15590           0 :         any_more = begin_potential_pack_expansion_context(&pesep);
   15591             :       }  /* if */
   15592             :     }  /* if */
   15593             :   }  /* while */
   15594        2803 :   if (check_for_packs) {
   15595           0 :     remove_stop_token(tok_comma);

   15599        2803 :   db_exit();

   15601             : 
   15602             : 
   15603             : #if !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15604             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* p_end_of_using_pos is not used in some configurations. */
   15605             : #endif /* !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15606        1535 : void alias_declaration(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
   15607             :                        a_source_position   *p_end_of_using_pos)
   15608             : /*
   15609             : Handle a declaration of the form:
   15610             : 
   15611             :         using <identifier> = <type-id> ;
   15612             : 
   15613             : which is essentially equivalent to a typedef.
   15614             : 
   15615             : The caller has consumed the "using" token: The <identifier> is the current
   15616             : token.  The caller is also responsible for checking and consuming the final
   15617             : semicolon.
   15618             : 
   15619             : *dps describes the declaration (which can be a class member or not).
   15620             : *p_end_of_using_pos is the end position of the "using" token.
   15621             : */
   15622             : {
   15623        1535 :   a_symbol_locator  loc;
   15624        1535 :   a_decl_pos_block  decl_pos_block;
   15625             : 
   15626        1535 :   report_gnu_cpp11_extension_if_needed(&pos_curr_token,
   15627        1535 :                                        ec_alias_declaration_is_cpp11);
   15628        1535 :   clear_decl_pos_block(&decl_pos_block);
   15629        1535 :   add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   15630        1535 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_identifier);
   15631        1535 :   decl_pos_block.decl_pos = pos_curr_token;
   15632             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15633        1535 :   decl_pos_block.specifiers_range.start = dps->start_pos;
   15634        1535 :   decl_pos_block.specifiers_range.end = *p_end_of_using_pos;
   15635        1535 :   decl_pos_block.identifier_range.start = pos_curr_token;
   15636        1535 :   decl_pos_block.identifier_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   15637        1535 :   decl_pos_block.declarator_range.start = pos_curr_token;
   15638        1535 :   decl_pos_block.declarator_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
   15639             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15640        1535 :   loc = locator_for_curr_id;
   15641        1535 :   if (loc.is_qualified_name || loc.is_operator_name ||
   15642             :       loc.is_udl_operator_name) {
   15643           0 :     pos_error(loc.is_qualified_name ? ec_qualified_name_not_allowed
   15644             :                                     : ec_operator_name_not_allowed,
   15645             :               &pos_curr_token);
   15646           0 :     set_to_error_locator(loc);
   15647             :   }  /* if */
   15648        1535 :   (void)get_token();
   15649             :   /* Although the alias name is not technically a "declarator-id", it has
   15650             :      exactly the same function and relation to any subsequent attributes.
   15651             :      We therefore record the attributes with al_declarator_id. */
   15652        1535 :   dps->id_attributes = scan_attributes(al_declarator_id);

   15655           0 :     decl_pos_block.declarator_range.end = curr_construct_end_position;
   15656             :   }  /* if */
   15657             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15658        1535 :   dps->auto_type_allowed = FALSE;
   15659        1535 :   dps->is_alias = TRUE;
   15660        1535 :   if (required_token(tok_assign, ec_exp_assign)) {
   15661        1535 :     a_type_ptr  parent_type = NULL;
   15662        1535 :     if (dps->in_class_scope) {
   15663        1322 :       check_assertion(scope_stack_top().kind ==
   15664             :                                         (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union);
   15665        1322 :       parent_type = scope_stack_top().assoc_type;
   15666             :     }  /* if */
   15667        1535 :     type_name_full(dps);
   15668             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   15669             :     /* It is tempting to emit the source sequence entry for the alias
   15670             :        declaration when the name of the alias is first encountered (above),
   15671             :        since that name has some similarity to a declarator.  However, doing so
   15672             :        could create complications if type_name_full parses a non-autonomous
   15673             :        tag declaration: Such a declaration may have to be promoted to become
   15674             :        autonomous later on, and that promotion process requires that the
   15675             :        source sequence entry for the top-level declaration follows the entry
   15676             :        for the non-autonomous tag declaration. */
   15677        1535 :     dps->source_sequence_entry = add_empty_source_sequence_entry();
   15678             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15679        1535 :     decl_typedef(&loc, dps, parent_type, &decl_pos_block);
   15680        1535 :     if (dps->sym != NULL && dps->sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_type) {

   15694           0 :                        a_src_seq_secondary_decl_ptr)->is_alias = TRUE;
   15695             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15696             :         }  /* if */
   15697             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL

   15723     1184100 : static a_boolean check_for_missing_declarator(a_decl_parse_state  *state)
   15724             : /*
   15725             : The decl-specifiers have been scanned.  Check for the case in which a
   15726             : declarator is missing, in which case return TRUE after issuing appropriate
   15727             : diagnostics.  (It is not always an error -- for example, an "autonomous"
   15728             : class definition like "struct S { int i; };".)
   15729             : 
   15730             : state describes the declaration parsed so far.
   15731             : */
   15732             : {
   15733     1184100 :   a_decl_flag_set    dso_flags = state->dso_flags;
   15734     1184100 :   a_boolean          declarator_omitted = FALSE;
   15735     1184100 :   a_boolean          declares_something;
   15736     1184100 :   a_boolean          defines_something;
   15737     1184100 :   a_boolean          inline_specified = ((dso_flags & DSO_INLINE) != 0);
   15738     1184100 :   an_error_severity  severity;
   15739     1184100 :   a_type_ptr         type_ptr = state->specifiers_type;
   15740     1184100 :   a_type_ptr         tp = skip_typerefs(type_ptr);
   15741             : 
   15742     1184100 :   declares_something = ((dso_flags & DSO_DECLARES_SOMETHING) != 0);
   15743     1184100 :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
   15744        3853 :     defines_something = ((dso_flags & DSO_DEFINES_SOMETHING) != 0);
   15745        3853 :     declarator_omitted = TRUE;
   15746        3853 :     if (state->decl_specifiers_error) {
   15747             :       /* Don't issue further errors on this declaration. */
   15748        3853 :     } else if (state->is_old_style_param_decl &&
   15749             :                (declares_something || defines_something)) {

   15751             :          within an old-style parameter list.  pcc, on the other hand,
   15752             :          will allow something like

   15961     1205330 : static void remove_all_local_stop_tokens(a_decl_parse_state  *state)
   15962             : /*
   15963             : Remove stop tokens as suggested by *state (and clear the associated flags).
   15964             : */
   15965             : {
   15966     1205330 :   if (state->need_semicolon_remove_stop_token) {
   15967     1184110 :     remove_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
   15968     1184110 :     state->need_semicolon_remove_stop_token = FALSE;
   15969             :   }  /* if */
   15970     1205330 :   if (state->need_comma_remove_stop_token) {
   15971        3210 :     remove_stop_token(tok_comma);
   15972        3210 :     state->need_comma_remove_stop_token = FALSE;
   15973             :   }  /* if */
   15974     1205330 :   if (state->need_assign_remove_stop_token) {
   15975           0 :     remove_stop_token(tok_assign);

   15985         209 : void check_main_function(a_func_info_block_ptr  func_info,
   15986             :                          a_type_ptr             type,
   15987             :                          a_decl_parse_state     *dps,
   15988             :                          a_boolean              *is_inline,
   15989             :                          a_source_position_ptr  pos)
   15990             : /*
   15991             : Check some constraints on the main() function whose declaration is described
   15992             : by func_info, type, and dps.  If "*is_inline" is TRUE, the function was
   15993             : declared "inline" (or was defined as an in-class friend).  Any diagnostics are
   15994             : issued at the given position.

   16000         209 :                                         integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);

   16005             :     /* main must return "int" (3.6.1). */

   16007             :                      strict_ansi_discretionary_severity : es_warning,

   16012             :        cannot be deleted and cannot be inline. */

   16017           0 :       pos_error(ec_inline_main, pos);

   16339           0 :           tp = type_pointed_to(tp);

   16388           0 : static void diagnose_initializer_on_function(a_boolean          paren_form,
   16389             :                                              a_symbol_ptr       sym,
   16390             :                                              a_source_position  *init_pos)
   16391             : /*
   16392             : Report what seems to be an attempt to specify an initializer (at the given
   16393             : position) on the declaration of a function described by sym.  If the
   16394             : initializer started with an assignment token ("="), it is natural to issue
   16395             : the diagnostic in terms of an invalid initialization.  If a parenthesized
   16396             : initializer was found paren_form will be TRUE: That is more likely a
   16397             : consequence of an error in declarator syntax than an actual attempt to
   16398             : initialize a function.  In such cases, we issue the diagnostic in terms of
   16399             : the encountered token and do not attempt to fully parse an initializer.
   16400             : */
   16401             : {
   16402           0 :   if (paren_form) {
   16403             :     /* The parenthesis was already consumed during parsing of the declarator,

   16418          52 : a_boolean deleted_or_defaulted_def_next(a_boolean  *defaulted)
   16419             : /*
   16420             : Return TRUE if the next two tokens correspond to an "= delete" or "= default"
   16421             : function definition (if the associated language feature is enabled).  Set
   16422             : *defaulted to TRUE in the "= default" case, and to FALSE otherwise.  This
   16423             : routine also works in Microsoft modes that do not have a keyword "default".

   16427             :

   16498     1128740 : static an_end_of_decl_action function_declaration(
   16499             :                                           a_decl_parse_state  *state,
   16500             :                                           a_func_info_block   *func_info,
   16501             :                                           a_symbol_locator    *locator,
   16502             :                                           a_decl_pos_block    *decl_pos_block,
   16503             :                                           a_token_kind        *final_token)
   16504             : /*
   16505             : Process a function declaration not directly appearing in a class scope (i.e.,
   16506             : ordinary namespace scope declarations, local variable declarations, block-
   16507             : extern declarations, and out-of- class definitions of member functions).  The
   16508             : declaration is described by state, func_info, locator, and decl_pos_block.
   16509             : *final_token (which should be set to tok_semicolon by the caller) may be set
   16510             : to tok_rbrace in a function definition is encountered.  This function is
   16511             : called from "declaration" and its return value indicates how processing should
   16512             : proceed after the call.
   16513             : */
   16514             : {
   16515     1128740 :   an_end_of_decl_action

   16802             :        mode.  The function will be entered at the file scope as static.  
   16803             :        GCC 3.3.x and earlier ignore the "static", GCC 3.4.x behaves like our
   16804             :        default mode, and GCC 4.x disallows "static" in this context.
   16805             :        Do not allow at all in C++ mode. */
   16806           0 :     if (state->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
   16807           0 :       an_error_severity  severity;

   16810             :            ANSI C mode. */

   16813           0 :           if (gnu_version < 30400) {
   16814           0 :             state->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
   16815           0 :           } else if (gnu_version >= 40000) {
   16816             :             severity = es_discretionary_error;
   16817             :           }  /* if */
   16818             :         }  /* if */

   16829             :     }  /* if */

   16893        9054 : void add_src_seq_end_of_variable_if_needed(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
   16894             : /*
   16895             : A variable declaration has been processed.  If that declaration triggered the
   16896             : creation of source sequence entries for constructs it embeds in its declarator
   16897             : or initializer, insert an end-of-construct source sequence entry.  This allows
   16898             : source sequence entries associated with a declarator or initializer to be
   16899             : distinguished from those that follow the initializer.  For example:
   16900             :     void *p = (union { char c; int x; }*) 0;  // Accepted in g++ mode.
   16901             :       // The source sequence entries for the anonymous union will be
   16902             :       // separated from those of S by an end-of-construct entry.
   16903             :     struct S {} s;

   16905             : function parameter declaration: This routine does nothing in that case.
   16906             : */

   16917           1 :       vp = dps->sym->variant.variable.ptr;

   16970          78 : void f_record_strongest_alignment_attr(a_decl_parse_state      *dps,
   16971             :                                        an_il_entry_kind        kind,
   16972             :                                        a_source_correspondence *scp,
   16973             :                                        a_boolean               is_defined,
   16974             :                                        a_boolean               is_definition)
   16975             : 
   16976             : /*
   16977             : If applicable, record the explicit alignment specified by the strongest
   16978             : alignment attribute on the declaration described by *dps in the corresponding
   16979             : entity as specified by kind and scp.  is_defined is TRUE if the entity has
   16980             : already been defined previously; is_definition is TRUE if the current
   16981             : declaration is a definition.  Issue an error if this alignment is invalid
   16982             : (e.g., inconsistent with previous declarations).  If no attribute was
   16983             : specified and is_definition is TRUE, issue an error if prior declarations
   16984             : specified an alignment attribute.  Should be called via
   16985             : record_strongest_alignment_attr.  Note that the attributes that are applied
   16986             : here are typically "standard" attributes, but they can also be GNU-specific
   16987             : attributes in later GNU modes that apply to fields or variables (i.e., in
   16988             : cases where the strongest attribute applies).
   16989             : 
   16990             : Note that this must be called at the end of a declaration/definition for
   16991             : any entity on which a standard alignment attribute may have been specified
   16992             : (to detect cases like: "struct alignas(8) A; struct A {};").
   16993             : */
   16994             : {
   16995          78 :   a_type_ptr        tp = NULL;
   16996          78 :   a_targ_alignment  *entity_alignment = NULL, type_alignment = 0;
   16997          78 :   a_boolean         has_alignment = FALSE;
   16998             : 
   16999          78 :   check_assertion(scp->attributes != NULL);
   17000          78 :   if (kind == iek_variable) {
   17001           3 :     a_variable_ptr vp = (a_variable_ptr)scp;
   17002           3 :     entity_alignment = &vp->alignment;
   17003           3 :     type_alignment = alignment_of_type(vp->type);

   17006          37 :     tp = (a_type_ptr)scp;

   17008          37 :       entity_alignment = &tp->alignment;
   17009          37 :       type_alignment = alignment_of_type(tp);
   17010          37 :       has_alignment = tp->alignment_set_explicitly;
   17011             :     }  /* if */
   17012          38 :   } else if (kind == iek_field) {
   17013          38 :     a_field_ptr fp = (a_field_ptr)scp;
   17014          38 :     entity_alignment = &fp->alignment;

   17177           0 : static a_boolean is_tuple_like_type(a_type_ptr     tp,
   17178             :                                     a_targ_size_t  *n_elements,
   17179             :                                     a_boolean      *p_err)
   17180             : /*
   17181             : If the given type is a tuple-like type, return TRUE and set n_elements to the
   17182             : number of elements in the tuple.  Set *p_err to TRUE if n_elements cannot be
   17183             : determined (and return FALSE in that case).  A type T is tuple-like if the
   17184             : expression "std::tuple_size<T>::value" is a valid integral constant expression.
   17185             : The value of that expression is the number of elements in the tuple.
   17186             : */
   17187             : {
   17188           0 :   a_boolean           result = FALSE, err = FALSE;
   17189           0 :   a_symbol_ptr        ts_sym, ts_inst_sym, value_sym;
   17190           0 :   a_type_ptr          ts_inst;
   17191           0 :   a_template_arg_ptr  tap;
   17192           0 :   a_constant_ptr      cp;
   17193           0 :   a_boolean           overflow;
   17194             : 
   17195           0 :   ts_sym = look_up_class_template_in_std("tuple_size");
   17196           0 :   if (ts_sym == NULL) goto done;
   17197             :   /* Instantiate tuple_size<T> for T = tp. */
   17198           0 :   tap = alloc_template_arg((a_templ_arg_kind)tak_type);
   17199           0 :   tap->variant.type = tp;
   17200           0 :   ts_inst_sym = find_class_template_instance(ts_sym, &tap);
   17201           0 :   if (ts_inst_sym == NULL ||
   17202           0 :       !symbol_is(ts_inst_sym, sk_class_or_struct_tag)) {
   17203           0 :     goto done;
   17204             :   }  /* if */
   17205           0 :   ts_inst = type_symbol_type(ts_inst_sym);
   17206           0 :   complete_type_is_needed(ts_inst);
   17207           0 :   if (ts_inst->incomplete) goto done;
   17208             :   /* Look up "tuple_size<T>::value".  If it is an enumerator constant or a
   17209             :      constant-valued variable (static data member), it may hold a valid
   17210             :      size value. */
   17211           0 :   value_sym = look_up_name_string_in_class("value", ts_inst, IDL_NO_OPTIONS);
   17212           0 :   if (value_sym == NULL) {
   17213             :     cp = NULL;

   17242             : 
   17243           0 : static a_type_ptr tuple_like_binding_type(a_variable_ptr     container,
   17244             :                                           a_type_ptr         tp,
   17245             :                                           a_targ_size_t      elem_idx,
   17246             :                                           a_source_position  *diag_pos,
   17247             :                                           an_init_component  **p_icp)
   17248             : /*
   17249             : Return the type of a binding variable for a tuple-like container.  tp
   17250             : represents the container type E (from the container e represented by container)
   17251             : and elem_idx is the element number n (starting at zero) being bound to.  The
   17252             : returned type entry is an lvalue or rvalue reference to
   17253             : std::tuple_element<n, E>::type.  It is an lvalue reference if the initializer
   17254             : for the binding is an lvalue; otherwise, it is an rvalue reference.
   17255             : 
   17256             : The initializer for the binding is returned in *p_icp.  If E is a class type
   17257             : with a member "get", that initializer is "e.get<n>()"; otherwise, it is
   17258             : "get<n>(e)" where get is looked up using argument-dependent lookup only.
   17259             : */
   17260             : {
   17261           0 :   a_type_ptr             e_type, te_inst;
   17262           0 :   a_symbol_ptr           te_sym, te_inst_sym, e_type_sym;
   17263           0 :   a_template_arg_ptr     tap;
   17264           0 :   a_constant_ptr         n_constant;
   17265           0 :   a_boolean              lvalue_binding;
   17266             : 
   17267           0 :   te_sym = look_up_class_template_in_std("tuple_element");
   17268           0 :   if (te_sym == NULL) {
   17269           0 :     pos_error(ec_missing_std_tuple_element, diag_pos);
   17270           0 :     e_type = error_type();
   17271           0 :     goto done;
   17272             :   }  /* if */
   17273             :   /* Instantiate tuple_element<n, T> for n = elem_idx and T = tp. */
   17274           0 :   tap = alloc_template_arg((a_templ_arg_kind)tak_nontype);
   17275           0 :   n_constant = local_constant();
   17276           0 :   set_integer_constant(n_constant, (a_host_large_integer)elem_idx,
   17277             :                        targ_size_t_int_kind);

   17279           0 :   release_local_constant(&n_constant);
   17280           0 :   tap->next = alloc_template_arg((a_templ_arg_kind)tak_type);
   17281           0 :   tap->next->variant.type = tp;
   17282           0 :   te_inst_sym = find_class_template_instance(te_sym, &tap);
   17283           0 :   if (te_inst_sym == NULL ||
   17284           0 :       !symbol_is(te_inst_sym, sk_class_or_struct_tag)) {
   17285           0 :     char  num_str[100];
   17286           0 :     (void)sprintf(num_str, "%lu", (unsigned long)elem_idx);
   17287           0 :     pos_stty_error(ec_missing_std_tuple_element_instance, diag_pos, num_str,
   17288             :                    tp);
   17289           0 :     e_type = error_type();
   17290           0 :     goto done;
   17291             :   }  /* if */

   17298             :                    tp);
   17299           0 :     e_type = error_type();
   17300           0 :     goto done;
   17301             :   }  /* if */
   17302             :   /* Look up "tuple_element<n, T>::type" and make sure it produces a type. */

   17306           0 :     e_type = error_type();
